674383431.name: Charming
674383431.author: a TripAdvisor user
674383431.reviewBody: Absolutely a must if you have time to go 2ookm outside of Mexico City. Beautiful colonial buildings, well preserved and clean. Step inside the buildings and you will be surprised by the beautiful patios with fountains or trees and birds offering you freshness and calm.

itemReviewed.name: Historic Center of Santiago de Queretaro

673505869.name: Beautiful and alive
673505869.author: a TripAdvisor user
673505869.reviewBody: The city is so beautiful and alive. You can be easily impressed by the buildings around,  but the Latin spirit and good food, by the events, people,  the way they are cutting the trees. We saw such a beautiful and unexpected photographic exibition at some image centre : photos made after famous paintings.

itemReviewed.name: Historic Center of Santiago de Queretaro

669040301.name: A very good experience
669040301.author: a TripAdvisor user
669040301.reviewBody: This was the 2nd time we visited the historic centro of Queretaro.  It is a beautiful place to walk from plaza to plaza and to enjoy the shops and tiangis and restaurants.  We\'ll be back soon.

itemReviewed.name: Historic Center of Santiago de Queretaro

666153046.name: Go with a guide
666153046.author: a TripAdvisor user
666153046.reviewBody: Our group stopped here for several hours, and we were very impressed.  Clean, quiet, historic.  Lots of interesting shops and restaurants.  Very charming colonial city.  Best to have a guide explain all the history and show you the hidden spots.

itemReviewed.name: Historic Center of Santiago de Queretaro

661739489.name: Casa de la Cooregidora is a must.
661739489.author: a TripAdvisor user
661739489.reviewBody: There many attractions in the city center area and we highly recommend finding a local tour guide that can take you on a one or two hour walking tour.  A must visit is the house of Dona Josefa Ortiz de Dominguez a Mexican Independence Heroine.  The main attraction includes three large paintings by Victor Rojas (a local artist) depicting three Mexican Revolutions: 1820, 1858, and 1910.  They are a great history lesson in better understanding the Mexican struggle for independence.  After spending some time looking at the paintings we hired a local guide to really explain what had taken place Queretaro and the surrounding areas.

itemReviewed.name: Historic Center of Santiago de Queretaro

657924022.name: Utterly charming!
657924022.author: a TripAdvisor user
657924022.reviewBody: The historic center is utterly charming and very walkable.     Mostly flat.    Quaint buildings, lots of squares and plazas,  easy to navigate.     Many, many restaurants, shops, and street vendors.    Most of the main sites are within a couple blocks of the Plaza de Independencia (formerly Plaza de Armas) although the Roman Aquaducts are pretty much all to themselves quite a bit to the east.    There is a very easy to follow map in the Queretaro brochure with all the main sites shown.

itemReviewed.name: Historic Center of Santiago de Queretaro

657892565.name: Love this Colonial city-not your average tourist destination
657892565.author: a TripAdvisor user
657892565.reviewBody: Mexico is not all beach front and mega all-inclusive resorts.  The first time I went to one of the colonial cities I thought that the tourism minister for Mexico should be replaced!  Who Knew??  Fabulous, walkable areas with architecture, plazas, restaurants and more!

itemReviewed.name: Historic Center of Santiago de Queretaro

657484269.name: An absolute beauty
657484269.author: a TripAdvisor user
657484269.reviewBody:
First of all, the town is as safe as it can be. The biggest danger for pale-skinned visitors such as us from Europe is the sun. Use protection factor of 50, get yourself a hat, stick in the shade, and you'll be fine. 

People are very friendly and, in fact, lovable. The historic center is stunning. You should see to spend at least a few days there, should you want to experience it the right way. 

When I started my journey, I was stuffed with prejudice towards Mexico that are usually served to us all through the media. After the first few minutes in Queretaro I was absolutely blown away. Luckily, I had wonderful hosts taking good care of me, and they only made it more simple and enjoyable to me. Yet, most of the time I was on my own  roaming the streets at any time of day or evening. I felt absolutely safe, and had no problems, at all. It was a pure joy. 

Maybe I should mention that the prices there are pretty low, comparred to what we are used to here in my hometown, or in Europe. 

I will definitely go there again. This is one of those places that captures your heart. Especially the people you meet.

<3

itemReviewed.name: Historic Center of Santiago de Queretaro

655263962.name: Great Day Trip
655263962.author: a TripAdvisor user
655263962.reviewBody: We spent the whole day in the histrionic center and seeing all the sights.  The buildings where amazing, lots of shops and street vendors, tons of restaurants, gorgeous churches.    Very quaint and lovely - beautiful!!

itemReviewed.name: Historic Center of Santiago de Queretaro

653729347.name: Great vibrant city
653729347.author: a TripAdvisor user
653729347.reviewBody: Everything I thought San Miguel de Allende would be, great architecture, wonderful restaurants, beautiful plazas and friendly people. Also felt very safe and welcoming. Nice shops as well

itemReviewed.name: Historic Center of Santiago de Queretaro

670941914.name: Beautiful church in a very nice square
670941914.author: a TripAdvisor user
670941914.reviewBody: This is a beautiful decorated church situated in a nice square, a bit apart from the centre, where are plenty of people. The city is full with amazing churches and nice areas.

itemReviewed.name: Iglesia de Santa Rosa de Viterbo

address.streetAddress: Ezequiel Montes esq. Arteaga

657924784.name: Beautiful 18th century church
657924784.author: a TripAdvisor user
657924784.reviewBody: At the Western part of the historical center.    Across the street is the very nice Plaza Mariano de las Casas.   Church is in the baroque style with lots of interior guilding and marble along with pagoda-like bell tower.    Actually, the most unusual thing about this church was not the earliest 4 sided clock in the New World but the curling buttresses on the front of the building, the likes of which I have never seen.

itemReviewed.name: Iglesia de Santa Rosa de Viterbo

address.streetAddress: Ezequiel Montes esq. Arteaga

655296962.name: Beautiful church
655296962.author: a TripAdvisor user
655296962.reviewBody: This is a beautiful church all be it very ornate - almost too much.  A service was going on so we didn\u2019t want to walk in and could take a tour - but saw it from outside and looking in.

itemReviewed.name: Iglesia de Santa Rosa de Viterbo

address.streetAddress: Ezequiel Montes esq. Arteaga

653729907.name: Overwrought, but in a good way
653729907.author: a TripAdvisor user
653729907.reviewBody: This church has these wonderful columns outside and is totally filled with gold decorations on the inside. Pretty overwhelming and definitely worth a visit. Pretty plaza outside with the Queretaro sign in it

itemReviewed.name: Iglesia de Santa Rosa de Viterbo

address.streetAddress: Ezequiel Montes esq. Arteaga

589613118.name: Beautiful
589613118.author: a TripAdvisor user
589613118.reviewBody: Awesome church. It has a museum next to it. Very close to down town. We took a tour and this church was one of the places. Very unique and beautiful.

itemReviewed.name: Iglesia de Santa Rosa de Viterbo

address.streetAddress: Ezequiel Montes esq. Arteaga

578707352.name: Get a guided tour
578707352.author: a TripAdvisor user
578707352.reviewBody: Besides religion, this place is an art masterpiece. Maybe you are not big fan of the Barroque, but if you have some interest on art it will an amazing experience.

itemReviewed.name: Iglesia de Santa Rosa de Viterbo

address.streetAddress: Ezequiel Montes esq. Arteaga

566746832.name: A Contrarian View
566746832.author: a TripAdvisor user
566746832.reviewBody: I find it amazing that this place rates the number one attraction in Queretaro, but I am old and out of it.  The inside is certainly striking and eye-catching in accordance to these busy and fast-paced time.  I prefer simple, elegant and graceful lines, not fake gilt coming from every nook, cranny and angle.  To each his own.

itemReviewed.name: Iglesia de Santa Rosa de Viterbo

address.streetAddress: Ezequiel Montes esq. Arteaga

564153771.name: My favorite church in Quer\u00e9taro
564153771.author: a TripAdvisor user
564153771.reviewBody: Even those not too interested in Mexican baroque architecture should visit this church as well as its convent. It\'s a short walk west of the main plazas, and be prepared to be approached by individuals trying to take advantage of tourists (e.g., speaking English and offering something or other. Dismiss them and give a few pesos to someone truly needy).

itemReviewed.name: Iglesia de Santa Rosa de Viterbo

address.streetAddress: Ezequiel Montes esq. Arteaga

560576194.name: Amazing
560576194.author: a TripAdvisor user
560576194.reviewBody: I visited on a day with light rain and had lunch at a Cafe Cronos across the plaza from this church where I could admire it from the outside. Unique baroque architecture. The interior is beautiful but the exterior is stunning. The plaza is very nice as well.

itemReviewed.name: Iglesia de Santa Rosa de Viterbo

address.streetAddress: Ezequiel Montes esq. Arteaga

553259132.name: If you don\u00b4t have time for several churches, see this one!
553259132.author: a TripAdvisor user
553259132.reviewBody: From the outside, it\u00b4s intriguing, with a mixture of styles,(baroque, neoclassical, mudejar) buttresses in one side and a lateral gate. But you\u00b4ll be surprised with the inside. It has many altarpieces and reredos, all covered in  golden leaf on both sides and in the back, but the main altar was replaced with a Neoclassical one, probably after a fire or earthquake. Take the time so observe each of the altars, so full with details.

itemReviewed.name: Iglesia de Santa Rosa de Viterbo

address.streetAddress: Ezequiel Montes esq. Arteaga

674574748.name: Amazing views!
674574748.author: a TripAdvisor user
674574748.reviewBody: A romantic place that offers great views (if you visit the lookout). You cant really admire it from the ground. You have to get to the park next to the  church. Will definitely come again.

673314327.name: Such a beautiful view
673314327.author: a TripAdvisor user
673314327.reviewBody: The aqueducts, that are so well preserved, creates such a beautiful view from the little church from the top named Mirador.

669040596.name: A great first experience
669040596.author: a TripAdvisor user
669040596.reviewBody: This was our first time to see the acueducts of Queretaro.  Our driver took us by the acueducts on our way to the historic centro.  Very impressive, awesome and a great piece of history.  Well preserved.

666153324.name: Who knew
666153324.author: a TripAdvisor user
666153324.reviewBody: Such a well preserved aquaduct right in the city.  Definitely take time to check it out and take some photos.

662264278.name: A testament to the force of unrequited love
662264278.author: a TripAdvisor user
662264278.reviewBody:
Once the central piece of Queretaro, it has been swallowed up by the ever-growing city.  Its grandeur now dwarfed by all the structures surrounding it.  Amazing that it is still in working condition at nearly 300 years of age!  It still feeds the various old water fountains of Queretaro.  It is very well maintained.  

Only walking the entire length (1.28 km) of it gives you a feel for it true size.  All 74 arches, some up to 20 meters wide with an average height of 23 meters... A train can drive through each arch (old archive pictures prove that)...  Best seen at night, all lit up against a more muted background.

Backed by a legend of unrequited love for a nun, it is indeed a testament to the force of love.  

For ‘birds’ eye’ view, see it from the viewing area near the Panteon de Los Queretanos Ilustres above the EJ. Republicano road. I especially like the mixture of red and grey rocks against the white mortar.  Still a must see even if lost in the hustle-bustle of the city.

660754141.name: Main monument of the City
660754141.author: a TripAdvisor user
660754141.reviewBody: You can pass the acuaducte since you are in the City. And its visible from the poins of views of the city, having a good story behind to tell

658769350.name: Fabulous Historical Site
658769350.author: a TripAdvisor user
658769350.reviewBody: Everyone needs to visit Queretaro, if only to stand anywhere under the incredible aquaduct structure and think about the engineering beauty of construction!\u00a1\nIt is a "must see" for visiting at night.\nI marvel at our aquaduct every day.

657925910.name: Beautifully preserved
657925910.author: a TripAdvisor user
657925910.reviewBody: The aquaducts are at the far east end of the historical district.   You should combine this with a visit to the Convento de la Santa Cruz which is also on the eastern side.    There is a great viewpoint slightly to the northwest to look out towards the 1.28 km aquaducts running directly above Avenida Zaragoza with its 74 arches.   You can also look east towards the hills and the more modern areas of Queretaro.     There is a plaque commemorating this as a Unesco site.

657895868.name: Like something you would think about seeing in Europe!
657895868.author: a TripAdvisor user
657895868.reviewBody: Really something to see in this beautiful colonial city.  A UNESCO site, it is easily visible by driving under it (or through the arches) or an easy walk to see an overview a few blocks from this historical center.

655726600.name: One Km long
655726600.author: a TripAdvisor user
655726600.reviewBody: It\u2019s interesting that an engineer could design something of this magnitude and not only did it serve its purpose, when the water dried up, the arches have withstood the test of time and still look beautiful. Lighting at night was disappointing. No colours.

655263477.name: Must see!
655263477.author: a TripAdvisor user
655263477.reviewBody: If you are in Querataro or near it you have to at least look at and see the Acudeucto and here the story behind it and the history around it.

655168896.name: Great
655168896.author: a TripAdvisor user
655168896.reviewBody: It looks like a roman aqueduct that streches across this big city. Simply amazing. There\'s a ton of other things to see and to do in Queretaro, as well.

655053583.name: Amazing structure
655053583.author: a TripAdvisor user
655053583.reviewBody: When you think about how this huge structure was built and once active it\u2019s amazing !! It runs parallel with a busy street    but still able to get up close and see it and get photos !

653265599.name: Beautiful view
653265599.author: a TripAdvisor user
653265599.reviewBody: Recommend enjoying a cup of coffee at Starbucks right along the Aquaduct and sitting on the upper deck for a selfie!

651907787.name: Covers a lot of ground!
651907787.author: a TripAdvisor user
651907787.reviewBody: Really, quite an engineering marvel.  Runs parallel to a busy road so we were able to see it from the car.  I like aquaducts so this was nice to come across this one but I don\'t think I\'d make a special effort to see it because of the location.  It\'s in a busy area.

651786665.name: Interesting history
651786665.author: a TripAdvisor user
651786665.reviewBody: El Acueducto brings a historical perspective to your visit. Most cities and towns in Mexico have a history that might not be so obvious.

650790359.name: Put it in the GPS and drive next to it
650790359.author: a TripAdvisor user
650790359.reviewBody: It\'s pretty huge and a main road runs parallel to it, under it around it. Best way to see it, driving.

649964740.name: Nice aqueduct
649964740.author: a TripAdvisor user
649964740.reviewBody: This architectural work goes from outside town all the way to the city center. You can pass by on your way to downtown. Not worth to go all the way to see it.

645227991.name: It\'s There
645227991.author: a TripAdvisor user
645227991.reviewBody: The aqueduct is not in the historic center of Queretaro as we assumed but a little way off by car. It is there and it was an aqueduct, but it doesn\'t appear to be in use. We found no place anywhere along the aqueduct that explained it.

642721713.name: Acueduct Tour
642721713.author: a TripAdvisor user
642721713.reviewBody: We enjoyed the city tour for de Acueduct purchased in any of the tourism offices in downtown. 90 mxn per adult, and very knowledgeable tour guides we enjoyed experience nicely. Tip reserve tour with time, some times busy can take up to 3 hours, you can take lunch. Also two level buses, second level nice for photo. Enjoy!

638683128.name: The awesome acueducto...
638683128.author: a TripAdvisor user
638683128.reviewBody: No matter how many times I return to this city I am still amazed by the ingenuity of those who lived in the 1700s.  The arcos was the most ambitious hydraulic project in Mexico during the Colonial era.  What an imposing sight!  If you visit, be sure to  ask the hotel the best place to get a photo.

627584137.name: Cultural heritage
627584137.author: a TripAdvisor user
627584137.reviewBody: The aqueduct has 74 arches very well preserved (it was built on the 18th century). It has more than 1km and at nigh it is illuminated.

618763228.name: Impresive
618763228.author: a TripAdvisor user
618763228.reviewBody: If you come to Quer\u00e9taro you have to see the aqueduct - you can\u2019t really miss this 1 km and something giant. It is truly iconic sight: 18 century roman stile structure in midst of buzzy 21 century mexican street \ud83d\udc4d\ud83c\udffb

618058035.name: Selfie time!
618058035.author: a TripAdvisor user
618058035.reviewBody: Aqueducts don\'t do very much that\'s visible, even if they are still operating. They are a fun background for a selfie photo. Personally, I like Morelia\'s aqueduct better.

617113602.name: An image that will live forever in your mind
617113602.author: a TripAdvisor user
617113602.reviewBody: The fact a 16th century structure is still standing in North America is in itself fascinating, but to think of the history and story behind these Acueductos and why they were built shares so much culture and rich memory to the many generations before us. I agree with reviews that it\'s best to see this in an Uber or stop nearby and walk around. I found it specially beautiful at night with the lights adorning it, and noticed quite a bit of night life scene in surrounding areas.

613512800.name: Historic, Beautiful, well worth seeing.
613512800.author: a TripAdvisor user
613512800.reviewBody: While in Queretaro, we took a walk thru the old downtown and made our way to the Aqueduct. Amazing to see up close, and reminded me of Rome. Be sure to do a quick wikipedia check to read about the history behind this structure. Queretaro itself is a very nice city with lots to do and see.

601603873.name: Use Uber or Taxi to see this
601603873.author: a TripAdvisor user
601603873.reviewBody:
We were very disappointed when the tour bus (called Tranvía 90 pesos per person) did not Stop at this main attraction of Querétaro. The bus drove by a half way of 74 arches and turned around. 

See my pictures that I managed to take from the tour bus driving by. 

The next day we took a Uber to get there. 
Yes, it stands at the dangerous road where many cars go through. Along this road, there are Subway, Starbucks and other stores. 

But I do recommend to stop by an Original Chocolate shop along this street that produces the famous souvenir chocolate from Querétaro called “pedo de monjas= the fart of nuns”.

599846136.name: A must see in Queretaro
599846136.author: a TripAdvisor user
599846136.reviewBody: Always a great thing to visit with new things going on around the area. Try to take a guided tour so you can learn the history of this beautiful place. Tons of restaurants and shopping especially in el centro. Have been here many times and always love to see what is new and exciting in this fast growing city.

598593526.name: The history behind
598593526.author: a TripAdvisor user
598593526.reviewBody: I went to check this place and it was comlletely amazing... read the history behind and you will be more amazed!

597645672.name: Signature Site
597645672.author: a TripAdvisor user
597645672.reviewBody: Face it, there aren\'t a huge number of tourist attractions in this fabulous city. That\'s great for tourists because, even in July, the place isn\'t overrun by selfie sticks and big red busses. The Aqueduct is Quer\u00e9taro\'s big attraction. There\'s no tour, there\'s no admission, and there\'s no fanfare. The amazing structure, built in the 16th Century, is in great shape, and even though it\'s no where near as old as the Roman variety, it\'s about as old as they get in North America. It\'s definitely worth a visit.

594960063.name: Unique structure
594960063.author: a TripAdvisor user
594960063.reviewBody: The history, architecture and grandeur are impressive. Relatively unique structure for North America. Recommend.

590269099.name: Must go turist attraction
590269099.author: a TripAdvisor user
590269099.reviewBody: Thiis a must go attraction in Queretaro. not many places have it so long and big. Fantastic construction. Looks also great in the night. Have some restaurants is some places.

589848625.name: Get some pictures and then visit the cafeteria to chill out with nice view
589848625.author: a TripAdvisor user
589848625.reviewBody: Beautiful aqueduct to visit on your trip to Queretaro. It\u2019s a great architecture piece from the old days. Be careful if you want to walk around as the streets are very busy with lots of car traffic. Nice pictures you can get there. I recommend you to visit a nice cafeteria "Lucien Caf\u00e9" (nice mexican coffee) with a great view of Queretaro aqueduct. The best time to visit it could be around sunsets to get some nice sky colors.

582256183.name: Incredible place
582256183.author: a TripAdvisor user
582256183.reviewBody: It was the first time I visited the city of Queretaro and it seemed beautiful and very quiet, ideal to visit alone or with family, and the Arches of the Aqueduct are incredible!

582248846.name: Super Cool Sight to See
582248846.author: a TripAdvisor user
582248846.reviewBody: This was super cool to look at, especially at night when it was all lit up! I just wanted to climb up on it and walk across the top! Unfortunately didn\'t get to hear any history on it, but we got some cool pictures! There apparently used to be a "mirador" or looking point where you could see the entire aqua-duct across the city, but with all of the new construction we couldn\'t find a cab driver who knew where it was (we tried three). It makes for a cool photo op at night if you get in the right spot.

578708956.name: Love prevails
578708956.author: a TripAdvisor user
578708956.reviewBody: Do you know that this Acueducto is the mexican version of the Taj Mahal? There is a love story behind, you should a local for it. Even there is a fake arch... guess which is it?

574428757.name: A Roman aquaduct in the new world.
574428757.author: a TripAdvisor user
574428757.reviewBody: This is fantastic attraction made even better by story unrequited love that lead to the construction by the general for the nun.  Start at the convent but don\'t miss the end up near the Hercules brewery.

574018623.name: Must have seen in Queretaro
574018623.author: a TripAdvisor user
574018623.reviewBody: If you go to Queretaro, you should take a walk or drive to the Acueducto. The most famous landmark, very unique. It is also included in the sightseeing bus tour which stop there for your pic.

571927704.name: Amazing historical structure
571927704.author: a TripAdvisor user
571927704.reviewBody: The aqueduct oh in queretaro is quite spectacular especially when you consider that it was built in the mid-1700s it was originally built to supply the church and people of queretaro with water. Well worth seeing while in queretaro.

570018803.name: Impresive
570018803.author: a TripAdvisor user
570018803.reviewBody: For me the largest so far, very clean and well mantained , out side of the historic center of Quer\u00e9taro, you nave to go

566746459.name: Raison D\'Etre
566746459.author: a TripAdvisor user
566746459.reviewBody: The aqueduct is not a knock your eyes out sight.  The important thing to understand is without the huge and tedious construction, there probably would never have been a sustainable city here.  Of course it was all probably indigenous slave labor.  Such is history.  The best view is from the Mirador at the mausoleum a couple of blocks above.

566538968.name: archetectural gem in Quer\u00e9taro.
566538968.author: a TripAdvisor user
566538968.reviewBody: This is really quite an accomplishment to build and wonderful that it remains. Worth your time. I might suggest that you go on a City tour that takes you there. It is a bit of a walk from El Centro. I did walk down there and took photos. However, I took a taxi back. I am told that on the tour you see it from a look out point ( which I didn\u2019t do). I\u2019m in Quer\u00e9taro for 3 weeks so may well return on a tour bus.

564915458.name: Aqueduct at sunrise and sunset
564915458.author: a TripAdvisor user
564915458.reviewBody: If you have the time while visiting Queretaro, be sure to see the lovely aqueduct at sunrise from the road, and again at sunset from the overlook and the setting sun lighting up the arches and the lovely city behind it.

556190177.name: Always a surprising site
556190177.author: a TripAdvisor user
556190177.reviewBody: I have been a number of times in Queretaro for meeting etc. and I have to admit, all of a sudden you come upon the aqueduct, and it is a very surprising site. Hard to believe that it is 300 years old. The engineering is incredible.  Of course, it is important to recognize that Queretaro was at one time the capital of the country, so you would expect some interesting civil engineering.  Be sure not to miss it!

550095101.name: Lovely bit of history
550095101.author: a TripAdvisor user
550095101.reviewBody: Impressive aqueduct recalling time\'s of old when the Duke feel in love with a nun and built it for her order at a considerable expense. Unfortunately it\'s in the middle of a lot of traffic....

548137058.name: Nice place
548137058.author: a TripAdvisor user
548137058.reviewBody: This is one of the most representative  place in queretaro,  at night the view is much better.. you can walk around

547961236.name: Business than site seeing
547961236.author: a TripAdvisor user
547961236.reviewBody: Awesome to see.  I did not expect to see nothing like this here. In drove in at night and once I saw it i had to see it all.  I looked up on maps and off I went.  Absolutely amazing what humans did long go. Wish i took the tour.

545634120.name: Amazing architecture, a must see attraction!!
545634120.author: a TripAdvisor user
545634120.reviewBody: Located in the center of Queretaro city, this construction dated from almost 300 years ago remains as witness of the city expansion and gives a beloved identity to their citizens. You can walk along to check the starting point until the end. There are some tours and storytellers who will be pleased to tell you the love history behind its construction. I recommend to take some pictures and discover your best shot. After visiting this attraction you can go to downtown and enjoy the romantic and festive ambient that surround the city.

544810838.name: Amazing right through town
544810838.author: a TripAdvisor user
544810838.reviewBody: I loved seeing this and it was one of the reasons I went to Queretaro. I had trouble finding it at first, took a wrong turn. Once I did it was very cool to see. I wish I had found the mirador as I just was taking photos from the street so that took away from it a bit as it was a very busy street.

542470579.name: The best place to visit in Queretaro
542470579.author: a TripAdvisor user
542470579.reviewBody: This is the best place in town if you are a tourist. You can enjoy the best view of old Queretaro and also appreciate the Acueducto. It was built by the Spaniards in the 1500s and it is in great shape.

540467127.name: Old Roman style Aqueduct in Mexico
540467127.author: a TripAdvisor user
540467127.reviewBody: The city has grown around the roman style aqueduct.  We had the opportunity to see the length and structure up close.  We stopped at an old hacienda  and heard it\'s history  and that it may be haunted by a young girl.   The plan is that it is scheduled to be remodeled into condo apartments, restaurants, shops for retirees.

539302816.name: Cool to see
539302816.author: a TripAdvisor user
539302816.reviewBody: Haven\'t seen to many aqueducts in my time so it was interesting to see in person.  The science behind the engineering is interesting.

539005207.name: A more relaxing view of the acueducto
539005207.author: a TripAdvisor user
539005207.reviewBody: Last time I visited Queretaro I ran the city marathon. It was a great way to see the city and it includes running along the aqueduct. This time I took a more leisurely stroll from downtown along Calle Ejercito Republicano to the small plaza-like area around Panteon de los Queretanos Ilustres. There are market sellers here and a fantastic view of the aqueduct and this part of the city. Only takes 10-15 mins from el centro and is worth it for the view!

538556703.name: The Best Aquaduct in Queretaro
538556703.author: a TripAdvisor user
538556703.reviewBody: This is my first trip to Queretaro but I have to say that this is the prettiest aquaduct I have ever seen in Mexico. It is also the only aquaduct I have ever seen in Mexico. You see it whether you want to or not as you arrive into the city from the airport. Great love story behind its creation actually.

537635989.name: Not a highlight/ But worth the walk to view from a couple locations
537635989.author: a TripAdvisor user
537635989.reviewBody: The aquaduct was structurally interesting and a nice photo opp.  It was not a top tier attraction for me.

536765264.name: beautifully lit
536765264.author: a TripAdvisor user
536765264.reviewBody: what an amazing aqueduct, 74 really tall arches, all lit up at night, by far the longest aqueduct I\'d ever seen and in the middle of a city

532174787.name: Interesting
532174787.author: a TripAdvisor user
532174787.reviewBody: I enjoyed the history lesson regarding the aqueduct. I took the Big Red Bus tour. Our particular tour was only in Spanish, fine for me but may have been disappointing to some. I think if they had non-Spanish speakers they also give the information in English too.

531213545.name: Hard to understand the amazing reviews!
531213545.author: a TripAdvisor user
531213545.reviewBody: I am not sure why this scores so highly on TripAdvisor but I suspect it is because of Queretaro\'s dull city center compared to other astonishing cities in the heart of mexico, such as San Miguel de Allende or Guanajuato. For the well traveled readers: this is just an old aqueduct. The blocks around it are plain and dull. I am not saying you should not go and see it (it\'s on the way around the classic sightseeing circuit, so you\'ll bump into it as you walk around), but don\'t expect to be marveled based on so many overhyped reviews (in my humble opinion). If you keep your expectations low and then are super impressed (maybe I lack the aqueduct impression gene :))), even better!

525870836.name: Beauty street
525870836.author: a TripAdvisor user
525870836.reviewBody: This is a spotlight in the city, a great "literally" aqueduct.\nThe street have some coffees with visit, and a walk on that place is always enjoyable.\n

524084003.name: Amazing!
524084003.author: a TripAdvisor user
524084003.reviewBody: A must see, along with the statues at the base. This is one of the most interesting stories about Queretaro, about a man who was in love with a nun. He built the aqueduct just for her.

522686586.name: Its a must if you are in Queretaro!
522686586.author: a TripAdvisor user
522686586.reviewBody: Its a must if you are in Queretaro! You can go by foot, downtown Queretaro is not that big and you can enjoy walking in one of the most beautiful colonial cities in Mexico

521108364.name: Must see!
521108364.author: a TripAdvisor user
521108364.reviewBody: City tours go here.....it is very interesting....quite the architectural marvel and the people of Queretaro are very proud of it.

515498485.name: Trip Downtown
515498485.author: a TripAdvisor user
515498485.reviewBody: We drove past these while on way to eat downtown. They were beautiful. Our business partner told us how these were built to bring water into the city. Beautiful site to see.

512477455.name: TIP: go to Church of Santa Cruz to get the best sight of the aqueduct
512477455.author: a TripAdvisor user
512477455.reviewBody: Nicely preserved, beautiful to see and admire. The aqueduct ends at the Church of the Holy Cross and Miracles. And a few steps from the church, you get to see the aqueduct in all its glory. Beautiful

509083045.name: Amazing spot in Queretaro
509083045.author: a TripAdvisor user
509083045.reviewBody:
We took a ride in two story bus to visit this spectacular construction it cost 90 pesos each. 

Even you can go on your own to visit the acueducto, this was a nice experience and the view from top of the bus is really nice.

Bus departs from downtown and the tour takes around and hour.

508843019.name: Beatiful view
508843019.author: a TripAdvisor user
508843019.reviewBody: The Aqueduct is unique and very impressive as it is very well preserved and a master of engineering itself. You can look at it from your car

508554605.name: Beautiful Aqueduct!
508554605.author: a TripAdvisor user
508554605.reviewBody: This lovely aqueduct dominates the Queretaro skyline. It reminds one of the Roman aqueducts in Europe. It really cannot be missed. This is beautiful city.

503491240.name: El Acurducto
503491240.author: a TripAdvisor user
503491240.reviewBody: The actual seeing is something one should do BUT, the story on how, especially why, it was built makes it worth seeing. Read the story first before visiting the aqueduct.

497648505.name: Beautiful structure
497648505.author: a TripAdvisor user
497648505.reviewBody: The aqueduct structure is amazing, it\'s well preserved and it have a historic value for the people of Quer\u00e9taro.

492069757.name: best of Queretero
492069757.author: a TripAdvisor user
492069757.reviewBody: its shocking to find an well- preserved Roman - like aquaduct squat in the middle off a Mexican town. take plenty of photos and read up on the history of the aquaduct.  you\'ll be amazed.

492068008.name: Beautiful
492068008.author: a TripAdvisor user
492068008.reviewBody: Best view of the aquaduct is from behind the Holy Cross Church.  It\'s very impressive, too bad I didn\'t see it at night.

485122925.name: Great view at night
485122925.author: a TripAdvisor user
485122925.reviewBody: This is Santiago de Queretaro\'s landmark. Its very extensive and beautiful to see at night. Blue lights turn on, you can take great pictures. Near the start of the Acueducto, there\'s a lookout. You can view Queretaro\'s city. Must go.

483271197.name: If you go to Queretaro you  must go to Acueducto
483271197.author: a TripAdvisor user
483271197.reviewBody: Nothing special, but it\'s the icon of the city, so if you go to Queretaro you have to go to Acueducto and take your picture.

482134919.name: Amazing structure and the story behind it
482134919.author: a TripAdvisor user
482134919.reviewBody: Truly a marvel the height and length.we saw it during our tour of the city. The guide gave us all the history very fascinating.

475966604.name: Nice view
475966604.author: a TripAdvisor user
475966604.reviewBody: Very nice view, easy to find and get there by car. Around one can find plenty of restaurants which are not so turistic.

473994573.name: Impressive
473994573.author: a TripAdvisor user
473994573.reviewBody:
A thing to see in Queretaro!
The history is interesting and impressive.
You can't miss it.
Recommend

472242579.name: At par with Zacatecas acueductos
472242579.author: a TripAdvisor user
472242579.reviewBody: We unfortunately only sw the acueductos from a tourist tram but they are so impressive. Built almost 300 years ago, thanks to the structural techniques the Spanish learned from their occupation by the Moors some 1,500 years ago.

464751195.name: Impressive structure used to provide safe water for residence
464751195.author: a TripAdvisor user
464751195.reviewBody: Quite long above ground and has connecting tunnel underground.  Historically, finally brought safe and clean water to the city.

464109950.name: Old structure
464109950.author: a TripAdvisor user
464109950.reviewBody: The story behind the aqueducts make it very interesting and why it stands out in Queretaro. it spans from one end to another in the city.

460236749.name: Lovely
460236749.author: a TripAdvisor user
460236749.reviewBody: I hadn\'t seen such a beautiful aqueduct system since Spain many years ago.   I am not sure I had the best viewing place but I just walked to the end of the street and there it was.  An easy walk from the center of town.   I wish I had a guide to tell me more about it though.

459825047.name: Amazing
459825047.author: a TripAdvisor user
459825047.reviewBody: These acueductos were built in the early 1700\'s by Juan Antonio de Urrutia and functioned for almost 200 years bringing water from the mountains to over 60 fountains in the historical centro. There are 74 arches over 1280 meters. \n\nQueretaro is justifiably proud of this major fete! If you go to Queretaro you must see the Arcos.

458575783.name: A must see!
458575783.author: a TripAdvisor user
458575783.reviewBody:
Incomparable Queretaro's symbol!
Need to see during the day and at night!
A lot of history happened beside it!
Cannot pass by Queretaro without taking the time to enjoy the view!

458092830.name: Queretaro Aqueduct
458092830.author: a TripAdvisor user
458092830.reviewBody: It\'s beautiful. It\'s illuminated at night.  Juan Antonio de Urrutia y Arana , Marqu\u00e9s de la Villa del Villar ordered it\'s construction in 1726 in order to send water to the city. It \'s Queretaro Symbol. There is a celebration each year with a serie of events. People can visit Queretaro. It is a city full of culture, traditios and excellent food.

457976696.name: Impressive but not spectecular
457976696.author: a TripAdvisor user
457976696.reviewBody: The Aqueduct is nice, but the surroundings are not so great. In my opinion it is enough if you just look at it while passing it by.

454255442.name: Pride of Queretaro city
454255442.author: a TripAdvisor user
454255442.reviewBody: I visited this place during my visit in Mexico. It\'s a long aquadict and the end of this monster arhitecture located in Queretaro. It\'s interesting and really worth to see because it\'s quiet unique, visible from most places in the town.

452914223.name: Amazing achievment
452914223.author: a TripAdvisor user
452914223.reviewBody: This aquaduct was built for the love of a woman. Very romantic story for this great example of craftsmanship and vision.

451927700.name: Fantastic structure
451927700.author: a TripAdvisor user
451927700.reviewBody: Built as a gift by Marquis del Villa del Aguila for the love of his life (a nun) this aqueduct is a marvellous structure to go and see.

451100935.name: very nice
451100935.author: a TripAdvisor user
451100935.reviewBody: very nice to see it at night, important to know the history, a very interesting building, a symbol of the city

449715948.name: A tall drink of water
449715948.author: a TripAdvisor user
449715948.reviewBody: Built in 1736 by a Spanish Marquis (Juan Antonio...) to provide fresh water to a Nun he was in love with. Really, you can\'t make this stuff up. It still stands virtually intact! It\'s beautiful at night with the lights shining on it. An impressive piece of architecture (and history).

448071409.name: Great civic pride
448071409.author: a TripAdvisor user
448071409.reviewBody: It is hard to review an object. It is just there. What is unique about this object is that it has been preserved by the city and is a regional landmark. Originally built in 1736 to bring fresh water from the mountains to the Centro Historico.  It is 4,160 feet long and 75 feet tall. A portion of the Pan-American Highway makes its way beneath its arches. Today, the water still flows to the fountains in the center city though it is no longer potable. It is a beautiful example of civic architecture and stands as a symbol of the area uniting the colonial and modern elements of the city.

447796631.name: nice place
447796631.author: a TripAdvisor user
447796631.reviewBody: Queretaro is very nice city, quite easy and silent. It is good place for visiting and wiev of acueducto is amazing. Famous from its history (Mexican Uprising).  They have great bars and restaurants there. Worthy to stay for 2 - 3 days. Acueducto is going thru the city center and is one of the most important and beautiful objects during Your visit.

447001970.name: Great walk
447001970.author: a TripAdvisor user
447001970.reviewBody: I stayed in hotel in Centro Historico and on Saturday I had decided to see Acueducto. It is located 20 minutes walk from the city center. It is very impressive construction. I have wonderful walk there and back.

446100543.name: beautiful aqueduct
446100543.author: a TripAdvisor user
446100543.reviewBody: almost 2km and 30m tall, the aqueduct of Queretaro is an impressive site within the UNESCO world-heritage city of Queretaro. Its story, as many mexican stories, is a tale of love, so make sure you ask the locals in downtown for it.

444734389.name: Must see this massive structure
444734389.author: a TripAdvisor user
444734389.reviewBody: This is Queretaro\'s landmark structure and it is a huge aquaduct that is no longer functional but still standing after all these years. \nBuilt initially to transport water to the convent, due to a wealthy man showing his love for a nun who would never marry him.\nDefinitely see it day & night with all the lovely lighting.

435400610.name: Acueducto de Quer\u00e9taro, Mexico
435400610.author: a TripAdvisor user
435400610.reviewBody: Its important to the city and it does have a lot of history about it, and would be something that you can read about and has a great story which you can read and review the information. I did walk the area and did also take some cool pictures and did view it at night and during the day.

428247286.name: It is just an aqueduct...
428247286.author: a TripAdvisor user
428247286.reviewBody: Although it was very important for the city developing i do not think it deserv a big visit however it is still a big monument.

427066621.name: MUST READ HISTORY ON THE CONSTRUCTION TO APPRECIATE
427066621.author: a TripAdvisor user
427066621.reviewBody: I am not a historian but there is a great storyline on the building of this aqueduct.  You will appreciate it so much more if you read before visiting.

422595250.name: interesting
422595250.author: a TripAdvisor user
422595250.reviewBody: very interesting to follow its path and very beautiful at night!!  Definitely a must see in Quer\u00e9taro.

413030326.name: Amazing
413030326.author: a TripAdvisor user
413030326.reviewBody: The story of how these came to be is incredible.   Worth a look.  Not far from town.  Spectacular at night.

412867839.name: Historic and wonderful views
412867839.author: a TripAdvisor user
412867839.reviewBody: This is one of the most important landmarks in the historical city of Queretaro, Mexico. It was built in the 18th century with a romantic legend behind it.   The "arches"  can be admired when walking from the beginning of the Aqueduct until the famous Mirador.  There are many good restaurants in both sides of the Aqueduct to please the most demanding visitors.

410192555.name: A place to take great picts!
410192555.author: a TripAdvisor user
410192555.reviewBody: This is a place to get the camera ready, nice picts you can take from here, from the start right at the foot of Milenio III until the very end right in the old streets of Quer\u00e9taro, sometimes you can find art sculptures or figures lend by universities, either way its a place to walk by and photograph!

406812845.name: Astonishing Structure
406812845.author: a TripAdvisor user
406812845.reviewBody: Walk to the \'Mirador\' from which you can see almost the entire length of this acuaduct and great parts of the city.

404712044.name: Beautiful at night.
404712044.author: a TripAdvisor user
404712044.reviewBody: This is a,beautiful spot to watch the sun set. The views of the city are beautiful and to match the lights light up the aqueduct is lovely. It is an easy cab ride from centro and the cabs are in the square for your return.

404580888.name: Good walk
404580888.author: a TripAdvisor user
404580888.reviewBody: Is always very clean but sometimes the water  smell weird other wise is a great place to walk or run and is a great part of the city history.

403604278.name: An Aquaduct
403604278.author: a TripAdvisor user
403604278.reviewBody: It stands out as you drive into Queretaro, I guess you can say its impressive and does have history but all in all not worth a special visit, its probably more impressive from a distance!\nIt is well preserved and obviously Queretaro is proud of it so I will say no more!

399328699.name: Both Historically Interesting & Beautiful
399328699.author: a TripAdvisor user
399328699.reviewBody: After a visit to the Convento de la Santa Cruz, its just a short walk down the street to the mirador for an excellent view of "Los Arcos". From this vantage point, one can see nearly all of the 74 arches that make up the aqueduct. Even from this angle, one can get the sense of the size of the pillars and arches that run for more than one and a quarter kilometers. Considering the aqueduct was build in the second quarter of the 1700s, it has stood the challenge of time to be one of Queretaro\'s most icon landmarks.

398615958.name: Either way it\'s a photo spot
398615958.author: a TripAdvisor user
398615958.reviewBody: Whether you are into history or propsecting a good photo spot El Acueducto is a prime location. If you are the former type of person then don\'t miss one of the tour buses departing from the historic centre of the town. Chances are you want to go by nightime to get some very unique pictures.

398609082.name: An integral part of the history of Queretaro
398609082.author: a TripAdvisor user
398609082.reviewBody: You must take time to see the acueducto when in Queretaro.  Amazing to think that it was manually built over 400 years ago to bring clean water to the citizens.  It has been beautifully maintained and ends in a lovely fountain/water box.

397086321.name: If you are into history....
397086321.author: a TripAdvisor user
397086321.reviewBody: ....then this is a must-see when in Queretaro. You\'ll see similarities with aqueducts in Spain and Italy, but that\'s as far as the similarities go. Walk its 1+ kilometers length, while trying to  isolate the aqueduct from its present surrounds, and you may "see" what it was like 400 years ago!

389736220.name: Very interesting view
389736220.author: a TripAdvisor user
389736220.reviewBody: El Acueducto is very interesting to see... our tour guide was very informative ..it is beautiful and to know the history of the reason why they constructed the Acueducto...very historical

387828208.name: The Icon of Queretaro
387828208.author: a TripAdvisor user
387828208.reviewBody: Historical, beautiful, enormous, and free! What else can you ask for? There are a lot of places to eat by the sides, for bruch, cafe, lunch or dinner. You need to go here if you travel to Qro.

387745487.name: Clean and and very nice down town
387745487.author: a TripAdvisor user
387745487.reviewBody: The "old Town" is just great to visit. A huge varaity of restaurant, small bars, cafe and small hotels. You feel really safe and everyone is really helpful and friendly

387590566.name: Beautiful and historic
387590566.author: a TripAdvisor user
387590566.reviewBody: The aqueduct is a nice addition to a beautiful city.  To get the best view go up to the convent on the hill and you can see the aqueduct from a picturesque location.

386819975.name: Alebrijes
386819975.author: a TripAdvisor user
386819975.reviewBody: Good excibition of alebrijes. Excellent view of art from an important artist of this popular type of art.

385390239.name: Amazing historical site
385390239.author: a TripAdvisor user
385390239.reviewBody: Get a local to tell you about the acueduct.  Amazing history behind it makes it even more fascinating.

384130296.name: Not for walking
384130296.author: a TripAdvisor user
384130296.reviewBody: This street isn\'t for walking,  there aren\'t many tourists or commercial attractions.  Is OK if you go by taxi,  take a few pictures and move on.  This month there was an exposition of "alebrijes",   but I\'m not sure if it is permanent.

382619134.name: Original Acueducto de Queretaro
382619134.author: a TripAdvisor user
382619134.reviewBody: This is an amazing example of what can be accomplished by early craftsman. It has been preserved and is a very beautiful example of early stone works.

381276965.name: Impressive
381276965.author: a TripAdvisor user
381276965.reviewBody: It\'s simply amazing. One of Queretaro\'s many points of interest, the Acueducto is impressive. Now out of service, but an beautiful landmark indeed!

379184417.name: Beautiful, But....
379184417.author: a TripAdvisor user
379184417.reviewBody: The Acueducto is beautiful landmark in Queretaro, but I don\u00b4t know why you would go just to see it. Its really something you will see in passing, driving by.

378456579.name: Fantastic
378456579.author: a TripAdvisor user
378456579.reviewBody: This aqueduct is an engineering marvel. And the story says that it was build for love. Now is the most emblematic construction in Queretaro.

376023278.name: Impressive
376023278.author: a TripAdvisor user
376023278.reviewBody: Beautiful, big and impressive this monument is part of history. A must see in Quer\u00e9taro. Average 15 min from the historic downtown by foot

371937037.name: Beautiful to see
371937037.author: a TripAdvisor user
371937037.reviewBody: This is a quick visit but interesting to see the landscaping and to learn about the history. There is also a small park across the street and a luxury hotel made from a bullring nearby.

370202305.name: Amazing architecture and landmark
370202305.author: a TripAdvisor user
370202305.reviewBody: This amazing structure has withstood the test of time. Standing large across major streets, it also serves as a point of orientation for people new to the city.

369741805.name: Amazing photos at night
369741805.author: a TripAdvisor user
369741805.reviewBody: I basically Walked through this to enjoy the view. The are many restaurants and bars close by, so there\'s no excuses to stop by and get your selfie

367504375.name: One of Quer\u00e9taro\'s symbols
367504375.author: a TripAdvisor user
367504375.reviewBody: This is one of Quer\u00e9taro\'s symbols. It was finished in the mid 1730\'s and is one of the longuest that exist in the country, measuring over 1,200 meters. It has a nice legend upon why it was built.

367036275.name: Let\'s be honest, it\'s an aqueduct.
367036275.author: a TripAdvisor user
367036275.reviewBody: It\'s an aqueduct.  It\'s not particularly old, or anything, but it is kind of nice to look at.  At night they light it with colored lights.  If you are in the neighborhood it\'s worth a look, but I wouldn\'t make much of a special trip to see it.

363498010.name: These arches have witness the growth and development of Queretaro from a small town to a large city
363498010.author: a TripAdvisor user
363498010.reviewBody: Good to see that works have been done to retain the splendour of the traditional arches. They are illuminated with multicolour lights at night. These arched have helped Queretaro exist. They used to be the source of water to the city. Now they only serve as souvenir of centuries of tradition.

363250739.name: Great views
363250739.author: a TripAdvisor user
363250739.reviewBody: Go to the mirador that has the best views over a large expanse of the aqueduct. It\'s a short walk from the city centre and the views are really worth it. Best to be enjoyed at sundown.

360994272.name: Great view at night
360994272.author: a TripAdvisor user
360994272.reviewBody: We went here in both the daytime and at night. During the day with the city as a backdrop is really cool to see the history. At night though they light it up and it is absolutely beautiful. The restaurants around it are very good and it\'s just a short drive from the central area with tons of shops.

359079226.name: Stunning architecture of our ancestors
359079226.author: a TripAdvisor user
359079226.reviewBody: You can not imagine more than hundreds of men carrying stones, projecting and measuring the walls. Impressive columns of colossal height raised with the limited technology of existing load almost three hundred years ago. Only by being under the arches you feel small compared to people able to lift this majestic work of architectural art. Go and feel yourself this special feeling combined heat of the city and the cool winter morning in Queretaro.

357724687.name: Just go to el mirador to take a picture
357724687.author: a TripAdvisor user
357724687.reviewBody: It is not the most special place in Mexico but it is charming. If you\'re in Quer\u00e9taro just have a walk from the city centre to el mirador to take a picture of the acueducto while you enjoy the panoramic view.

357103077.name: Interest thing to watch
357103077.author: a TripAdvisor user
357103077.reviewBody: It\'s about understanding the history behind it and the engineering effort that took to build it. Read about it and stop by to take a picture.

355361991.name: Impressive arquitecture
355361991.author: a TripAdvisor user
355361991.reviewBody: It is amazing to see this old aquedcuct, very tall, crossing the city. You can see it from almost everywhere in the city.

349440671.name: Beautiful queretar
349440671.author: a TripAdvisor user
349440671.reviewBody:
I don't believe I'm in Mexico
This town is so clean and picturesque
Wonderful history and great food😍
Very walkable to all the important historical sites

348500907.name: Great for photos
348500907.author: a TripAdvisor user
348500907.reviewBody: Los Arcos are gorgeous when all lit up at night and make quite a striking photo. Art is seasonal beneath the arches.

347491870.name: Unique and impressive
347491870.author: a TripAdvisor user
347491870.reviewBody: Remarkable Landmark crossing the city centre of Queretaro. Around you can find some great street art.

346707185.name: lots to eat and buy along the acueducto
346707185.author: a TripAdvisor user
346707185.reviewBody: theres a park along side where you can sit and enjoy the acueduct for all its grandeur.at night it is lit up and usually has statues from local artists that change from time to time

346526220.name: City by Marathon
346526220.author: a TripAdvisor user
346526220.reviewBody: I took part in the annual Queretaro City Marathon in Sept 2015 - the route gives a good tour of the greater City and then also visits the older parts. One highlight, towards the end of the race was running up and down the road alongside the aqueduct. It is an amazing piece of engineering and well worth seeing.

344528164.name: "Even better at night"
344528164.author: a TripAdvisor user
344528164.reviewBody:
I've been in Queretaro before but I never visited the Aqueducto neither during the day or at night.  You can't miss it since it crosses the city at one point and divides what is the Historic area and the local one.
The acueducto is long and is visible even from a long distance. 
We visited the first day during the day and walked along, but at night is a very nice spectacle with lights changing colors.
Also, something that really caught my attention, was the crossing lights close to the acueducto.  Queretaro has the most advanced lights I've ever seen, not even Europe or the US have the ones where the "little person" in the light starts to walk faster when the time is running out.  Very funny, but quite advanced form my opinion.

341810868.name: An impressive engineering feat
341810868.author: a TripAdvisor user
341810868.reviewBody: There is a large aqueduct running over 3800 feet down the median of a boulevard. It\'s tall in the middle, tapers to nothing at the ends. It used to carry water; now it doesn\'t. If you are an engineer, or know an engineer, or maybe your father or neighbor or spouse is an engineer- then this may excite you.

340182676.name: Beautiful city monument.
340182676.author: a TripAdvisor user
340182676.reviewBody: The aqueduct had an impressive history. Great stories behind it. The aqueduct itself is good reachable by car. You can drive alongside the monument and stop to make pictures.

339748110.name: Great Visit!
339748110.author: a TripAdvisor user
339748110.reviewBody: It is not something you are expecting, but the visit is great - see it at night, when it is lit up and the ambiance is pretty nice!

330035550.name: Nice Place to take Picts
330035550.author: a TripAdvisor user
330035550.reviewBody: Its a nice place with many views to take many kinds of pictures, by night its illuminated with lights according to season

328062440.name: Impressive!
328062440.author: a TripAdvisor user
328062440.reviewBody: The aqueduct is a reminder of history as well as the importance of a water system to any modern city. Its significance is obvious but it also adds to the charm of this beautiful city. Underneath there were cow and bull statues painted by different organizations in anticipation of the agricultural festival to be held here between November and December. Small restaurants and bars line the boulevard on both sides of the aqueduct as well as vendors of many kinds.

326856355.name: Boring
326856355.author: a TripAdvisor user
326856355.reviewBody: Interesting from the architectural point of view and a nice story behind, but not much to see or to explore. Can be visited in 10 min.

315197687.name: Nice evening sight
315197687.author: a TripAdvisor user
315197687.reviewBody: just wonderfull to see in the evening, all lit up.It stretches for a decent part of town, so you can hardly miss it when visiting town.

313283538.name: A marvel in the modern world.
313283538.author: a TripAdvisor user
313283538.reviewBody: An inspiring structure built in the 1800s and a main attraction.  We went on a tour trolley with a guide telling us the history of its building.  Very entertaining guide if you understand Spanish well enough.

313218498.name: No! You are NOT in Rome!
313218498.author: a TripAdvisor user
313218498.reviewBody: This marvellous and perfectly maintaoned aqueduct can be spotted from far away, as it runs into central Queretaro from the North and its massive columns become slowly lower and lower until they level with the ground. It is probably the very first piece of art you\'ll notice in this beautiful little central Mexican jewel, and it does remind you of the aqueduct you see when you approach Rome from South; although this one is of a more reddish colour and a couple of milleniums newer.

312380525.name: An iconic place
312380525.author: a TripAdvisor user
312380525.reviewBody: If you visit Queretaro you have to see this place and have a picture with the iconic arcs. The only drawback is that there is that much to do around this place

311943604.name: seen one aqueduct....
311943604.author: a TripAdvisor user
311943604.reviewBody: Plenty of history here, but for once I\'ll agree with my traveling companion, plenty of dust. A must engineers, but your average soul might be satisfied with a quick drive-by.

311447413.name: Queretaro iconic building
311447413.author: a TripAdvisor user
311447413.reviewBody: very impressive, traditional and easy to access. Very good dining places around and quite close to downtown Queretaro.

306342349.name: Nice!
306342349.author: a TripAdvisor user
306342349.reviewBody: They told me that El Acueduto was create by the monk to bring water to the monastery.\nBeside the history this arcs are the most famous art in Queretaro.\nYou don\'t need to visit, you will see in the road.

306318295.name: Scenic Historical Architecture
306318295.author: a TripAdvisor user
306318295.reviewBody: Those who know about Quer\u00e9taro know about this beautiful structure and its historical significance. It\'s not necessarily something to do while visiting, but it is definitely something worth a scenic drive by and possibly a photo opportunity. QRO is a great stop for tourists passing through M\u00e9xico.

304213529.name: Witness of a love story
304213529.author: a TripAdvisor user
304213529.reviewBody:
Witness of a love story!!!  

Behind this amazing structure there´s an impossible love story.  

See "Leyendas y Mitos de Queretaro" to hear the full version.

301652329.name: Part of Queretaro\'s history
301652329.author: a TripAdvisor user
301652329.reviewBody: Beautiful monument which is the symbol of Quer\u00e9taro City, it is well kept it and it is very nice, you must go and take a picture with it, people will know that you were in Quer\u00e9taro.

296063119.name: The Symbol of Queretaro
296063119.author: a TripAdvisor user
296063119.reviewBody: The acueduct is the main symbol and icon of queretaro and even features on the emblem of the local football or soccer teams logo. Its located in a leafy part of town and is a nice walk from the Centre. In terms of design it is nothing special compared to the one in zacatecas but it has an interesting history as to why it was built.

295792753.name: Colonial Urban Architecture
295792753.author: a TripAdvisor user
295792753.reviewBody: I\'ve always been attracted by aqueducts like this one, and it is very well preserved and is a landmark of the city of Quer\u00e9taro.

288356440.name: A quick drive by
288356440.author: a TripAdvisor user
288356440.reviewBody: It is very big but in a dirty part of town.  there are no cafes, it is not quiet, there are buses and taxies stopping everywhere.  It smells bad like gas and smoke

275068617.name: Pleasantly surprised
275068617.author: a TripAdvisor user
275068617.reviewBody: Seems like quiet sleepy town but impressive food, caf\u00e9s, shops, architecture. Passed through on my way to San Miguel but I would have liked more time to look around this town.

268417610.name: Just amazing!!! surrounded of a lot to do places!!!!
268417610.author: a TripAdvisor user
268417610.reviewBody: What started as a love story, between a nun and a Marquis, the Marquis ought to bring water to the city in order to gain the right to court her, after almost 300 years, is a must place if you visit M\u00e9xico.\n\nYou will find restaurant, parks, pubs, to delight with the view

262762940.name: piece of Rome architecture  in mexico
262762940.author: a TripAdvisor user
262762940.reviewBody: worth the view, try to take a photo along the aqueduct from ground level. impressive. The viewing spot from the distance gives the perspective of his grandeur in its day. Pity the city had to grow around the structure.

259887496.name: Just some brick arches.
259887496.author: a TripAdvisor user
259887496.reviewBody: Nothing more and nothing less. It\'s just some brick tall arches along the highway. You\'ll see them as you pass by. A quick 1 min if enough.

255695565.name: I love aquaducts, wherever they are
255695565.author: a TripAdvisor user
255695565.reviewBody: A long slow walk from one end to the other, stopping to take photos, and then looking back and then up and then forward. It is so tall and slender and utterly beautiful. The longer that I stayed in Queretaro, and started ferreting out all her secrets, the more I like the city.

255354048.name: Regional landmark
255354048.author: a TripAdvisor user
255354048.reviewBody: This structure has only relatively recently been promoted more aggressively, but still seems to be rather under appreciated by the local residents.  It is not all that easy to walk along its length, there are not a lot of markers giving you much information about the structure.  At least it was not destroyed when Blvd. Bernardo Quintana was built.  It does form a good backdrop for photographs and it helps give Queretaro a flair that many cities in Mexico do not have, or have lost as they became urbanized and industrialized. Is it worth a trip to Queretaro just to see this feature?  No, but luckily Queretaro has retained, in the Zona Centro, a lot of its colonial and 19th century heritage, so there are other things to see here as well.

253580665.name: Amazing piece of architecture
253580665.author: a TripAdvisor user
253580665.reviewBody: The aqueduct is simply incredible. Just by knowing that it was built so many years ago, it is astonishing. Although the aqueduct is amazing, the government hasn\'t really took the time to make enough tours or a place in which you could take photos of the place. It is right in the middle of one of the highways with the most transit in Queretaro and this makes it less attractive.

251532882.name: Postcard of Queretaro
251532882.author: a TripAdvisor user
251532882.reviewBody: Impossible to see photos of Queretaro and don\'t see the Acueducto. This is a postcard of the city and a very impressive and large construction. During the night, it\'s all iluminated and also very beautiful!

239532216.name: Wonderful architecture
239532216.author: a TripAdvisor user
239532216.reviewBody: This is a must visit monument. They say it is the highest one in the world. Great photo opportunities here. Out in the suburbs, so one needs to perhaps hire a taxi to get there.\nBut it is worth it.

227757049.name: More Than Three Centuries Old....
227757049.author: a TripAdvisor user
227757049.reviewBody: Very impressive 1.78 km-long structure and declared a World Heritage site by UNESCO recently.  It\'s still in use and if you are in Queretaro, DO NOT MISS it.  It was originally erected to bring water to the people of Queretaro and, over time, changed to supplying water to the fountains at Plaza de la Independencia. An engineering marvel when one realizes it was designed in 1723.

226799571.name: Very Nice structure That makes the city unique.
226799571.author: a TripAdvisor user
226799571.reviewBody: Large Arquitectonic structure with History. Great for Picture taking, at different angles of the city you cant miss it.

226757998.name: Acueducto Los Arcos.
226757998.author: a TripAdvisor user
226757998.reviewBody: A must if you are stopping by Queretaro, the view of this roman style acueduct is amazing in the fastest growing city in Mexico. Towards the end of the acueduct theres a small place for a scenic view. This Acueduct used to deliver water into small fountains downtown for people to get water for daily needs. The acueduct is a symbol of the city. Back in the late 1800s the train used to pass underneath , today one of the main streets pass through here.

213776999.name: Awesome Architecture
213776999.author: a TripAdvisor user
213776999.reviewBody: The aqueduct not serves as a highway divider, but it\'s worth seeing from both a distance and up close; I walked its entire length and back

213468438.name: Good option
213468438.author: a TripAdvisor user
213468438.reviewBody: The acueducto is really pretty, if you are considering visiting it, you should also check out this....It is located in the center of the city, so there\'s a lot of people nearby, some tours offer taking you there, I haven\'t tried them, but I can tell you that my experience was really good by just seeing it by my car window.

211772178.name: Not sooo old but interesting
211772178.author: a TripAdvisor user
211772178.reviewBody: This not like the ancient Romans, of course, but it is still noteworthy and interesting to see the engineering that was required to bring mountain water to Queretaro in the 18th century (I think).

208268482.name: very impressive
208268482.author: a TripAdvisor user
208268482.reviewBody: I loved the acueducto, and I loved the story of why and how it was made. Sort of romantic and comic.

206326232.name: a well-kept piece of queretaro history
206326232.author: a TripAdvisor user
206326232.reviewBody: it was a little hard to find on our own, as we walked everywhere, but well worth it once we did find it!

201982292.name: Fantastic Aqueduct of Queretaro
201982292.author: a TripAdvisor user
201982292.reviewBody: One will have to take the trolley or auto to view the aqueduct of Queretaro. The construction began 1726 and was finished in 1738. The aqueduct provided water to the people and the water flowed to the different fountains of the city. There are 74 massive arches that can be seen miles away. \n\nRMS

672856896.name: Live music and nice place
672856896.author: a TripAdvisor user
672856896.reviewBody: In this nice place always you can see or find something interesting.  There is live music coming from the restaurants and the place is very active.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

669041669.name: A good experience
669041669.author: a TripAdvisor user
669041669.reviewBody: We enjoyed walking around this plaza.  This is really a historic place.  Beautiful buildings and very nice restaurants.  Many people hanging around and some venders too.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

662314003.name: Not your typical main square
662314003.author: a TripAdvisor user
662314003.reviewBody:
Did you notice the difference?  Did you?  Unlike nearly all other Mexican main squares, this Plaza de Armas is NOT surrounded by four streets open to traffic, NOR does it have a church or cathedral, NOR a kiosk!  Here, you will find the Government Palace where the independence of the country would begin.  

It is surrounded by colonial houses from the seventeenth to the eighteenth centuries.  It is worth noting that this square has also been named: "Plaza Mayor", "Plaza de Arriba", "Plaza del Corregidor ","Plaza de los Perros" and "Plaza de la Independencia ".

More to be enjoyed by pedestrians, less by cars.  From early birds to night owls, a good place to sit, listen, watch, and remember this country's history.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

657925243.name: Delightful shady plaza
657925243.author: a TripAdvisor user
657925243.reviewBody: We were told the name was changed to Plaza de Independencia although the map still refers to it as Armas.    Lots of shade, fountains, street vendors and restaurants all around it as well as the Governors Palace.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

655421898.name: Leafy square
655421898.author: a TripAdvisor user
655421898.reviewBody: Such a Spanish style and well preserved square maybe common in Mexico, but this is a particularly beautiful one. The trees have grown together and been trimmed square, making a beautiful edge and home for many birds. Excellent and high end restaurants rim the edges, each with their own style. At night, the lights on the buildings make this wondrous. You could be in Europe. There are many folks from poorer parts of the country offering their wares, so be prepared.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

655295384.name: Beautiful old historic city
655295384.author: a TripAdvisor user
655295384.reviewBody: This is a beautiful old historic city.  Wonderful buildings with unbelievable architectural charm of old - religious buildings, government, churches, shopping and restaurants - everything you need within walking distance!

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

648353420.name: very charming plaza
648353420.author: a TripAdvisor user
648353420.reviewBody: Plaza de Armas is wonderful to spend an evening people watching and/or having anything from a cocktail, casual meal, or romantic meal.  Lots of options around the plaza.  Live music in the evenings too at a couple of the restaurants.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

647886112.name: Good restaurants and activities.
647886112.author: a TripAdvisor user
647886112.reviewBody: It was enjoyable. Good people watching and food. Several restaurants, performers and vendors in the area.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

642127271.name: Nice place
642127271.author: a TripAdvisor user
642127271.reviewBody: Nice plaza centrally located with upscale restaurants and hotels. Pleasant, small with good places to eat and drink.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

638682514.name: Such a pretty plaza!
638682514.author: a TripAdvisor user
638682514.reviewBody: Just sit...for a short break or an afternoon.  Enjoy the sun or the shaded places.  Watch the pigeons drink from the fountain...the children play...young and old people strolling hand in hand...the good scents from the many restaurants close by.  A good place to soak up the essence of Queretaro just about any time of the day or night.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

628611745.name: Nice plaza to sit and rest
628611745.author: a TripAdvisor user
628611745.reviewBody: There are three restaurants on the plaza where you can have a drink and watch plaza life, two of them play music (not at the same time) and one belongs to a good hotel - the two with music are better than the hotel restaurant.\n\nThe plaza has a good nativity for Christmas and displays for the day of the dead.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

618426680.name: Great place to watch the endless parade of people
618426680.author: a TripAdvisor user
618426680.reviewBody: The  Plaza de Armas, in Queretaro City, Mexico has the historic plaza that is perfect for  watching the endless parade of people, all the while you eat delicious ice cream or Mexican sweet bread for the nearby shops!

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

598595788.name: Beatifull place
598595788.author: a TripAdvisor user
598595788.reviewBody: I went ther to this plaza, the people gather here just for hang out, its not too big but you can have a pice of history

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

598031370.name: Very nice coty
598031370.author: a TripAdvisor user
598031370.reviewBody: Plenty to see, the buildings are beautiful, and the churches are something you must walk in and see. There is one almost on every corner. I felt safe the whole time, and lots of great street vendors.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

594754386.name: Great place to start a visit to Querertaro
594754386.author: a TripAdvisor user
594754386.reviewBody:
Restful benches under shaded trees.
Street music. 
People watching. 
Easy to walk in the area. 

Impressed with the cleanliness of the city.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

586839530.name: Fascinating historical location
586839530.author: a TripAdvisor user
586839530.reviewBody: Part of Queretaro\'s independence walking tour. Also a nice shady place to take a walk and people watch. Lots of outdoor cafes and ice cream ships in the area too.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

578708618.name: Plaza de Armas
578708618.author: a TripAdvisor user
578708618.reviewBody:
Sit here to see the time flows. 
Daytime or nightime.
You will enjoy. 
Grab a drink, it can be really hot at day time.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

574019412.name: Part of the Centro historico
574019412.author: a TripAdvisor user
574019412.reviewBody: If you go downtown Queretaro to the Centro Historico, just take a walk, see the different Placas, sit down for a drink or something to eat. Enjoy the time.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

571738048.name: Great place to hang out
571738048.author: a TripAdvisor user
571738048.reviewBody: Center of the Centro Historico, very pleasant to sit, read, hang out, etc. Lots of restos and bars on the square.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

567567872.name: A lovely, and safe place to sit, day or night!
567567872.author: a TripAdvisor user
567567872.reviewBody: A lovely, and safe place to sit and visit, day or night! Basically anywhere within the Historical District is safe day or night. Always something going on here, whether vendors, musicians, dancers, concerts, etc. Restaurants surround the Plaza, as well as alleys full of vendors and artists, varying depending on the day of the week.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

565367216.name: Beautiful spot to relax
565367216.author: a TripAdvisor user
565367216.reviewBody: This small plaza is filled with large Indian Laurel trees so it is quite shady. A perfect spot to sit, relax and people watch. Most evenings there are various sorts of entertainment groups that are really quite good. Sunday nights there is a big screen showing recorded concerts. You might, also, decide to eat in one of the great restaurant \nS that line the plaza.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

564720396.name: Diversity is visiting Plaza de Armas
564720396.author: a TripAdvisor user
564720396.reviewBody: If you want to learn more about the people that live in Queretaro and the curious visitors, do not hesitate to stop by Plaza de Armas. Beyond a beautiful historical place you will find diversity and inclusion. Locals and tourists gather in this place to chat and have fan in a leisurely manner. Loose yourself in the esplanade surrounded by nostalgic colonial buildings, specialty stores and restaurants. Listen to the birds, the bustle of people, and ocasional street musicians. An afternoon in Plaza de Armas is something you can\u2019t miss.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

563617763.name: Quiet, romantic, historic plaza
563617763.author: a TripAdvisor user
563617763.reviewBody: We didn\'t spend much time there, but is certainly a nice plaza for a romantic stroll.   Seems fairly safe also.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

558460732.name: The way Mexico used to be
558460732.author: a TripAdvisor user
558460732.reviewBody: Very nice place to take family or visitors, walk around the park, the streets. Drink coffee across the street, buy a few things from the vendors.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

550095386.name: Lovely walkable area
550095386.author: a TripAdvisor user
550095386.reviewBody: Lovely area extremely walkable to see the colonial buildings up close. Nice restaurants, gardens to enjoy this concentrated area.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

539302451.name: Great Plaza
539302451.author: a TripAdvisor user
539302451.reviewBody: Nice relaxing plaza with beautiful buildings surrounding and a very nice fountain.  There are some inviting restaurants around but I did not visit any of them.  Few places to kick back and relax in the shade and watch the world go by.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

534641258.name: Very nice place with history
534641258.author: a TripAdvisor user
534641258.reviewBody: I have been there a couple of times and there is always some activity, either musicians, artist in general, shows. Nice restaurants with traditional food. Having dinner in one of the terraces of these restaurants is a wonderful experience. From here you can walk down the narrow Libertad street and find stands selling local handcraft. Wonderful place.
