address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

525241474.name: Great square for live music
525241474.author: a TripAdvisor user
525241474.reviewBody: We stopped at a bar in this square as we fancied a sit down and a drink away from the crowds on Friday night. We stopped at a bar with live music, until we realised the guy was singing but pretending to play the guitar. It was kind of amusing, I think the bar was called Parajes. The plaza was filled with music and the atmosphere was friendly and lots of locals were out. Great plaza for a restaurant or drink, live music and a great vibe. Just avoid the cocktails at the bar we tried. The margharitas were overly salty and the mojito had no mint. They also handwrote a total on the $245 bill of $290!!! 1 - cheeky and 2 you didn\'t earn such a tip! Try this square, avoid this bar.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

524083294.name: My favorite fountain
524083294.author: a TripAdvisor user
524083294.reviewBody: I love this plaza. It has two of the best restaurants in  Queretaro at one end. The fountain has four dogs on the corners. The water comes out of their mouths. Very nice. There is music and sometimes magicians in the plaza every night. Very safe, also

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

508842666.name: Very nice downtown square
508842666.author: a TripAdvisor user
508842666.reviewBody: It is a colonial square in the middle of very beautiful buildings and plenty of restaurants and shops in the area. There is locate the government offices that can be visited where the independe of Mexico was planned.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

508555656.name: Lovely Little Plaza!
508555656.author: a TripAdvisor user
508555656.reviewBody: This is such a lovely little plaza with nice shade trees and fountains. There are some really good restaurants around the plaza. I highly recommend El Meson de Chucho El Roto. There are street musicians that can be good or annoying. Lots of artisanal goods around.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

504471259.name: Great place to relax
504471259.author: a TripAdvisor user
504471259.reviewBody: Queretaro is full of history and from the plaza you can visit many historical places. Lots of shade, food and shopping all around. Night time brings the street vendors with many items to choose from. Great restaurants all around and within walking distance. This is a must visit place in Queretaro.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

501277904.name: To know more about Queretaro\'s and Mexico history
501277904.author: a TripAdvisor user
501277904.reviewBody: It is a beautiful square where you can learn a lot about Mexico Independence, the old houses are beautiful and full of histories. Make sure to take the legends tours as well. there are also good restaurants where you can try very good mexican food. Or small cafes to enjoy the view and the music.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

499766201.name: Wonderful place to visit
499766201.author: a TripAdvisor user
499766201.reviewBody: Plaza de Armas is my favorite place in Queretaro to visit. I love the plaza to sit and enjoy watching the people having a wonderful time. I feel like this park is the "heart" of Queretaro.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

489918736.name: Must see
489918736.author: a TripAdvisor user
489918736.reviewBody: Awesome place to just hang out. Go there and buy some cute souveniers and do some site seeing. I\'d opt for a leyends and myths tour as well

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

485492762.name: Queretaro\'s downtown
485492762.author: a TripAdvisor user
485492762.reviewBody:
Plaza de armas is at Queretaro's downtown. This is a beautiful square where you can just sit on a bench and what mexican people perform on the street. Musicians, clowns, mariachis and I even saw some guys from a circus.
The place is very unique.

At night, there are many bars nearby. This is the most active area of Queretaro.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

482134170.name: Very interesting
482134170.author: a TripAdvisor user
482134170.reviewBody: Love the history  in this city and this was no exception.  We visited the site as part of a trolley tour of the city.\nIt was one of the stops.\nI was so glad we took the extended sight seeing tour.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

480477629.name: Cute,little square!
480477629.author: a TripAdvisor user
480477629.reviewBody: This Plaza turned out to be much smaller than I had imagined. There are some great mature trees around the plaza and the famous fountain at the center. Some of the restaurants/cafes looked nice with live music. Gets crowded in the evenings.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

474392417.name: Uniquely clean
474392417.author: a TripAdvisor user
474392417.reviewBody: Great square at the heart of Quer\u00e8taro, very neat and clean, polite people, even street sellers are very gentle.\nGreat place to walk, admire the night life of the city and get a glass of wine or a cup of coffee.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

473039634.name: Relaxing
473039634.author: a TripAdvisor user
473039634.reviewBody: It is a very nice place, you can walk along the streets, there are many shops, many restaurants. It can get crowded, but it is beautiful place

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

469736256.name: Night walk downtown Quer\u00e9taro
469736256.author: a TripAdvisor user
469736256.reviewBody: Just went out for a walk in downtown QRO, we decided to go and visit Plaza de Armas, and the famous Juan Antonio de Urrutia y Arana fountain (builder of the city\'s aqueduct). There are some of the best restaurants near the plaza and they often have live music. Great.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

461202681.name: Our Favorite Site in Queretaro
461202681.author: a TripAdvisor user
461202681.reviewBody: Over the course of the month that we were here, this public square which contains the famous "dog" fountain was an always exciting and bustling center of activity. The most outstanding feature are the beautifully trimmed Ficus trees that stand to attention while providing luxuriant shade to all visitors.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

460267445.name: Romantic Little Plaza
460267445.author: a TripAdvisor user
460267445.reviewBody: Located in the heart of downtown...  We stayed at a beautiful and affordable B&B (El Serafin), so we were literally less than a half of a block from La Plaza de Las Armas.  This plaza made for a very romantic evening stroll (after a fabulous meal at the Indian/Thai restaurant, Bhaji\'s, only three blocks away).  Other activity and music can be found at various other parks a short walk away.  The area had a safe, clean feel also.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

459823627.name: Queretaro\'s Sweet Spot
459823627.author: a TripAdvisor user
459823627.reviewBody: If you want to spend a lively night on the town or a lazy afternoon people watching, Plaza de Armas, is the place to go! Anchored by restaurant El Meson Chucho del Roto, and the Governor\'s office, this charming plaza with lovely architecture never disappoints.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

458457461.name: Charming
458457461.author: a TripAdvisor user
458457461.reviewBody: One of the prettiest squares in a delightful colonial city. Take it in as part of a stroll around downtown. It only takes a few minutes to walk around so more of a pass-by rather than a major destination. A selection of nice restaurants and outdoor coffee shops allow you linger if you choose .\n\n

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

454257655.name: City center
454257655.author: a TripAdvisor user
454257655.reviewBody: This place is the one in the city center. I visited during my business trip in Queretaro. The "print" of Spanish it\'s visible all around in city center. Also statues related to the conquest age as well as most of the buildings in this area. Worth to see.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

451665017.name: The heartbeat of the town
451665017.author: a TripAdvisor user
451665017.reviewBody: There is always something going on at Plaza de Armas. This time, we came across the festive sign of 2017 to welcome the upcoming New Year. It\'s always a good idea to just stop here, sit and get the feeling of old Quer\u00e9taro seep into your veins. A good place to hunt for coffee, a glass of wine or good mexican food as well.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

449691514.name: Fun Place
449691514.author: a TripAdvisor user
449691514.reviewBody: This plaza always has tons of people in it! A lot of history here and some excellent restaurants with live music. Very safe at night.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

446819760.name: Great Place
446819760.author: a TripAdvisor user
446819760.reviewBody: This place is great..we had teenagers with us and they had great fun taking pictures and going to all the vendors around the Plaza seeing all the different Nick Naks that they had. It felt safe as well if you know what I mean.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

441236015.name: Beautiful place
441236015.author: a TripAdvisor user
441236015.reviewBody: One of most beautiful places in Queretaro. If you want to spent some time sitting in the shade watching locals and tourists going around, or have a good coffee, food or drink, shop, listen to the live music... this is the place. Love it!

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

436378196.name: "Beautiful Square"
436378196.author: a TripAdvisor user
436378196.reviewBody: Queretaro, MX is an historic town with lots of site, churches, stores and lots of different types of vendors and locals to inter-act with. Very colorful and lots to see and do. The people are amazing and also has ton\'s of different of restaurants which give lots of different choices.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

436017620.name: Pretty plaza in the midst of things...
436017620.author: a TripAdvisor user
436017620.reviewBody: Queretaro\'s historic center is a fun place to walk around and eat and visit the historic sites.  The Plaza de Armas is a pleasant spot in the middle of things to rest for awhile, have a drink, people watch.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

432221666.name: Folk Dancing on the Square
432221666.author: a TripAdvisor user
432221666.reviewBody: This past weekend we were walking around Old Town Queretaro when we heard this wonderful music coming from our destination.  As we emerged on the Plaza de Armas a folk dancing festival was in full swing.  And this went on all day.  Every two hours a different show...not just folk dancing.  We drew the limit at the comedy show as our Spanish is very limited but this surely where the action is!

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

430746571.name: Very pleasant atmosphere!
430746571.author: a TripAdvisor user
430746571.reviewBody: We got there twice to have dinner, the place is really enjoyable with music and very good restaurants , is a piece of the past, with old building and if you are to walk around you can find amazing church\'s with thousand year of history and very well kept.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

429724875.name: Great spot for people watching!
429724875.author: a TripAdvisor user
429724875.reviewBody: Each time I go to Queretaro I always make time to spend a little time at the Plaza de Armas.  It\'s great for people watching and soaking up the local culture.  It can get quite lively in the evenings over the weekend. There are a couple of good restaurants on the square that I enjoy eating at.  Overall, the Plaza is a great place to relax.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

428245338.name: The heart of the city
428245338.author: a TripAdvisor user
428245338.reviewBody: Here is where everything happen... A really good place to walk, to read a book or simply watch the local people.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

427079827.name: Great place to sit and enjoy afternoon
427079827.author: a TripAdvisor user
427079827.reviewBody: Every Hispanic city has Plaza de Armas (Plaza Major). This one is not the biggest I have seen but definitely one of the most enjoyable. It is great place to sit down after busy day and enjoy end of the day.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

426657976.name: With staying all day
426657976.author: a TripAdvisor user
426657976.reviewBody: This is the typical Mexico square with benches under trees but the difference is that it\'s beautiful, clean, full of life all day and until small hours of the morning. It\'s safe, has free wifi and is surrounded by cafes and craft stalls. So take a book, get a coffee and watch the world go by. Stay at Santa Rosa hotel (on square) and eat there or a 1810 restaurant.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

426256881.name: Lovely and lively
426256881.author: a TripAdvisor user
426256881.reviewBody: Plaza de Armas is a pedestrian square with a central fountain and lovely shade trees.  It\'s a wonderful place to people-watch from one of many cafes and restaurants that line the square.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

419333159.name: Very nice
419333159.author: a TripAdvisor user
419333159.reviewBody: Went with a 2 years old. had a great time. Bought some great artistic stuff and Mexican hand made in good price

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

416502294.name: The spitting dogs
416502294.author: a TripAdvisor user
416502294.reviewBody: Better known locally as the "spitting dogs" plaza, this charming site is a great place to people watch.  Several nice restaurants and art galleries nearby.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

409745072.name: Gardens, fountains, restaurants and live music
409745072.author: a TripAdvisor user
409745072.reviewBody: Families and tourists sit alongside gardens listening to music and watching children playing. A wonderful place to rest for awhile while enjoying the town.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

409714447.name: The must-to-visit place when in Queretaro City
409714447.author: a TripAdvisor user
409714447.reviewBody: This is the main place of Queretaro City. It is surrounded by legendary buildings including the State Government Palace and the De la Villa del Villar Marquis statue in the main fountain. Villa del Villar Marquis financed the Queretaro Acueduct as a response of his love to a nun of the La Cruz Convent.  The Plaza de Armas Place is also flanqued by cofeterias and nice restaurants to enjoy local cuisine. The Chucho El Roto and the 1810 restaurants offer non-spicy food so foreign visitors can have any meal witout hot chilli. Of course If you like to taste chilli just ask your waiter,\nYou may chose these nice hotels to stay. Meson de Santa Rosa (at the Plaza de Armas) or Antiguo Meson de Aspeytia (Excellent Choice) and 3 blocks from Plaza de Armas

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

407904138.name: Excellent Restaurants located in the Plaza
407904138.author: a TripAdvisor user
407904138.reviewBody: We ate at two restaurants on different days at the Plaza: Chucho El Roto (Classic Mexican Food - Great Steaks and some delicacies ("Escamoles" Mexican Caviar (ant eggs) and "Chapulines" (Grass Hoppers)) The service is friendly and outside there are dueling piano players. Next Door to Chucho\'s is 1851 a restaurant with a very similar menu and the other piano player. The ambiance was friendly and most attentive. We were waited on by at least four different waiters and the maitre d\'h\u00f4tel who made sure that we wanted for nothing! Both restaurants offered an excellent experience and food and beverages were TOP QUALITY!!

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

405481791.name: Where the town takes care
405481791.author: a TripAdvisor user
405481791.reviewBody: All about the city of Queretaro is great. Its safe, clean and there is always something happening there. Irs great to spend a day in QRO!

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

404577876.name: Relax and history
404577876.author: a TripAdvisor user
404577876.reviewBody: If you\'re going to Queretaro you can\'t miss this spot is a beautiful and small plaza with lush trees and good restaurants and you can hire some guys that are on the plaza to tell you the history about this place.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

399365590.name: The Heart of Queretaro
399365590.author: a TripAdvisor user
399365590.reviewBody: What great fun it is to stroll around Plaza de Armas particularly on a weekend night. The central areas in Mexican towns and cities present some of what is best about this country. Individuals, couples, and families all gather to celebrate community in towns small and large. By far, in all of my travels around Mexico, the "dog" fountain of Plaza de Armas is one of my favorites. Great care has been given to the manicured trees still leaving plenty of open space with seating for people watching. Street musicians and entertainers provide evening diversions after a day at work.  Whatever you call it, the plaza, zocalo, or parque central, these public spaces are the heart of most towns because that\'s where the community comes together. In fact, Queretaro has three delightful plazas close together in the centro historico.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

398630024.name: Probably the closest to being the heart of Mexico
398630024.author: a TripAdvisor user
398630024.reviewBody: Right in front of Plaza de Armas is located La Casa de La Corregidora which was the centre of intelligence of the Mexican War of Independence that started out in Dolores, near Guanajuato. From Plaza de Armas you can get to most historic attractions in Queretaro and also chill out at night in one of the many restaurants around this area.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

398561767.name: Charming, historic
398561767.author: a TripAdvisor user
398561767.reviewBody: Charming plaza - great place to just sit, relax and people watch.  Several nice restaurants and art galleries nearby.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

393518884.name: Epicenter of your walks in Quer\u00e9taro
393518884.author: a TripAdvisor user
393518884.reviewBody: Lovely plaza, my favorite in the city with the most beautiful fountain. There are restaurants and coffee shops around it. The restaurants with the best view are not necessarily the ones with the best food though. Buy a coffee somewhere else and go seat in the plaza in the morning as you plan your tour plan for the day. You can walk to any site from Plaza de Arrmas. The best free wifi signal in a public space in the city is in Plaza de Armas.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

390005718.name: Nice suroundings
390005718.author: a TripAdvisor user
390005718.reviewBody: A must see when in Queretaro, the Independence square has lovely buildings around and an overall chill atmosphere. Museums and cafes around.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

389725561.name: Great Relaxing atmosphere
389725561.author: a TripAdvisor user
389725561.reviewBody: This place is very quaint quiet and very relaxing...you see people strolling and can meet people from just any where ..you can eat or just observe...have a drink and can even shop if you like ...people are very friendly...

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

386979738.name: Visit
386979738.author: a TripAdvisor user
386979738.reviewBody: Nice walking to enjoy, you can go to Ray some  crepas or a good outside of caf\u00e9 or restaurant it is very joyfull in Quer\u00e9taro.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

382618811.name: Beautiful Plaza in the center of the historic section
382618811.author: a TripAdvisor user
382618811.reviewBody: Plaza de Armas is a very nice and clean historic plaza.It is surrounded by small shops, restaurants and bars. Some are rated the very best in Queretaro. This is in the historical district and there is lots to see during your walking tour.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

379018860.name: Beautiful Romantic square
379018860.author: a TripAdvisor user
379018860.reviewBody: It\'s one of the best and romantic locations in Quer\u00e9taro, you can go there and listen music and get to know a littler more about M\u00e9xico. It\'s common to find concerts or expositions there.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

376239611.name: Relaxing and safe park
376239611.author: a TripAdvisor user
376239611.reviewBody: A wonderful relaxing and safe park in the middle of Queretaro.\nFree WiFi and the perfect place to people watch.  Sundays are hectic but that is Mexico...Family day.  You will never see such a heart warming spectacle as a Mexican family out together for the day!

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

375958221.name: Serene
375958221.author: a TripAdvisor user
375958221.reviewBody: Ah, the vibe of this place is awesome: always live music from restaurants; lots of seats in the shade; street performers.  An oaisis.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

371926071.name: Always lots going on here
371926071.author: a TripAdvisor user
371926071.reviewBody: This is a fun place to hang out with different music groups performing, music from two restaurants, and other unexpected delights.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

370201800.name: Comfortable plaza away from hussle of central area
370201800.author: a TripAdvisor user
370201800.reviewBody: Quiet little square off the main streets of central Queretaro. Great for people watching and relaxing.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

367208020.name: Well, it\'s a plaza with a fountain.
367208020.author: a TripAdvisor user
367208020.reviewBody: There is some history here, and it\'s surrounded by old government buildings.  But mostly it\'s surrounded by over-priced, poor quality restaurants.  You are much better off eating at, almost, any restaurant NOT by Plaza de Armas.\n\nThe fountain does have puppies as water spouts, so that\'s worth seeing.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

360335491.name: Historic Queretaro
360335491.author: a TripAdvisor user
360335491.reviewBody: Queretaro was key in Mexico\'s independence. There is a lot to see as you walk around the Plaza. Enjoy the colonial buildings and the charm of this area. There are many restaurants, museums, and cultural events going on here.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

356687940.name: Relax, listen to music, eat and drink
356687940.author: a TripAdvisor user
356687940.reviewBody: There are so many plazas in Queretaro but this is one of the best. Several pedestrian only callejons converge here. It is a large plaza and in the middle is a funky fountain featuring dogs. Around the edge are restaurants.and everywhere are people watching benches in sun or shade. Kids play, lovers caress, people sell their wares,  and old men and women like we are just enjoy being among happy people. Every town should have a gathering place like this,

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

355411374.name: A delight to the senses!
355411374.author: a TripAdvisor user
355411374.reviewBody: I LOVE Quer\u00e9taro, and this square is at the heart of it. Surrounded by restaurants and coffee shops, filled with families and couples and musicians, flowers blooming all around....this park delights your senses in every way! You can drink a nice strong caf\u00e9 con leche while reading your emails (wireless is available in every park in the city!), or you can order a delicious meal while listening to guitarists play. You can stop by the delightful fountain decorated with dogs with water streaming out of their mouths, and watch the families walking their own dogs! Or you can just sit on a bench, smell the lavender all around you, and wonder why every town does not have a square like this one.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

354448352.name: Nice, clean plaza surrounded by restaurants
354448352.author: a TripAdvisor user
354448352.reviewBody: Several of the restaurants surrounding this plaza have music so it is nice to sit and enjoy even if you are not patronizing one of them.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

352627860.name: The most beautiful plaza of the city!
352627860.author: a TripAdvisor user
352627860.reviewBody: During christmas time they had decorated this plaza with huge amount of poinsettias. The whole plaza was breath taking beautiful. It\'s nice just to sit down and watch people passing by or teenagers gathering around the statue. Or maybe grab a bite in a nearby restaurant.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

349821611.name: Very Nice Plaza in Mexico\'s Independence crib.
349821611.author: a TripAdvisor user
349821611.reviewBody: I walked this place with my parents. We took a few pictures and had lunch there at one of the restaurants. There was a live music performance and the ambience was very relaxed.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

346738058.name: A lovely colonial plaza, in the heart of the UNESCO centro
346738058.author: a TripAdvisor user
346738058.reviewBody: Plaza de Armas is one of the three or four most charming spots in Queretaro.  There are several tourist-y restaurants/bars bracketing it, and the Governor\'s Palace dominating one side.  Radiating outward from it are several Aztec/Chichimec pedestrian alleys with various carts selling jewelry and clothing, as well as Cinco de Mayo, the city\'s main party avenue.  It\'s a great place to start your exploration of the city.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

346309668.name: Iconic plaza in UNESCO centre
346309668.author: a TripAdvisor user
346309668.reviewBody: The Plaza de Armas is one of the many squares in the centre of Queretaro with fountains, trees and free wifi! At Armas there is also the iconic \'QUERETARO\' sign made in colourful 10\u2019 pieces. Well worth a visit. Some really excellent restaurants around the square also, including the Meson de Santa Rosa.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

340701731.name: Great place to sit and watch a little bit of Mexico
340701731.author: a TripAdvisor user
340701731.reviewBody: Plaza de Armas is in the old city part of Queretaro.  It is a lively place from early morning until night.  Good restaurants surround the plaza.  Great to enjoy some good mexican food or to have a drink or two and watch the world go by.  Colorful people, street musicians, etc.  A place I\'m comfortable and feel safe as an American often traveling by myself or with one or two others from my company.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

340426549.name: Well, it is like any other Plaza de Armas...
340426549.author: a TripAdvisor user
340426549.reviewBody: Unless you\'re a Historian with a MA or PhD in Quer\u00e9taro, it does not seem to be a useful place. It is like many Plaza de Armas, it stated something about political power and that is that.\nYes, many people use it like public garden to gather together and walk or talk or meet. Well, that\'s it.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

337374779.name: Nice, little plaza in downtown Quer\u00e9taro
337374779.author: a TripAdvisor user
337374779.reviewBody: Very well preserved (as the rest of downtown Quer\u00e9taro), surrounded by many cafes and restaurants, and with one of the main attractions in the City: la "Casa de la Corregidora", a must-visit when in Quer\u00e9taro. And whether it is day or night, one may find a beautiful spot to stay and/or take a good photo!

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

337115176.name: Lovely plaza
337115176.author: a TripAdvisor user
337115176.reviewBody: Trimmed laurel trees line this very orderly plaza.  It is/was surrounded by prestigious mansions, government offices, hotels, and restaurants.  A bit staid for my taste.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

334945318.name: Few cities in Mexico have such a well preserve historical district, not a single paper on the streets,
334945318.author: a TripAdvisor user
334945318.reviewBody: At the center of the square the Marquis de la Villa del Villar del Aguila is honored with a monument, the trees (cotton wooods) are trimmed, the buildings and houses around it at of noble proportions, some with lovely baroque details. The atmosphere is placid.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

334518244.name: Beautifully decorated during Christmas time plaza
334518244.author: a TripAdvisor user
334518244.reviewBody: I went to see plaza during Christmas holidays and was surprised by the way fountain and trees were decorated with hand made dools. Wery nice plaza surrounded by beautiful trees.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

331907313.name: Nice central plaza with historic murals
331907313.author: a TripAdvisor user
331907313.reviewBody: Step inside the local government building to see the murals of Mexican history.  Recommend megusta segway tour to get here or just walk.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

330427122.name: Such a nice time
330427122.author: a TripAdvisor user
330427122.reviewBody: My friend and I decided to stop by this place to eat a sunday afternoon. What a surprise when we heard this band singing and make people around dance! The place is clean, there are restaurants, little shops, fountains, statues, etc. This is really a lovely place with good animations!

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

330186299.name: beautiful
330186299.author: a TripAdvisor user
330186299.reviewBody: this park is one of the most beautiful is in the center, and you have a lot of restaurants near of this.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

328061082.name: Lovely place to enjoy an evening or afternoon stroll.
328061082.author: a TripAdvisor user
328061082.reviewBody: This is a lovely historical place where you can walk, visit a restaurant, have a drink or visit some of the shops. At night there are many street vendors and singers. Sometimes there are acrobats. When it is really busy sometimes you become overwhelmed with sellers of tourist items but at night when the buildings are lit it is a romantic scene.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

326584248.name: A safe place for an afternoon walk
326584248.author: a TripAdvisor user
326584248.reviewBody: Familiar environment, relax and peaceful, you can sit there and chat. The plaza offers free wifi, for me was great because I was traveling from Texas and I didn\'t have service.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

326202144.name: Business
326202144.author: a TripAdvisor user
326202144.reviewBody: Beautiful area with lots of history but make sure you get a walking tour so you get the best explanations of what you are seeing. The tour is more fun later in the evening.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

325923138.name: The heart of Queretaro
325923138.author: a TripAdvisor user
325923138.reviewBody: Is a must when visiting the city. Here is where the main things happen. Good restaurants offer. Not so easy to find a parking lot, only a few.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

325826337.name: Tourist destination and lots of restaurants
325826337.author: a TripAdvisor user
325826337.reviewBody: Town square with lots of people, shoe polish service and beautiful historic colonial buildings and churches. Pretty relaxing. Lots of restaurants in the area. Music at night. Buildings well maintained and nostalgic.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

322490172.name: Historic place
322490172.author: a TripAdvisor user
322490172.reviewBody: The colonial and beautiful city of Queretaro has many attractions for tourists from all over.   The Plaza de Armas is one of the most picturesque sites downtown Queretaro.  It is surrounded by very charming restaurants two of which offer excellent food: Chucho el Roto and "1810".

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

320502295.name: Great Plaza with Fantastic Restaurants.
320502295.author: a TripAdvisor user
320502295.reviewBody: We at breakfast at Chucho el Roto in Plaza de Armas.  It was fantastic and the views, landscaping and proximity to everything downtown was delightful.  Would definitely walk the plaza and all neighboring streets and churches in Queretaro.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

319853675.name: absolutely beautiful
319853675.author: a TripAdvisor user
319853675.reviewBody: I was taken here while on business by a coworker from the area for dinner.  It is definitely a must see if you are in Quertaro.  There are several restaurants and shops.  The architecture, statues and fountains are beautiful.  I was fortunate enough to be there during the week of Mexico Independence day, so it was decorated as well.  I was there in September, and I am back in Queretaro now (November) and I am definitely going back again and taking coworkers who are here for the first time.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

318979819.name: Hystorical sight
318979819.author: a TripAdvisor user
318979819.reviewBody: This is a very special site. Here is where one can say Mexico begins; on one of it\'s sides you can found Corregidora\'s house where Independence meetings where held 200 years ago.\nYou can also find a lot of shops and restaurants. This is a great place for walking tours

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

316578620.name: Pleasant for a rest.
316578620.author: a TripAdvisor user
316578620.reviewBody: Very beautiful and very cool (literally!) in the shade. A wonderful place to watch the world go by and maybe enjoy a coffee.  Great little markets too full with all kinds of interesting crafts and artisan work.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

315719663.name: Mexico\'s Pride
315719663.author: a TripAdvisor user
315719663.reviewBody: After 15 years+ of traveling to Mexico - we finally had the opportunity to experience Mexico\'s Independence celebrations and chose Queretaro.  On the night of the 15th of Septiembre, the Governor gives the "El Grito" or a repeat of the original "Cry for Independence" and this is followed by a large fireworks display.  A real family experience for the citizens of Mexico!

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

313217808.name: Close to everything
313217808.author: a TripAdvisor user
313217808.reviewBody: All Mexican cities have their typical main square called Zocalo; but the peculiarity of Querretaro is that there are 4 of them just a few steps away from each other. And plaza de armas is just one of them. The difference is that this place is completely surrounded by average restaurants, with waiters almost grabbing your arm to convince you to sit down and eat or drink something. Although Queretaro is one of the best and cheapest places to eat in Mexico, I suggest you keep walking until you reach Plaza de la Independencia qhere you\'ll find 2 of the best restaurants in all of Mexico.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

307317719.name: Great place to stay a couple of hours and drink a coffee
307317719.author: a TripAdvisor user
307317719.reviewBody: There are some nice restaurants and cafes on Plaza de Arma, definetely take a couple of hours here and have dinner or supper. Very nice and clean place.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

305104524.name: Pretty Plaza anchored by the Fuente de los Perros
305104524.author: a TripAdvisor user
305104524.reviewBody: Queretaro\'s main attraction is a quaint plaza with lots of bustling activity.  In the middle is the esteemed "Fuente de los Perros" (Fountain of the Dogs".  The restaurants are tourist traps and you\'re better off venturing a few blocks away for better options.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

297684094.name: Recommended
297684094.author: a TripAdvisor user
297684094.reviewBody: Really nice plaza surrounded by many caf\u00e9s and restaurants ! \nIt\'s a really nice place to walk around and get to experience Queretaro\'s downtown.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

297538740.name: My favorite fountain with 4 little dogs!
297538740.author: a TripAdvisor user
297538740.reviewBody: The cutest little fountain with 4 little dogs providing the water!  Its a great place to come and sit and people watch.  In the evening there are Marachis around playing music.  Also there are many free concerts in the square.  Sometimes there are protests or rallys outside the government offices, but I have never seen any problems and there appear to be many police keeping order.  There is free wireless here as well making this a great place to pass the time and check in with family at home.  In the night, there are lots of families and couples walking so I always felt safe.  There is also a Santander ATM here if you have a Bank of America account you can get cash out without paying fee.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

295143862.name: FUN AND HISTORY AT PLAZA DE ARMAS FOR SURE!
295143862.author: a TripAdvisor user
295143862.reviewBody: Lots of fun people, music and great restaurants! I loved the tours at night with all the actors and legends of Queretaro old homes folklore. Great food and music to dance as well!

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

293265950.name: A nice place to stroll
293265950.author: a TripAdvisor user
293265950.reviewBody: The Plaza is in the downtown area of Queretaro and seems to be a main area for restaurants and shopping. There was a Jazz Festival going on while we were there. Very nice and kept very clean.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

288387123.name: A nice plaza in Queretaro\'s downtown
288387123.author: a TripAdvisor user
288387123.reviewBody: Plaza de Armas is a small and pretty plaza in Queretaro\u2019s downtown. There are things going on pretty much every week, month at very least (small expos, music presentations, etc). The two restaurants that are at the farthest part of the plaza are great places to eat Mexican food (\u201c1810\u201d and \u201cChucho el Roto\u201d). Besides \u201c1810\u201d restaurant, \u201cGaleria Libertad\u201d usually has an art expo going on and there is no entry fee as long as I can remember. Local people like to just seat and watch life go by here.  It\u2019s a great place to go if you are taking a walk downtown.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

288358569.name: Great plaza
288358569.author: a TripAdvisor user
288358569.reviewBody: Quer\u00e9taro has more plazas than I have seen in Mexico.  There was an expo hen i went there and later in the day the teachers were going to come to protest.  We just passed through.  There are nice builldings and fountains.  Great place to have a coffee.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

286615178.name: Nice place to hang around!
286615178.author: a TripAdvisor user
286615178.reviewBody: You can sit there in one of the banches and just see life going around you or enjoy the architecture!

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

286203341.name: Pleasant oasis in the middle of the city
286203341.author: a TripAdvisor user
286203341.reviewBody: A lovely, clean plaza in the Centro Hist\u00f3rico de Quer\u00e9taro. The fountain in the center features four dogs with water coming out of their mouths! Stop by for dinner or cocktails one evening and enjoy the music provided by the restaurant. Pick a restaurant that actually has people in it eating a meal or having a coffee, a cocktail, or a meal. If you\'re able to sit down in their outdoor areas, the people watching is quite entertaining.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

285570554.name: Fantastic atmosphere!
285570554.author: a TripAdvisor user
285570554.reviewBody: You got to experience it, magiic atmosphere, mariachis, food, colors, everything together creates a fantastic seetting

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

282917862.name: Attractive place
282917862.author: a TripAdvisor user
282917862.reviewBody: Ever since my first visit as a school kid in the late 60s, I was impressed by the beauty of this now famous Plaza. The well manicured tres lining the square invite you to go inside one of the several sidewalk bars and restaurants, or simply sit on a bench and watch the world go by

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

259653639.name: Rainy Day
259653639.author: a TripAdvisor user
259653639.reviewBody: We went to the plaza in search of El Meson de Chucho Roto, a restaurant where we enjoyed a lovely Sunday brunch. Because of the rain, which we hadn\'t expected when we planned our trip, I didn\'t see much of the plaza. However, tomorrow it\'s supposed to clear up, and I expect to see this & more of all of the colonial part of Queretaro.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

258757714.name: Lovely Plaza
258757714.author: a TripAdvisor user
258757714.reviewBody: Great place to people watch while having a break or a meal. A hub of the area.\nHad some excellent coffe at El Maron.\n.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

258705988.name: Quaint
258705988.author: a TripAdvisor user
258705988.reviewBody: Very nice quaint plaza and people watch. There is free wifi - a plus! There are many restaurants to choose around. Stores in walking distance. There are gentlemen offering tours (mostly in Spanish only - hard pressed to find English tours). Good place to get your shoes shined and relax.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

257693045.name: Charming, Trendy: must visit!
257693045.author: a TripAdvisor user
257693045.reviewBody: Plaza de Armas is a place that is alive with restaurants, visitors and locals. It has a beautiful fountain in the middle, and restaurants, shops and hotels surround it.  There is always something going on.  Photograph exhibitions, folk music, etc...

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

257691733.name: Something is happening here every night
257691733.author: a TripAdvisor user
257691733.reviewBody: This is a favorite gathering place for families.  There are restaurants and bars alongside the Plaza with live music.  On the weekends, there are often free concerts, and during the day on Saturday there is a farmer\'s market.  It is great place to people watch, drink, dine and shop.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

257145615.name: beautiful place to relax a while
257145615.author: a TripAdvisor user
257145615.reviewBody: This place is good for people watching and sitting a spell. The gardens are lovely, and at night it is (while we were there) transformed into a more lively venue. The only reason it does not get an \'excellent\' from me is the lack of truly good food options. That\'s fairly typical in Mexican central plazas, but it would be nice to have interesting eateries here.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

252836123.name: The Heart of Queretaro
252836123.author: a TripAdvisor user
252836123.reviewBody: This historical square is surrounded by beautiful historical buildings... lovely place, nice people, lovely places to visit, good restaurants around, museums, curiosities... I just love it.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

251532156.name: Great walking
251532156.author: a TripAdvisor user
251532156.reviewBody: Queretaro is one of the most pleasant cities to know in Mexico by walking. Plaza de Armas is very central and is full of attractions, mainly at night, like mariachis, people dancing. There\'s also many restaurants around the Plaza. You need to do this by walking. In each quarter, Queretaro show a new beauty. A very nice and very recommended tour.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

249379264.name: Beautiful square
249379264.author: a TripAdvisor user
249379264.reviewBody: we love to sit at the Cafe Marron and watch life pass in this exquisite square. Where else would you see a fountain with statues of dogs spouting water!

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

248862974.name: Lively and beautiful
248862974.author: a TripAdvisor user
248862974.reviewBody: Queretaro has many plazas but this is definitely one of the most lively. It was bustling at all hours with people wandering through the park in the center and sitting near the dog fountain. Great restaurants line this plaza as well.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

248373238.name: Cute plaza
248373238.author: a TripAdvisor user
248373238.reviewBody: I like the atmosphere of the place the green trees around it and the churches! Lots of places to eat and art to see, a bit hot during the summer time

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

246536476.name: Charming streets, full of life and history
246536476.author: a TripAdvisor user
246536476.reviewBody: This plaza and everything around are just beautiful. It\'s a good option to walk around the streets and find your own way. At every side you will find the beautiful architecture preserved, esculptures, and fountains decorate the historic downtown.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

244871450.name: Meeting point for residents and visitors
244871450.author: a TripAdvisor user
244871450.reviewBody:
Also known as the Plaza de la Independencia, this square is one of the most notable in Querétaro for its location and historical interest.  The Palacio de Gobierno on the north side of the plaza is the ceremonial office of the Governor of Querétaro State and he initiates the festivities of Mexican independence from its balcony on the night of September 15.  In the colonial era, this building was the residence of the Corregidor (Chief Magistrate) of Querétaro and, perhaps more importantly, his wife the Corregidora, who is arguably the most famous woman in modern Mexican history.  She took part on the so-called conspiracy to overthrow Spanish colonial rule in 1810 and is celebrated throughout the city.  Their busts are displayed in the building’s courtyard, where you can also see several dramatic murals depicting Mexican and local history.

The fountain in the center of the Plaza, a favorite meeting point for queretanos and visitors, is popularly referred to as the “dog fountain”, because it features the water-spouting hunting dogs of the gentleman portrayed in the statue, the Marqués de la Villa del Villar del Águila.  He was the nobleman who financed the famous aqueduct of Querétaro (which you can visit on the east side of the city) that brought water to the town center derived from suburban sources.  If you read Spanish, check out the inscriptions on the side of the statue.  You’ll learn not only *exactly* how much the aqueduct cost, but also that the statue of the Marqués placed on the site in the mid-19th century was blown off its pedestal during the siege of Querétaro in 1867.  (For more on that subject, visit the Museo de la Restauración de la República on Calle Guerrero)

All of the buildings surrounding the square are of historical interest.  For a thorough understanding of them, the authoritative guidebook (in Spanish only) is Guía de la Plaza de la Independencia by Beatriz Padilla Siurob, which is available at the nearby bookstore under the portico on Avenida Corregidora next to the Del Sol Department Store.

The restaurants on the south side of the plaza, Chuco El Roto and 1812, are somewhat expensive, but worth the extra cost for an excellent meal served in a delightful location.  The cafes on the east side of the plaza under the portico are great places for coffee, smoothies, and light meals.  All of the cafes offer wifi, but you have to ask the waiter or waitress for the password (clabe in Spanish).

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

243522786.name: Very Good
243522786.author: a TripAdvisor user
243522786.reviewBody: On this Plaza there are always events, really nice restaurant, from this place a street market begins where you can find a lot of gifts.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

241136053.name: Nostalgic beautifully maintained historic square
241136053.author: a TripAdvisor user
241136053.reviewBody: Landscape trees lined the square in old downtown Queretaro. Lots of restaurant with outside seatings. Water fountain featuring dogs. Musicians and performers works for tips. Plenty of place to sit and relax. Buildings are well maintained. Very memorable and authentic place to enjoy he culture.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

239668125.name: Nice plaza
239668125.author: a TripAdvisor user
239668125.reviewBody: Nice place to relax with a drink. Very touristy, ringed with many restaurants , some play good live music. We did not eat here. Recommend eating at places just off tthe plana, such as The Creperie, Fabrica de Chocolate for hot chocolate and Churros, and  the Italian pizzeria next door.\nThere is a nice fountain with benches to sit and relax.\nWorth a visit.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

239275696.name: Like a second home
239275696.author: a TripAdvisor user
239275696.reviewBody:
I have family that lives here, whenever we need a place to gather or unwind in this would be the place. 

Let me paint a picture for you, the centerpiece of the plaza is a fountain, I honestly forgot the name of the person on top so I called it the Dog Fountain because of the 4 dogs around the perimeter. There are benches and stone walls for sitting everywhere, there's the governors building which you can walk around free of charge and learn some of the history that went down inside the walls. On the opposite end of the square are some nice Italian/Mexican restaurants (slightly pricier than average) with live music almost everyday, fantastic musicians.

I've seen live concerts held here, political group gatherings, World Cup viewing parties, Yoga classes, you name it, this place is the nexus for anything cultural.

You're probably asking me "what about the food? or the bathrooms?!?" Glad you asked. Plenty of hidden gem of restaurants through the side roads, I can't recommend a specific one but I can tell you if you whatever you find you will love it. And the bathrooms are located one block over underground in a parking garage, relatively clean and they charge 5 pesos to use it.

Oh and there's an awesome churro shop nearby. That's important to note.

Come, relax and people watch, soak in the culture, you won't regret it.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

233536655.name: little Plaza
233536655.author: a TripAdvisor user
233536655.reviewBody: Hotel Meson Santa Rosa is located here, great hotel. the plaza has restaurants located all the way around with various food choices, the little streets which leave the plaza has fun little stores and on Saturday-Monday the street vendor carts are all out with all kinds of stuff. fun place.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

231654626.name: The Heart of the City
231654626.author: a TripAdvisor user
231654626.reviewBody: There was so much happening at Plaza de Armas where we were there. Music, folkloric dancing, clowns and mimes. There are so many lovely plazas is "el Centro" of this beautiful and historic city. We loved sitting on the benches and people-watching. We look forward to our return to Queretaro.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

226759101.name: PLAZA DE LOS PERROS.
226759101.author: a TripAdvisor user
226759101.reviewBody: Locally known as "Plaza de los Perros" ( Dogs plaza) for the dogs pouring water out of their mouths in the middle of the plaza. This is perhaps one of the most historical places in Queretaro.  The main fountain is dedicated to the duke that ordered the construction of the acueduct.This plaza has one of the main buildings "The house of the Corregidora"  in which the Mexican independence movement was conspired. Bunch of coffee places , exhibitions and an art gallery perfect to spent an afternoon.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

226335246.name: Beautiful Clean Plaza
226335246.author: a TripAdvisor user
226335246.reviewBody: When one wanders around centro Queretaro, the number of super clean plazas really jumps out at you!  Plaza de Aramas is especially nice since there are a couple of restaurants or cafes lining the plaza relax and enjoy.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

217159101.name: Lovely Spot to Enjoy the Day
217159101.author: a TripAdvisor user
217159101.reviewBody: This is one of the most beautiful plazas in the city. Young and old were hanging out here (there\'s also free wifi.) There are several lovely restaurants surrounding the plaza in addition to benches, ice cream vendors etc.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

212855151.name: Relax in the Plazade Armas
212855151.author: a TripAdvisor user
212855151.reviewBody: Mexican cities all have their Plazas. Families go there to pass a pleasant evening outdoors, and couples go there to court. This is the main plaza in the historic center of the city. There are regular musical events, restaurants and vendors. If you don\'t hang out in a plaza, you\'ve missed the real Mexico.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

211772052.name: Pretty spot, fun fountain, performances
211772052.author: a TripAdvisor user
211772052.reviewBody: This is a fun spot to spend some time in.  The colonial building surrounding the gardens set a nice scene.  The fountain is a tribute to the aristocrat who brought water to the city with the aqueduct.  The fun part is that he is accompanied by four hunting dogs spewing water.  There are often staged musical performances here.   On June 23 there was a huge screen projecting the World Cup.  It was great fun to see and hear the crowd cheering on the Mexican team, which won the match over Croatia at 3-1,

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

209000023.name: Peaceful Plaza las Armas
209000023.author: a TripAdvisor user
209000023.reviewBody: The Plaza transports you to the past, you start to imagine how it could be when the Mexican independence days. Very good Restaurants  like Chucho el Roto and 1810 to enjoy the beauty of the plaza.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

208105755.name: Good Restaurants
208105755.author: a TripAdvisor user
208105755.reviewBody: You can find good restaurants such as El Meson de Chucho El Roto, 1810, and Orange at El Meson de Santa Rosa

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

206325784.name: Beautiful!
206325784.author: a TripAdvisor user
206325784.reviewBody: Great place to shop, people watch and eat ... loads of restaurants to choose from, from easy on the wallet, to fine dining,

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

203323762.name: Enjoyed the Plaza
203323762.author: a TripAdvisor user
203323762.reviewBody: The plaza has a lot of activities and one can feel the ambiance of the city. It is best to go in the morning before noon in order to feel the tempo. Many statues of historical heroes of Mexico.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

198818560.name: Plaza de Armas.
198818560.author: a TripAdvisor user
198818560.reviewBody: Historically important plaza surrounded by restaurants and govenment building with great architecture and beauty, including a UNESCO plaque.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

197923604.name: Photo Fest National Geographic
197923604.author: a TripAdvisor user
197923604.reviewBody: We were here when the NatGeo Photo Fest was in display, they\'ve been all over the world and I have seen it in other cities but I was quite disappointed that they had it so small and the lines to get in was reeeeaaallliyyy long. Not the best plaza in the area, try the surroundings where the street performers put up a good show and in the main plaza by the Kiosk every Sunday or holiday the elders go dance Danz\u00f3n, a Mexican tradition in the dying... \n\nThe free internet in the plazas around the Plaza de las Armas is pretty good, fast and reliable. You have to try the elotes, hand made ice-cream and the local candy!!

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

185911688.name: Fun. Different Every Night.
185911688.author: a TripAdvisor user
185911688.reviewBody: Our trip to Queretaro started at Plaza de Armas. We enjoyed meeting my son and his friends there. We enjoyed eating at several of the restaurants on the Plaza. Our last night we enjoyed a Big Band concert sponsored by the Cultural Center. Loved this place, and would definitely hang out there again.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

181706724.name: You won\'t be able to resist not spending hours here!
181706724.author: a TripAdvisor user
181706724.reviewBody: I probably spent more time here than almost anywhere else in Queretaro.  Be it during the day or night I would sit in an outdoor cafe enjoying a latte, arranging the day, or chilling to some live music played everyday.  The plaza has wi-fi, but depending where you sit it can be a little spotty.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

178634980.name: Beautiful square.
178634980.author: a TripAdvisor user
178634980.reviewBody: I was there for the evening of September 15, "El Grito" the cry for independence.  A nice evening with music, mariachis, a small bit of pomp, and fireworks after the cry for independence.  September 8-15 is also the Festival de la Cruz, with costumed dances and drums during the day.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

177728468.name: Centro Experience
177728468.author: a TripAdvisor user
177728468.reviewBody: This is a great starting point to discover Quer\u00e9taro\'s centro. Make sure to venture a little further away from the main plazas in order get the best prices and the most authentic food! You should be able to get a meal, fruit, drink, and may even dessert for around 35 pesos. And, my, is it delicious :)\n\nQuer\u00e9taro is a beautiful city, take it all in and support the locals!

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

175269869.name: Nice walk in Queretaro downtown
175269869.author: a TripAdvisor user
175269869.reviewBody: Nice and clean/safe walk at historic Queretaro, do not miss small restaurants and ice cream boutiques there.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

171123280.name: Beautiful Zocalo
171123280.author: a TripAdvisor user
171123280.reviewBody: 20.59358,-100.39051\nThis is the Zocalo of Queretaro. It contains the Palace of the Government (which you can visit), a statue of the builder of the aqueduct (which is a must see) el marqu\u00e9s de la Villa del Villar del \u00c1guila. It is surrounded by restaurants and cafes and is the entertainment center of Queretaro. Around this plaza are museums, churches, gardens and theaters. It is really fun to be at. Not far from there, west, is the Art Garden (Jardin Zenea) another center of entertainment and close to this, on street north, is the departure of tours for the city and its surroundings such as Pena de Bernal, Freixenet, San Sebastian de Bernal, Tequisquiapan etc. To the south is the Alameda but check the schedule. Close to the Plaza de las Armas is a Tienguis, a flea market, where you will find practically anything you desire.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

169800731.name: Site of history
169800731.author: a TripAdvisor user
169800731.reviewBody: In downtown Queretaro this Plaza is a perfect tourist destination, a place to walk, sit on one of the multiple caf\u00e9s and restaurants, or as a starting point for the car tours of the city. The surrounding buildings are very well kept, and a beautiful sight.\nRegarding the restaurants, this plaza\'s sites are good and usually go beyond the regular tourist traps. 1817 or El Meson de Chucho el Roto are two really good choices for a gourmet meal. One block away, you can find Alda Caf\u00e9, for a nice spot with fresh salads, good coffee and deserts.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

169682718.name: The center of the colonial city
169682718.author: a TripAdvisor user
169682718.reviewBody: The Plaza de Armas is surrounded by restaurants, hotels, art vendors and the state government offices. Demonstrations are almost as common as concerts. Most of the municipal parks in Queretaro (downtown) have free WiFi. It is a great place for watching people, drinking coffee or having a meal.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

164618419.name: Beautiful Square
164618419.author: a TripAdvisor user
164618419.reviewBody: Lovely oasis in the old town surrounded by beautiful colonial architecture and some pretty good restaurants.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

156545822.name: Beautiful and quaint
156545822.author: a TripAdvisor user
156545822.reviewBody: A must see in downtown Queretaro. Downtown is small enough to see it all in less than 2 hours. Plaza de Armas is a nice starting point for taking a nice walk around town.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

155590491.name: Nice place to hang out
155590491.author: a TripAdvisor user
155590491.reviewBody: There are two excellent restaurants at one end, and several cafes along the arcades. There is often a concert and the square is filled with lively activity.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

155288666.name: Excellent place for walk, eat and have a good time
155288666.author: a TripAdvisor user
155288666.reviewBody: Very nice view, it\u00b4s to close to many good restaurants and attractions like "The house of Josefa Ort\u00edz de Dominguez" but the best is the safety and quiet of the place.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

155105843.name: Beautiful!!!
155105843.author: a TripAdvisor user
155105843.reviewBody: Colonial style, amazing just at the historic center, easy to get by taxy, close to buy souvenirs and eat

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

154094092.name: So Much To Do
154094092.author: a TripAdvisor user
154094092.reviewBody: This plaza has many restaurants, shops and outdoor craft vendors.  Locals come here to socialize and hang out.  It\'s a very lively atmosphere.  Some restaurants have small bands playing. There seem to be festivals of some sort each weekend.  The place gets very crowded. Parking can be difficult, but walk the few blocks and enjoy the area.  No doubt you\'ll find a good place to eat, some souvenirs, and great people watching.  Enjoy!

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

150212084.name: Quintessential Queretaro
150212084.author: a TripAdvisor user
150212084.reviewBody: La Plaza de Armas is Queretaro in a nutshell. Great atmosphere and such, but the people are really nice too. We met some kids there that I still keep in touch with on Facebook.\n\nFree wifi here too.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

148866126.name: Central walking park of Queretaro
148866126.author: a TripAdvisor user
148866126.reviewBody: This place is stuffed with history, great restaurants and bars.  Try to visit during a weekend and enjoy the shopping of inexpensive souveniers.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

147858411.name: Very nice square!
147858411.author: a TripAdvisor user
147858411.reviewBody: Excellent square, lots of places to seat and nice coffee shops.\n\nYou can stroll from there to the mirador for the acqueduct and on the way back stop for a coffee.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

145150658.name: Relaxing plaza
145150658.author: a TripAdvisor user
145150658.reviewBody: It seems everyone who visits old Queretaro will eventually pass by here or just hang around and people watch. There are many restaurants, ice cream parlors, and plenty of places to sit and enjoy the atmosphere.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

144642297.name: A mix of cultural events and good food
144642297.author: a TripAdvisor user
144642297.reviewBody: Don\'t miss this place at nights, on Tuesday\'s you have good documentaries been projected just for free in the square. And also good coffee shops and restaurantes with live music and good service, not expensive.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

144516488.name: Beutiful
144516488.author: a TripAdvisor user
144516488.reviewBody: I was here during Day of the Dead / Halloween Week and it was Beautiful.  I am attaching some of the pictures I took.  I was staying only 2 blocks from the plaza and walked here day and night.  There was always something going on and I ate at several of the restaurants which were not only excellent but very reasonably priced!\n\nOne of the most beautiful plazas I have visited in Mexico!

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

144474414.name: Free concerts !
144474414.author: a TripAdvisor user
144474414.reviewBody:
The Plaza de Armas regularily holds free concerts in the evenings.  

The Festival Internacional Cervantino was going on while I was there so there were quite a few festival shows.  

One evening I caught a "regular" show and was totally impressed by the quality of the band.  And a great interesting crowd drops by to check out the music also.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

140860333.name: Old times
140860333.author: a TripAdvisor user
140860333.reviewBody: You recreat part of Mexico\'s Independence when you take part of the night tours. During weekens you can listen to Cuban music while you drink some expresso.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

140561651.name: Mexican Independence Day Celebration
140561651.author: a TripAdvisor user
140561651.reviewBody: Beautiful plaza. We celebrated Mexico\'s Independence in Queretaro and the events in Plaza de Armas were wonderful. Amazing music and great fireworks.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

137945677.name: Lovely square
137945677.author: a TripAdvisor user
137945677.reviewBody: Really nice square, lots of restaurants, a little pricey. The fountain in the middle is a traditional meeting point for locals.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

135788938.name: People Watching
135788938.author: a TripAdvisor user
135788938.reviewBody: This is a very small plaza surrounded by historic buildings, coffee shops and restaurants. We like having comida at one of the outdoor restaurants with live music and just watching the people which always include salespeople, college students, families and businesspeople as well as the occasional protest or concert. The park has been undergoing some restoration so views have been limited but should now be finished.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

133875448.name: Beautiful town square
133875448.author: a TripAdvisor user
133875448.reviewBody: Lots of activities, even later at night.  Good restaurants around.  This was a great place to be.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

133144962.name: Plaza Independencia
133144962.author: a TripAdvisor user
133144962.reviewBody: This is a beautiful plaza surrounded by plenty of stores and restaurants. In rain though you need to take cover in the surrounding buildings.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

131115043.name: A great place to eat, meet and relax
131115043.author: a TripAdvisor user
131115043.reviewBody: Many people out at all hours with restaurant and bar choices up the kazoo.  Nice to take in the local color and meet with friends or clients.  One of the many nice squares in Queretaro.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

130488966.name: Great vibe, nice spot to relax and people watch
130488966.author: a TripAdvisor user
130488966.reviewBody: Plaza de Armas, along with the numerous other plazas in Queretaro, is a nice colonial square lined with shops, restaurants with outdoor seating, fountains, and historic buildings.  The historic centro of Queretaro is a great place to walk around leisurely, looking at colonial buildings and soaking in the great atmosphere and terrific climate.  Very enjoyable way to spend an afternoon or evening.  You\'ll feel totally safe here.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

129145846.name: Quer\u00e9taro is so cool!
129145846.author: a TripAdvisor user
129145846.reviewBody: Try and walk around the downtown area in the late afternoon and early evening.  There are wonderful shops and restaurants.  It is very romantic and colonial.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

124793313.name: Take your Camera
124793313.author: a TripAdvisor user
124793313.reviewBody: If you like history, architecture, good food, outdoor terrace dining, or people watching, then this is the place for you.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

124182491.name: Historic plaza in Queretaro
124182491.author: a TripAdvisor user
124182491.reviewBody:
Located in downtown Queretaro this is the main city plaza, you'll find countless restaurants and many historic locales from the 18th century.

Here are some important monuments, the "Palacio de la Coregidora" and the monumento to Juan Antonio de Urrutia y Arana to name some.

This is a must place to visit in Queretaro, you'll have a great time.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

123296662.name: Love to people watch
123296662.author: a TripAdvisor user
123296662.reviewBody: This plaza is small but interesting.  Good restaurants and stores surround the plaza and nearby.  I love the little ice cream shop on 5 de Mayo.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

123184823.name: Wonderful place just to take in the city
123184823.author: a TripAdvisor user
123184823.reviewBody: Lots of restaurant, wonderful old buildings, a perfect place to people watch. The most important thing, the city is VERY SAFE.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

121180179.name: Shaded and quiet
121180179.author: a TripAdvisor user
121180179.reviewBody: Many restaurants around it to enjoy staying longer there. On each side of the plaza there are monuments or old hacienda transformed in hotel to visit.

address.streetAddress: Plaza de Armas

673313710.name: Impressive
673313710.author: a TripAdvisor user
673313710.reviewBody: The building is impressive also the space in front of it creates a large square with plenty of handicrafts and corners to relax.

itemReviewed.name: Templo y ex-convento de la Santa Cruz de los Milagros

address.streetAddress: Independencia s/n Jardin de los Fundadores. Barrio La Cruz. Centro

657927979.name: Cross shaped thorns
657927979.author: a TripAdvisor user
657927979.reviewBody: Convent is most famous for its trees with cross shaped thorns which are protected from visitors in a fenced in area in the rear.    You can, however, buy souvenir thorns in the gift shop.   Convent is also noteworthy as the headquarters of Emperor Maximillian in 1867 before his subsequent incarceration here and his death by firing squad at the nearby cerrillo de campana.    You can only enter the convent via 25 minute guided tour in Spanish.   20 pesos regular price, 10 pesos for over 60.    Lovely square in front of the convent with lots of food stalls and vendors.   Combine a visit here with the Aquaducts - both of which of the eastern side of the historic district.

itemReviewed.name: Templo y ex-convento de la Santa Cruz de los Milagros

address.streetAddress: Independencia s/n Jardin de los Fundadores. Barrio La Cruz. Centro

655296806.name: History- Tour
655296806.author: a TripAdvisor user
655296806.reviewBody: Take the tour it\u2019s very cheap and was very nice to see everything- even though I don\u2019t speak Spanish- wonderful site.  Nice gift shop.  Great pictures from here!

itemReviewed.name: Templo y ex-convento de la Santa Cruz de los Milagros

613306212.author: a TripAdvisor user
613306212.reviewBody: It has a extreme high Both,  religious and historical tradition, I highly recommend a tour there, as most of Queretaro buildings Architecture it is amazing

itemReviewed.name: Templo y ex-convento de la Santa Cruz de los Milagros

603581784.name: Amazing
603581784.author: a TripAdvisor user
603581784.reviewBody: Took the tour with my family and its just something out of this world so much history in one place. Make sure you buy the one of a kind tree splinters

itemReviewed.name: Templo y ex-convento de la Santa Cruz de los Milagros

address.streetAddress: Independencia s/n Jardin de los Fundadores. Barrio La Cruz. Centro

603571648.name: Interesting for visitors who appreciate the historical value
603571648.author: a TripAdvisor user
603571648.reviewBody: It is a religious temple dating from the fifteenth century, has fascinating history, legends and stories really good, a nice place, quiet and beautiful.

itemReviewed.name: Templo y ex-convento de la Santa Cruz de los Milagros

address.streetAddress: Independencia s/n Jardin de los Fundadores. Barrio La Cruz. Centro

598596813.name: Amazing tour!
598596813.author: a TripAdvisor user
598596813.reviewBody: I took the tour and really enjoyed it, the tour guide was really good at knowing everithing of the convento... at the end theres a souvenir shop... GO!

itemReviewed.name: Templo y ex-convento de la Santa Cruz de los Milagros

570018958.author: a TripAdvisor user
570018958.reviewBody: Great \u00e1rea there ar\u00e9 many chuches and convets in the historic downtown that Are worth see, this is one of them

itemReviewed.name: Templo y ex-convento de la Santa Cruz de los Milagros

address.streetAddress: Independencia s/n Jardin de los Fundadores. Barrio La Cruz. Centro

566762486.name: Forward to the Past
566762486.author: a TripAdvisor user
566762486.reviewBody: I rarely do this sort of thing, but the blurb about spiny trees growing in the shape of a cross drew me inside.  The trees were a disappointment, but the rest was very worthwhile.  For a modest entrance fee, you are taken on a twenty minute tour of the convent.  A young woman (who was careful to say she was paid only tips :-), was my guide and I was lucky enough to be the only visiter at the moment.  I am fairly fluent, but being alone allowed me to ask when I did not understand something, and also to remind her to slow down her professional patter when I had trouble following it.  The convent is a mini-lesson into the beautiful and tragic history of the conquest.  The building is beautiful.  Particularly poignant was the luxurious cell where Maximillian was held for three days before being executed.  A very worthwhile thirty minutes and go in even if you don\'t speak Spanish just for the visual treat.  They no doubt speak a little English, I am guessing.

itemReviewed.name: Templo y ex-convento de la Santa Cruz de los Milagros

address.streetAddress: Independencia s/n Jardin de los Fundadores. Barrio La Cruz. Centro

565593278.name: The lovely Santa Rosa and the Founders square
565593278.author: a TripAdvisor user
565593278.reviewBody: There are often celebrations in front of the Santa Rosa Church, and the day after we arrived in Queretaro this year, we arrived upon a wonderful celebration of dance, drums, and traditional Indigenous costumes!!! There are regularly locals who sell their artisan wares in front of the church and in the Founders square.

itemReviewed.name: Templo y ex-convento de la Santa Cruz de los Milagros

address.streetAddress: Independencia s/n Jardin de los Fundadores. Barrio La Cruz. Centro

487747729.name: Excelente el \u00e1rea de Gym del Club
487747729.author: a TripAdvisor user
487747729.reviewBody: Ya con la entrega del Gimnasio en este mes de Mayo, la oferta deportiva y de fitness del Club lo hace mucho m\u00e1s atractivo y competitivo. Una vez que el Gimnasio quede decorado, no hay duda que tendremos el mejor Club Deportivo de Quer\u00e9taro.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Cantil 341 El Salto Jurica

475613654.name: La mejor alberca ol\u00edmpica y recreativa de Quer\u00e9taro
475613654.author: a TripAdvisor user
475613654.reviewBody: Es necesario conocer a alg\u00fan miembro activo del Club para poder acceder ademas de pagar una cuota de invitado. Despu\u00e9s de que mis hijos pasaron un fin de semana muy contentos y con varias actividades para ellos, decidimos adquirir una membres\u00eda para nuestra Familia y bien vali\u00f3 la pena!

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Cantil 341 El Salto Jurica

673095347.name: Beautiful and relaxing place
673095347.author: a TripAdvisor user
673095347.reviewBody: The place is beautiful.  We arrive there walking from the city centre in about 30 minutes,  the entrance in the garden was 5 pesos and unfortunately the museum was closed.  But anyway we spent such a beautiful time being there.

address.streetAddress: Av. Universidad

648354140.name: a bit hard to find, worth the effort
648354140.author: a TripAdvisor user
648354140.reviewBody: Located on the grounds of the University.  We had a pleasant walk there and back from our hotel in the city center.  The park is a bit hard to find as the location on TripAdvisor wasn\'t quite correct.  The effort was worth it to see this important spot in the struggle for Mexican independence. The park had a small admission fee.  Well maintained.

address.streetAddress: Av. Universidad

618764048.name: History&Nature
618764048.author: a TripAdvisor user
618764048.reviewBody: Cerro de las Campanas is the hill where the Emperor Maximilian of Habsburg was executed on 1867 by the troops of Presidente Benito Juarez. Appropriately you can find a mausoleum for Maximilian and a huge statue of Benito Juarez. The park is very nice, it\u2019s a bit off from the center but you can escape the heat and witness some history at the same time. The entrance to the park is 5 pesos and if you want to visit the museum you have to buy the ticket at entrance (18 pesos). The museum is not among the greatest.

address.streetAddress: Av. Universidad

601610522.name: Very quiet and refreshing in the morning.
601610522.author: a TripAdvisor user
601610522.reviewBody:
To get to the Cerro de Las Campanas,
We walked from the Downtown “Jardín Zenea”. Took us about 20-30 minutes from Centro to get to Cerro. Walked on the street called Andador Francisco Madero (for about 8 blocks toward west), then turn right (north) on the Tecnológico Avenue. About 4 blocks or so, you will see the park entrance with big statue of General on horse. 
It was a nice morning walk, still a little chilly but refreshing , safe walk. 

To enter the park , it cost 5 pesos. To go to the museum, it cost 18 pesos. 

How beautiful and well kept park it was. Lots of nice trees give us a shade to rest. 
On top of the hill, the gigantic statue of Benito Juarez was standing, as if claiming his ruling of this country after the execution of Maximilian. 

Because we visited around 9 am -10 am on Tuesday morning, basically no one was there. We enjoyed walking around. 
Good place to visit.

address.streetAddress: Av. Universidad

565593631.name: Chapel of the Hill of the Bells
565593631.author: a TripAdvisor user
565593631.reviewBody: Recommended to hire a tour guide to get the story of the Hill of the Bells, but there is a tourist kiosk on site which can help you out if you speak Spanish. A beautiful chapel, and grounds, with artisans selling their wares along the steps leading up to the Chapel.

address.streetAddress: Av. Universidad

551322977.name: Visit to Cerro de las Campanas
551322977.author: a TripAdvisor user
551322977.reviewBody: This is a quick stop to visit, an hour would be more than enough. Bring or hire a tourist guide to find out why this place is important in mexican history

address.streetAddress: Av. Universidad

547744210.name: It\'s the reason to visit
547744210.author: a TripAdvisor user
547744210.reviewBody: Walk around and explore, the same you would in the Rive Gauche or Prague.  No destination is necessary.

address.streetAddress: Av. Universidad

521999262.name: Beautiful Park
521999262.author: a TripAdvisor user
521999262.reviewBody: Although what happened there was everything but beautiful, I have to say that they have created a Beautiful Park. Incredibly clean and well maintained. Peaceful and in love with the cypress trees next to the chapel.Would have loved to spend the entire day there.

address.streetAddress: Av. Universidad

496367669.name: Historic and Impressive
496367669.author: a TripAdvisor user
496367669.reviewBody: Took a tour bus in el centro de queretaro. It cost 155 pesos for 2 hours. It took us to the Cerro de las Campanas. Its a historic shrine where Maximiliano and the 2 generals executed with him lie in peace. Beautiful gardens and a fountain surround the resting grounds. Beautiful place to rest and enjoy nature.

address.streetAddress: Av. Universidad

480484180.name: Sad!
480484180.author: a TripAdvisor user
480484180.reviewBody: I went to visit  the " Hill of Bells" mainly  to see the chapel built by the Austrian Government in 1901 for Emperor Maximilian and the 2 generals executed with him. The story of this young and somewhat inexperienced prince who became the emperor and refused to leave when the danger to himself became obvious, made me sad.
