Yes, he has issued orders that caused the death of thousands of Benito Juarez\'s men and may be that is why he was executed in spite of the many requests from Europe (French king, Victor Hugo etc.) to spare him. He has asked the firing squad not to be shot in the face since he did not want his mother to see him in that condition.\n\nThe chapel is somber. His body is now in Vienna and there are only his name and those of the two generals who were loyal to him till the end, written on the marble inside. The hill is a nice place to visit with many university students around.

address.streetAddress: Av. Universidad

476152143.name: Beautiful grounds and birdy!
476152143.author: a TripAdvisor user
476152143.reviewBody: We took a taxi from centro historico (60 mx).  Farther, I think, than most people would want to walk.  Grounds are very beautiful.  Museum was closed because of no electricity the cleaning lady at the museum told us.  However, we really enjoyed spotting the different birds as we walked around.  Vermilion Flycatchers and a Monk parakeet.  We took Uber back and it was 40mx.  Good views of the city.  5mx entrance fee to the park and 16 more for the museum.  Signs in Spanish say you have to pay the museum fee at the entrance to the park.  The woman at the entrance did not tell us this but that was possibly because the museum was closed which she did not tell us either.  Lovely spot.

address.streetAddress: Av. Universidad

465601775.name: Lovely walking tour!
465601775.author: a TripAdvisor user
465601775.reviewBody: We took a bus tour around Queretaro and landed here at one of our stops. We grabbed some ice cream from the vendors just outside the gates and then walked around these beautiful grounds! It\'s so lovely to leisurely stroll around here, I definitely think it\'s worth a visit! There is so many hidden gems in this city and this is one of them!

address.streetAddress: Av. Universidad

455475305.name: Worth a visit
455475305.author: a TripAdvisor user
455475305.reviewBody: Interesting place to spend an hour exploring the gardens and surrounding area. This is the site where Emperor Maximilian was executed by firing squad. Quite an interesting story. Pay one peso ($0.05) to be admitted. If you like walking, the site is withing walking distance from the center of Queretaro.

address.streetAddress: Av. Universidad

436017951.name: Of historic interest among pretty park-like surroundings...
436017951.author: a TripAdvisor user
436017951.reviewBody: A good stop on a tour of the historic places in Queretaro.  The surrounding park is lovely, relaxing, and good place to jog in the mornings or take a walk.  The tiny chapel is pretty and the museum and statue of Presidente Juarez at the top of the hill is worth a visit and photos.  Such rich, interesting, history of Mexico and this area especially as related to Mexico\'s independence from Spain.

address.streetAddress: Av. Universidad

428245752.name: Where Maximiliano was murdered...
428245752.author: a TripAdvisor user
428245752.reviewBody: If you like hstory and want to know more of Mexico history this is a place to go... The place where Maximiliano, Mexico Emperor was killed in 1867...

address.streetAddress: Av. Universidad

378458551.name: Nice piece of history
378458551.author: a TripAdvisor user
378458551.reviewBody: If this is your first time in Queretaro, you must visit Cerro de las campanas. The history live in that place.

address.streetAddress: Av. Universidad

376244875.name: Worth the Stroll
376244875.author: a TripAdvisor user
376244875.reviewBody: A wonderful church will a lot of history.  Picture perfect and quite popular with locals although not crowed.\nIt is a little walk out of town but well worth the stroll!

address.streetAddress: Av. Universidad

371936830.name: Prettty place for a visit
371936830.author: a TripAdvisor user
371936830.reviewBody: We stopped here to see the chapel and admire the gardens. It\'s not a long stop but interesting to see and learn more about the area\'s history.

address.streetAddress: Av. Universidad

369083009.name: Cerro de la Campanas
369083009.author: a TripAdvisor user
369083009.reviewBody: This is a little hill that was located outside the western end of the city during Maximiliano\'s reign and served as a fort against the republican army coming from the north and west. It is now surrounded by the Universidad Aut\u00f3noma de Quer\u00e9taro and has a very nice museum on the history of Queretaro, a chapel where Maximilian, Mejia and Miramar were executed at the end of the siege of Quer\u00e9taro ending the second empire, and a large monument of Juarez. Worth a visit.

address.streetAddress: Av. Universidad

352631625.name: Nice park with a museum on the top of the hill.
352631625.author: a TripAdvisor user
352631625.reviewBody: Beautiful place to walk a bit and see all these plants and flowers which are so typical for the area. Different cacti and agaves. Nice view to the city. And on the top of the hill there\'s a museum of the local history and how people finally settled to that area. Multimedia show and all the artefacts are worth of seeing. Definitely a must-see place in Queretaro!

address.streetAddress: Av. Universidad

647999499.name: Grandes experiencias
647999499.author: a TripAdvisor user
647999499.reviewBody: M\u00e1s de una vez he visitado la plaza de toros para acudir a corridas de toros, conciertos y eventos gastron\u00f3micos. Es un gran lugar para eventos de todo tipo.

address.streetAddress: Villas Del Meson Av. Meson del Prado

646122278.name: Buen Lugar para eventos
646122278.author: a TripAdvisor user
646122278.reviewBody: Lugar amplio para la realizacion de eventos, ya sea dentro de la plaza  o en el jardin externo, buena ubucacion tambien.

address.streetAddress: Villas Del Meson Av. Meson del Prado

645424326.name: Una salvajada
645424326.author: a TripAdvisor user
645424326.reviewBody: Quien dice toros dice SALVAJES. No a los toros, no a las peleas de gallos ni de perros. Un poco de humanidad por favor!

address.streetAddress: Villas Del Meson Av. Meson del Prado

634038505.name: Hermosa construcci\u00f3n
634038505.author: a TripAdvisor user
634038505.reviewBody: M\u00e1s que una plaza de toros de le debe considerar como un centro de espect\u00e1culos, con una hermosa arquitectura y mucha amplitud

address.streetAddress: Villas Del Meson Av. Meson del Prado

631440627.name: Centro de reuni\u00f3n para ver corridas de toros o conciertos
631440627.author: a TripAdvisor user
631440627.reviewBody: Est\u00e1n muy bien las instalaciones y cuando hay espect\u00e1culos se puede uno comer algo en el mismo lugar Esta muy limpio y bien organizado

address.streetAddress: Villas Del Meson Av. Meson del Prado

616814352.name: Excelente plaza
616814352.author: a TripAdvisor user
616814352.reviewBody: Una de las plazas m\u00e1s bonitas del pa\u00eds para disfrutar de una corrida de toros, donde cuidan cada detalle. Y en una zona residencial cerca de Quer\u00e9taro.

address.streetAddress: Villas Del Meson Av. Meson del Prado

554472343.name: Plazas en Mexico
554472343.author: a TripAdvisor user
554472343.reviewBody: preciosa la plaza , su arquitectura, comodidad, sobre todo los eventos, los carteles, nada que que ver con otras plazas de provincia,

address.streetAddress: Villas Del Meson Av. Meson del Prado

547045519.name: LAMENTABLE
547045519.author: a TripAdvisor user
547045519.reviewBody: Lamentable que Tripadvisor sea promotor de estos lugares de TORTURA ANIMAL, deber\u00edan elegir mejor. Para los queretanos es una verg\u00fcenza!

address.streetAddress: Villas Del Meson Av. Meson del Prado

482951124.name: increible
482951124.author: a TripAdvisor user
482951124.reviewBody: si hay corrida vale la pena ir es muy divertido y tiene super buen ambiente.\n\nes un lugar muy recomendable para ver eventos y/o corridas de toros

address.streetAddress: Villas Del Meson Av. Meson del Prado

474372627.name: El festival del asado
474372627.author: a TripAdvisor user
474372627.reviewBody: Un ambiente familiar, en los verdes jardines, disfrutando de degustar las mejores opciones carnes en compa\u00f1\u00eda de la familia, y recorriendo los stands de artesan\u00eda hechas a mano. Escuchando m\u00fasica para todos los gustos.

address.streetAddress: Villas Del Meson Av. Meson del Prado

673507244.name: Wow wow wow !!!
673507244.author: a TripAdvisor user
673507244.reviewBody: Excellent place ! From outside it seems to be so little, but there is plenty of space inside and lots of rooms to visit. The museum is well organised and the plants,  the three chiostro, the restaurant - one of the best meals in Queretaro it was here - the view from the terrace. I cannot express through words the beauty of this place.

address.streetAddress: Privada Madero 91

672163020.name: The calendars, calendar art, and printing info were very interesting
672163020.author: a TripAdvisor user
672163020.reviewBody: The calendar art is one of the best displays of how views and values change over the years.  Most info was in Spanish only.   Our favorite museum on this trip.

address.streetAddress: Privada Madero 91

671991685.name: Very bad service, not worth your time
671991685.author: a TripAdvisor user
671991685.reviewBody: I went to the restaurant with my family and it was a bad experience. At the entrance they start to ask you a lot of questions. My little boy wanted to rest a little bit in the garden and they wouldn\'t let him stay there. They don\'t have a table to change diapers in the toilets. Will never go there again.

address.streetAddress: Privada Madero 91

662256314.name: A good reminder that not all history is politically correct
662256314.author: a TripAdvisor user
662256314.reviewBody:
To start, your ticket is good for a whole year.  If you have a coffee or eat at Los Naranjos (the orange trees), a fun café hidden among plants at the back of the museum, your entrance is free.  

Another amazingly well remodeled 17th century hacienda, the building alone is worth visiting, including its great terrace with a view.  From the history and origin of calendars coming from varied civilizations, to printing techniques, to paintings and calendars from many years (1890-2011).  

I had to check out the calendars from the year I was born, and many, today, would not be politically correct...  A reminder of how far we ‘hopefully’ have come from: objectification of women, abuse of indigenous people, promoting smoking and drinking, etc.   

A nice change from the sometimes heavy history or archeological museums, this one is light and fun.  Run under the auspice of "Calendars Landin that brightened the lives of Mexicans for more than 100 years..."  

Some of the plants in the central garden are original.  Well-kept, it is a nice place to sit and relax between show rooms.  There is also a store with amazing stain-glass work.  Don’t miss this little gem.

address.streetAddress: Privada Madero 91

653583266.name: A most unique museum
653583266.author: a TripAdvisor user
653583266.reviewBody: We planned on visiting and were pleasantly surprised. Both the milieu and the contents were enjoyable. This ought to be noted as a highlight in the guide books.                               Of note is that some of the calendars do have English text.

address.streetAddress: Privada Madero 91

652395725.name: Surprise
652395725.author: a TripAdvisor user
652395725.reviewBody: Extraordinary little museum, great cafeteria, but it is a peacefull corner right in the middle of the Centro historico

address.streetAddress: Privada Madero 91

632081707.name: Best museum in town
632081707.author: a TripAdvisor user
632081707.reviewBody: We loved this museum, the setting is awesome. There is a quiet resturant inside the museum that offers a nice lunch and tea or coffee. The exhibits were nicely done. It was a lot of fun!

address.streetAddress: Privada Madero 91

617123000.name: A wonderful former casa worth a visit
617123000.author: a TripAdvisor user
617123000.reviewBody: I especially enjoyed the layout of the former house and the pretty garden. The exhibition is nicely displayed in various rooms and noteworthy for its extensive collection of calendars that give an interesting look into the era when they were designed. There is a nice cafe in the yard, a cup of coffee there and the entrance to the museum is free.

address.streetAddress: Privada Madero 91

615383355.name: Gorgeously restored building with ancient gardens.
615383355.author: a TripAdvisor user
615383355.reviewBody: Although most calendars show the objectification of women, the collection is housed in a stunning building. The history of calendars across cultures is interesting. All in Spanish though.

address.streetAddress: Privada Madero 91

595593878.name: Art and a Time Capsule
595593878.author: a TripAdvisor user
595593878.reviewBody: Excellent museum in a beautiful building.\nWonderful exhibition that not only captures art,\nsome of it qualifying as genuinely fine art, but also the march of cultural time up to today. Some fun, some inspirational, some sensual, some practical. I highly recommend a visit. Great museum.

address.streetAddress: Privada Madero 91

591200717.name: A Missed Opportunity
591200717.author: a TripAdvisor user
591200717.reviewBody: I looked forward to visiting this museum and learning more about the calendar industry and the art it has supported. The artwork is interesting, but I was very disappointed in the commentary and curation. Rather than taking the opportunity to examine the way that this artwork and the popular calendars reinforce sexist, nationalist, and racist ideologies, the museum reinforces them. Paintings of construction workers leering at women are marked as displaying the workers\' appreciation of beauty, and there is no mention of the way that indigenous people are used as props in the paintings. Instead of examining these ideas, they are just promoted.

address.streetAddress: Privada Madero 91

573089577.name: Must See
573089577.author: a TripAdvisor user
573089577.reviewBody: The gardens and terrace alone are worth the visit!  The history not only of calendars but also of advertising on them is quite interesting.

address.streetAddress: Privada Madero 91

567432970.name: Also called the MUCAL
567432970.author: a TripAdvisor user
567432970.reviewBody: Very interesting museum.  I love it and also their little caf\u00e9 in the back where I had lunch with another GV.

address.streetAddress: Privada Madero 91

553045521.name: Definitely worth a visit
553045521.author: a TripAdvisor user
553045521.reviewBody: The restored casona has been brought back to it\'s original splendor, walking through the exposition halls plus the incredible interior gardens full of abundant plants and flowers make it a feast for the senses, and even though it\'s in the center of town, a half block from the Cathedral, the thick walls insulate you from the street traffic and create a true oasis. Even if the historic calendars aren\'t of interest, just visiting here makes for an amazing visit well worth the $30 peso entry fee.

address.streetAddress: Privada Madero 91

551276400.name: A different Museum
551276400.author: a TripAdvisor user
551276400.reviewBody: We are lucky that one of the most important factories of calendars has its roots at Queretaro. Therefore the owners, the Landin family, wanted to give back to the citizens, so they restored a very beautiful and centric mansion and install a unique museum, that show us the relevance of the calendars in several dimensions: the time counters, all the arts involved in the calendars and the meaning of time in different cultures, including an extraordinary wood reproduction of the Aztec calendar in a real size. Besides they organize very good art events. Is a must. Thanks for this gift and wish you long life.

address.streetAddress: Privada Madero 91

506977086.name: Good place to spend an hour or two.
506977086.author: a TripAdvisor user
506977086.reviewBody: The museum is not that small I think something like 14 rooms. It features several paintings of artists as well as a collection of calendars starting from late 20th till today. It was quite interesting so if you have time to kill go there. Also it has a lovely garden where you can get a cup of tea in the small tea room.

address.streetAddress: Privada Madero 91

496367326.name: Deja Vu
496367326.author: a TripAdvisor user
496367326.reviewBody: Had the opportunity to view first hand calendars from 1901. I reminisced on the calendars offered by merchants when I was a kid. Beautiful art exhibits and gardens. Great place to spend an afternoon.

address.streetAddress: Privada Madero 91

492068522.name: Lovely museum
492068522.author: a TripAdvisor user
492068522.reviewBody: Really enjoyed this museum! There are 18 rooms of calendars and artwork.  The cafe is a nice place for a snack while you listen and watch the birds.  There is a terrace up the stairs with amazing views of the city!

address.streetAddress: Privada Madero 91

484524612.name: A hidden gem and a new must aee
484524612.author: a TripAdvisor user
484524612.reviewBody: I lived the atmosphere in this museum and the beautiful garden to have a coffee. It is only 25 pesos and you can go on a list and come back for a year for free. Amazing. There is calendar art and actual calendars from the 1890\'s until the early 2000s. Fun to find one from your birthday. I would go back

address.streetAddress: Privada Madero 91

452599544.name: Vintage
452599544.author: a TripAdvisor user
452599544.reviewBody: It\'s a very interesting visit, they got calendars dating more than 100 years old, in the first few rooms they caught the Mexican folklore from the early 20th century, it\'s housed in a very nicely remodeled old house. worth visiting

address.streetAddress: Privada Madero 91

451926659.name: Most restful place on earth
451926659.author: a TripAdvisor user
451926659.reviewBody: I have previously commented on the museum itself but for 25pesos (\u00a31) per year for entry it is worth going just to sit in the garden, relax, drink great coffee, have breakfast and listen to the birds all around you. So peaceful. Fantastic building and grounds.

address.streetAddress: Privada Madero 91

424402070.name: Amazing!
424402070.author: a TripAdvisor user
424402070.reviewBody:
We didn't know what to expect. Calendars? Really!  

We were treated to a beautifully restored mansion full of surprises, the first being a huge reproduction of the Aztec calendar, the original of which is in the Mexico City Museum of Archeology. There is a large collection of very interesting and unusual Mexican ( and a few American) calendars dating over the last hundred years. A beautiful and serene garden in the back of the house has a little patio cafe. Our Sunday brunch there was delicious and cost 200 pesos per person. 

Highly recommended. We came back 3x.

address.streetAddress: Privada Madero 91

407546807.name: Time back and art
407546807.author: a TripAdvisor user
407546807.reviewBody: This place is beautiful: the mexican artist\'s paintings and great to admire and the historical travel to past century mexican calendars.\nNot less enjoyable was taking a coffe in the beautiful garden well taken care by the same person 50 years ago...

address.streetAddress: Privada Madero 91

399381210.name: a very nice place to visit
399381210.author: a TripAdvisor user
399381210.reviewBody: The museum is located in a beautifully restored house, with patios full of flowers, a terrace with nice views and a restaurant in the back. The exhibits are about various calendars and the calendar art itself. The exhibit is very rich and if you pay proper attention you will need about 2 hours to see everything in detail. Not many people venture here and you should be able to enjoy a really peaceful time here...

address.streetAddress: Privada Madero 91

354448824.name: Very interesting exhibits & nice garden restaurant
354448824.author: a TripAdvisor user
354448824.reviewBody: I thoroughly enjoyed visiting this museum. It has a very relaxed atmosphere & nice variety of features. There is also a garden restaurant with excellent service.

address.streetAddress: Privada Madero 91

351870691.name: A BEAUTIFUL ADDITION TO QUERETARO\'S LINE UP OF ATTRACTIONS.
351870691.author: a TripAdvisor user
351870691.reviewBody:
I looked forward to the opening of MUCAL because of a personal connection to this magnificent building.  Many years ago, the granddaughter of the owner hosted a bridal shower for my sister-in-law and me.  I was curious to see what it looked like after the restoration. Our event took place on the patio where the original fountain still stands and I was so happy to see this.  I thought the exhibits were very fascinating especially the calendars from different cultures.  The exhibits of the Mexican calendars are iconic and the artists idealized the Mexican culture very similar to Norman Rockwell's art and influence of that period.

Over the years I've heard incredible stories about hidden treasures, tunnels that run under the city, the Inquisition, etc...
To actually see the excavated jugs that most likely held the coins that were buried with the intention of returning to reclaim.  As well as the remains of two people that were buried in one of the walls.  This sparked lots of conversation with my relatives in Queretaro and they shared similar stories.  I found all of this so fascinating.

The cafe in the back was another wonderful place to just sit back and take in the sounds and beauty of such a serene garden.  I highly recommend you visit this place. I first visited the museum by myself and encouraged my family to visit.
I just returned in January with my parents and they provided a wheel chair for my dad and were so helpful.  I look forward to returning on my next visit.

address.streetAddress: Privada Madero 91

343870114.name: Interesting content, very interesting building
343870114.author: a TripAdvisor user
343870114.reviewBody: A museum about calendars is a great idea, and this museum has taken a good run at it.  The explanations of different calendars over the ages are all in Spanish.  There is an impressive multi-room display of calendars since 1890 when the contemporary wall-hanging type was created;  naturally there\'s an emphasis on Mexican.  \n\nThe building is an impressive example of excellent restoration.   And in the back is a great garden with two very tall palm trees covered in vines that make the perfect habitat for many birds.  Good roof terrace, too.

address.streetAddress: Privada Madero 91

341914623.name: A peaceful oasis, annual membership 25 pesos
341914623.author: a TripAdvisor user
341914623.reviewBody: The other travelers have done a great job of describing this beautiful museum and cafe. If you are staying in Queretaro for some time, note the following. When you arrive and pay your 25 pesos ($1.30) do fill out one of the half-sheet forms sitting on the entrance desk, and include your "address" (email address.) The staff will enter your information into the computer, and you are now free to attend anytime during the year. The outdoor cafe with free wifi is a beautiful place to hang out, read, and enjoy the birds that come to the bird bath. (The oranges that have fallen off the trees are not edible, according to the staff, they are "grey" oranges.)

address.streetAddress: Privada Madero 91

340801591.name: Calendar art in a beautifully restored building
340801591.author: a TripAdvisor user
340801591.reviewBody: This museum proves that a good curator can make any subject interesting.  The first room include a replica of the Aztec stone calendar and posters explaining how various civilizations measured the passage of time.  The many rooms that follow present the original art used for calendars in Mexico and a large collection of old illustrated calendars.  The Landin Company sponsors the museum and they spared no expense in restoring the 18th century building to modern use.  Be sure to admire all the interior courtyards and the rooftop terrace, which gives a lovely view of the historic center of Queretaro.  There is also a caf\u00e9 in the rear courtyard where you can sit quietly, enjoy a cup of coffee, and perhaps ponder the passage of time highlighted by the collection.

address.streetAddress: Privada Madero 91

340319034.name: Number One pick in Queretero
340319034.author: a TripAdvisor user
340319034.reviewBody: This is a beautifully restored compound with well-displayed archeological findings.  There are hundreds of displays of original works of art and vintage wall calendars.  Many of them are inexplicable, some of them are funny, some slightly naughty. The grounds are another feature altogether, with fountains, blooming vines, and specimen trees. There is a grand plaza on top with full views of the church spires of Queretero. A wonderful outdoor cafe sits at the end of the property. What a find!  This is our number one pick in Queretero.

address.streetAddress: Privada Madero 91

324913316.name: Much more than just calendars
324913316.author: a TripAdvisor user
324913316.reviewBody: This collection is in a beautifully restored mansion.  There\'s an introduction to the history of time measurement and calendars across every culture and historical period, including a very good explanation of the Mayan and Aztec calendars.  But way more than that is the collection of paintings by Mexican artists who produced calendar art which is just gorgeious, as well as a historical collection of Mexican calendars from various periods, and an assortment of archeological findings they made while restoring the house, and an exhibit about the history of printing.  There\'s a rooftop terrace, and a cafe in the back garden, and the obligatory gift shop.  Give yourself a couple hours at least.  At $26 pesos, this is a great deal, interesting, attractive, informative, and a bargain.

address.streetAddress: Privada Madero 91

324123582.name: Fascinating Museum and great place to eat.
324123582.author: a TripAdvisor user
324123582.reviewBody: Tucked away on a side street in the center of downtown Queretaro, this new museum is in a lovely old home. The displays of traditional Mexican calendar art (think Norman Rockwell or covers of old Western comics) are very interesting, but keep going back. You will come to a delightful walled garden restaurant. Weekdays you choose from a menu, but on Sunday there is a terrific brunch buffet- Lots of fruit, hot traditional Mexican dishes, cereal and juice, and fabulous coffee. And you can order other egg dishes at no additional charge. 200 pesos for a wonde3rful meal in a lovely setting. We were the only non-Mexicans there.

address.streetAddress: Privada Madero 91

310274326.name: DO NOT MISS IT!
310274326.author: a TripAdvisor user
310274326.reviewBody: Excellent new museum in Queretaro! The entrance is us $1.25. A guide, who will not take you to all the rooms but he is good in giving a sense of history, is another US$ 1.25. Almost free! The house, casona, is beautiful and calm. They also have access to the rooftop with an incredible vista. They also have a cafeteria in the luscious gardens attended by one of the best restaurants in town: Emilia\'s. Since it is so inexpensive and if you have extra time, visit more than once.

address.streetAddress: Privada Madero 91

307348474.name: Wow.  Beautiful building and very cool art.
307348474.author: a TripAdvisor user
307348474.reviewBody: My family and I went to this new museum in Queretaro.  200+ year old casona (house) which was beautifully restored.  Each of the rooms has a different era of calendar photos.  25 peso visit and we can return for the rest of 2015.\n\nSimple cafe in the back gardens which was a pleasant surprise.

address.streetAddress: Privada Madero 91

662283837.name: Queretaro\u2019s prominent place in the context of Mexico\u2019s history
662283837.author: a TripAdvisor user
662283837.reviewBody:
I came here while waiting for my guided tour of the city to start.  The entrance ticket is valid for the entire day so I figured if I didn’t have time to finish by the time my tour started, I would come back afterwards.  No food or drinks allowed inside – they will keep it behind the desk for you while you visit, just don’t forget it on the way out…  Small souvenir shop at the entrance.

Located in part of what was a very large San Franciscan Convent thought to have been built between 1540 and 1550.  Its courtyard with central fountain surrounded by arches on two levels is simple yet beautiful.  Here you can learn about: ancient calendaring systems to local towns and native groups, agriculture, art, daily life, the Jesuits, evangelization, various missions…  Pre-Hispanic Queretaro, Indian Villages of Queretaro, The Franciscan Convent of Santiago, the Vice Regal of Queretaro, Queretaro within the context of Mexican history, and much more.

The collections are made up of archaeological, ethnographic, colonial and contemporary pieces of ceramics, lithics, sculptures, paintings, furniture, clothing, weapons, means of transportation, photographs, and documents.

Well worth a visit before touring the city center as it gives you a good overview that helps you understand things much better once traipsing through the various plazas and important buildings of the city.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

657018604.name: Museum
657018604.author: a TripAdvisor user
657018604.reviewBody: Everything in Queretaro is a sight to behold.  The beautiful and majesty of these buildings is amazing.  Dating back to the 16th century with some of these buildings.  The architecture design is awesome.  This museum was closed when we where there but the outside alone is something to see - the courtyard is beautiful!!!

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

649756328.name: Great architecture
649756328.author: a TripAdvisor user
649756328.reviewBody: This building used to be a Franciscan convent. Huge place very well conserved. It has a small prehispanic collection. The three patios are amazing.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

648354684.name: very impressive
648354684.author: a TripAdvisor user
648354684.reviewBody: We very much enjoyed our visit to this museum.  Especially the per-European exhibits.  They have a gem here.  The only down shot is that all signage is in Spanish.  We muddled by with our basic Spanish skills.  It would be great if they could offer a self-guided audio tour in different languages.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

645861444.name: Spent At Least An Hour Here
645861444.author: a TripAdvisor user
645861444.reviewBody: Great place to see the cultural & heritage over here. Some modern display, oil paintings, went to one section but they were closing that section. Enjoy the architecture of the museum.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

644240924.name: an interesting local museum
644240924.author: a TripAdvisor user
644240924.reviewBody: it is an interesting local museum in a very charachteristic buildig that has played a cardinal role in the hisstry of the city of Queretaro

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

618058656.name: Loved it
618058656.author: a TripAdvisor user
618058656.reviewBody: I really enjoyed this museum, even though it is "just" a regional museum. The building in which it is located is beautiful, and the collection of art and artifacts within, fascinating. Not only would I return to this museum, I already have! I visited it both times I visited Queretaro.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

615835530.name: Know your Spanish
615835530.author: a TripAdvisor user
615835530.reviewBody: Our group of 4 decided to visit this museum to learn more about the history of Queretaro. There are a lot of exhibits, but you definitely need to know Spanish as there is no English anywhere on any of the signs. Thankfully the rest of my group spoke Spanish and could translate when something looked interesting.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

598927631.name: A Huge Place!
598927631.author: a TripAdvisor user
598927631.reviewBody: This historical place is huge, without the tour guide it could take you hours to go through... a lot of history...

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

593771872.name: The Regional Museum/Museo Regional
593771872.author: a TripAdvisor user
593771872.reviewBody: If your Spanish is up to snuff.The most interesting exhibits are of the Viceroyalty era. A lot of reading that makes the historical people come alive. It\'s ALL in Spanish.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

588908580.name: Very complete and interesting museum
588908580.author: a TripAdvisor user
588908580.reviewBody: The museum is very complete and interesting. It has a very good collection of prehispanic stuff and even some samples of the local prehispanic languages that still exist today in the state. Definitely a must.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

581526221.name: Beautiful building and well conceived museum
581526221.author: a TripAdvisor user
581526221.reviewBody: Very much worth a visit, this museum tells the story of Queretaro and the area from pre-hispanic times through the Spanish Conquest, the fight for Mexican Independence and the Mexican Revolution and all within a building with exquisite architecture.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

578914939.name: Splendid colonial building
578914939.author: a TripAdvisor user
578914939.reviewBody: The museum is not so much interesting for its artefacts, but it is situated in a beautiful building which certainly deserves a visit. Luckily, all the main buildings and churches in Queretaro are within short distance and you can at a pinch see most attractions in one day.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

571736501.name: Nice pre-hispanico collection
571736501.author: a TripAdvisor user
571736501.reviewBody: Really enjoyed the more or less local prehispanico stuff on the second floor. While tastes may vary, we skipped the rooms that were from the viceregal period. Also a very cool building.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

565931500.name: Excellent displays, cool building, great art - all for Mxn$60 - do visit!
565931500.author: a TripAdvisor user
565931500.reviewBody: Decided to go because it was next to the church and expected a dreary municipal self-promotion of trick - just how wrong  would we be! Do go! The displays are well structured with a clearly marked route,  showing key aspects of Queretaro throughout history and it\'s important role in Mexican history. Despite all being in Spanish, the most basic understanding of  vocabulary will suffice to bring much of it to life. There was also modern local art in one room.  The building itself is unprepossessing from the outside but it\'s religious heritage is evident in the cool cloistered and a montage including video tracks it\'s transformation. Good value for MXN$60.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

552122347.name: Do visit it!
552122347.author: a TripAdvisor user
552122347.reviewBody: Highly recommend to visit the Museum. It used to be a nun\'s home. It is very peaceful and beautiful with a very nice exhibition of some of the history of mexico.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

551330407.name: Lovely building, artwork and history information
551330407.author: a TripAdvisor user
551330407.reviewBody: A beautiful building which feeds the soul, ex Franciscan convent with 2 patios which you can endulge in. Cabrera painting worth seeing if you can withstand the dark spaces where they are hung since you can hardly see them. Pay attention to the building details as they are amazing. Good information on the history of the Queretaro Valley and founding of the city and revolutionary times. I saw a posting that this was free, maybe on Sundays when most museums are free in the country but this one is $60MX for adults.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

547564935.name: well worth a visit
547564935.author: a TripAdvisor user
547564935.reviewBody: Beautiful building. Some crazy modern exibits, lots of heavy religious paintings and an interesting mixture of more modern artists. Donations accepted in a glass box and photos allowed for a small fee of 15 pesos.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

536765826.name: interesting
536765826.author: a TripAdvisor user
536765826.reviewBody: loads of interesting things to see - especially for tourists, it\'s location set behind a plain front was most impressive

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

534149539.name: History of Queretaro
534149539.author: a TripAdvisor user
534149539.reviewBody: The Museum is 55.00 MX (about $3.00 USD) it is pretty extensive regarding the history of the area.  Unfortunately, nothing is in English.  There was a nice student who did his best to explain exhibits to us.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

531213153.name: Since it\'s free, worth a visit for its inner patio
531213153.author: a TripAdvisor user
531213153.reviewBody: This is perhaps the most attractive building in Queretaro\'s historic city center compared to the rest, so it is worth the walk (it\'s just a few blocks from the main plaza) to see the inside and outside patio. Entrance is free, so you can just look around and leave as you please. There is not much to see besides appreciating the architecture, so anticipate spending a brief amount of time here as part of your Queretaro tour.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

529308434.name: Exquisite museum
529308434.author: a TripAdvisor user
529308434.reviewBody: A trip to this museum is worth the visit just to see the architecture of the building in this lovely part of Queretaro\'s historic center.  We\'ve visited multiple times and the collections are interesting. There is no cost.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

510655172.name: Architectural jewel
510655172.author: a TripAdvisor user
510655172.reviewBody: Extremely well done museum and stunning architectural beauty. Very lovely way to spend a couple of hours in downtown Quer\u00e9taro away from the bustle of the streets

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

499255717.name: Very nice museum
499255717.author: a TripAdvisor user
499255717.reviewBody: Queretaro is very enchanting place .... great for walks and good dinning. If you want to know about the history of this city and the region then you should definitely visit this museum.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

483271691.name: History of Mexico
483271691.author: a TripAdvisor user
483271691.reviewBody: Nice  and big museum, the cost for entrance it\'s $50.00 pesos, ans you\'ll need like two hours for see it all, nice spot for pictures too.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

482665835.name: Great Museum!
482665835.author: a TripAdvisor user
482665835.reviewBody: Queretaro is a very important city and this museum traces the history of Queretaro from pre-colonial era to the 19th century.  Beginning with the indigenous people, going through the colonial period, then the Independence movement.  Well- laid out and spacious, with lovely quiet patios.  All exhibits are in Spanish.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

482136329.name: Fabulous amazing structure
482136329.author: a TripAdvisor user
482136329.reviewBody: To totally unexpected. Beautiful design and architecture.  Also included several rooms to view regional artwork .\nWas very nice.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

464752525.name: Many usuall and grand arifacts from last 500 yrs
464752525.author: a TripAdvisor user
464752525.reviewBody: Incredible would carvings and some very old painting displayed in poor light.  A few prehispanic artifacts.  Well displayed items with beautiful tropical hardwood floors

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

464110468.name: Good visit
464110468.author: a TripAdvisor user
464110468.reviewBody: This place is situated in the heart of the old city. It has history and lots of information about different important historical figures in Mexico.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

458342539.name: Beautiful Museum
458342539.author: a TripAdvisor user
458342539.reviewBody: The Museo Regional is a must visit when in Quer\u00e9taro, you can see the history of the region since the Spanish conquest until early 20th Century.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

455778797.name: Wonderful museum
455778797.author: a TripAdvisor user
455778797.reviewBody: The Regional Museum was terrific.  It runs the gamut of Mexican and Queretaro history,begins with Pre-hispanic periods and running to the present day.  The temporary exhibit on corn is excellent.  The museum is housed in a beautiful former convent which is worth seeing just for itself. We spent several hours there, those with less interest in history might spend less time, but either way it is time well spent.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

455294827.name: Beautifully presented large collection of pre-hispanic artifacts
455294827.author: a TripAdvisor user
455294827.reviewBody: Learning about the early history of the region of the valleys, hills and sierra of Queretaro State was the best reason to spend a couple of hours in this well-lit museum.  Signs are Spanish only but there\'s plenty to entertain, just looking.  Enjoyed a special exhibit on the importance of corn to the indigenous culture, with a very informative section on the incursion of transgenic corn to an area where traditional land-races perfectly adapted to local conditions can be produced without input of chemicals, saving seed through the generation.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

451668051.name: A happy accident
451668051.author: a TripAdvisor user
451668051.reviewBody: We were walking by and there was a christmas market on the central patio of the museum. They invited us in and were welcome to walk around the museum while looking at the handicrafts. I was very interested to learn that there are guided tours during the evening to learn about the history of the museum and it\'s surroundings and I can\'t wait to return to Quer\u00e9taro and try it!

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

436087496.name: Beautiful.
436087496.author: a TripAdvisor user
436087496.reviewBody: While there we just toured the area and lots to do and see, as Mexico has so much history as no matter where you go this is something you will enjoy doing, with friends and family. The local are also great to inter-act with and just lots to see and read about.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

427043282.name: Good exhibition on the importance of corn in Mexico
427043282.author: a TripAdvisor user
427043282.reviewBody: The permanent collection of art is ok, but the temporary exhibition on corn was fantastic. The housing of the museum in an old monastery is an attraction itself.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

421185889.name: Nice but not much to see
421185889.author: a TripAdvisor user
421185889.reviewBody: If you\'re downtown in the historic district you\'re likely to come across this Museum. It is worth a quick visit. It was formerly a convent in the augustinian tradition. Later the government took it and turned it into a military headquarters. The architecture is stunning.\n\nThe reason I rated as three stars is there is very little to see. they have roughly 20 or 30 paintings and a book store. I was here years ago and it was free as it was yesterday. We were told it is always free, so despite the other reviews you do not need to go on certain days for free admission.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

398861887.name: great atmosphere
398861887.author: a TripAdvisor user
398861887.reviewBody: The entrance tickets are super cheap. The museum is pretty big. It has a gallery with modern art (paintings), but you can also learn a lot of history of Queretaro and its region. I loved orange trees in patio and a fountain. Very charming place. *no labels\\ descriptions in English though*

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

397663016.name: Wonderful museum in Quer\u00e9taro
397663016.author: a TripAdvisor user
397663016.reviewBody: The Museo Regional is one of the top five attractions in Quer\u00e9taro! Housed in the ex-Convent of San Francisco, one of the most important colonial structures in all Mexico, this museum offers a great array of paintings, sculptures, furniture, documents, and artifacts related to the whole region of the State of Quer\u00e9taro. Starting with rooms mapping the development of pre-Colombian cultures leading up to role of the city/state in the struggles for Independence and then the Mexican Revolution, the museum is a wonderful summary of Mexican history, politics, and culture neatly presented in chronological order as you stroll through the huge ex-convent. Bring a camera. The views of the dome and the tower of the Church of San Francisco next door from the verandas facing the interior patio are breathtaking.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

376242940.name: Museo Regional - FREE on Tuesday
376242940.author: a TripAdvisor user
376242940.reviewBody: The Museo Regional is a very interesting place to visit.  All exhibits of course are in Spanish but even if you cannot read it you will throughly enjoy your experience.  The architecture is gorgeous and a wonderful way to waste some time!!

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

369703803.name: Worthwhile
369703803.author: a TripAdvisor user
369703803.reviewBody: Lovely, very interesting, to spend at least an hour, good orientation for your visit to the city.  I was almost alone in it.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

365683574.name: Nice building
365683574.author: a TripAdvisor user
365683574.reviewBody: The building is pretty and right next to the Cathedral - Ver clean ND well maintained - A 15 minute visit with interesting information about Mexico\'s independence.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

356551005.name: Best if you read Spanish
356551005.author: a TripAdvisor user
356551005.reviewBody: This museum takes the visitor through the prehispanic life of the area, through the pacification of the Chichemeca indigenous people and the time of haciendas, with much emphasis on the religious aspects. There is a great summary of the independence period. The building itself is part of the story of the area.  Everything, unfortunately is in Spanish, so we missed a lot.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

355425219.name: Gem of a museum
355425219.author: a TripAdvisor user
355425219.reviewBody: Absolutely worth it just for the building alone... time your visit during lunch hours 1400-1600 when it\'s less crowded.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

354447645.name: Nice if you are near, not a destination
354447645.author: a TripAdvisor user
354447645.reviewBody: The building itself is beautiful architecturally. The permanent exhibits are interesting, but there are not very many pieces. Also, the lighting is annoying because it glares on the paintings. It is also sort of hard to tell where you are supposed to go. There was no charge to enter, so it\'s worth a visit.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

337372318.name: Good overview of the region and history of Quer\u00e9taro
337372318.author: a TripAdvisor user
337372318.reviewBody: A must if one wants to know and understand the rich history of Quer\u00e9taro and the region, and the contributions to the history of M\u00e9xico.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

337116529.name: Go to the Art Museum first
337116529.author: a TripAdvisor user
337116529.reviewBody: The collection seems thin, uneven, and inaccessible to English-speakers.  If you are in town for several days, walk through for the architecture.  Compare the simplicity of this Franciscan monastery Santa Cruz (also Franciscan) and to the wealth of Santa Clara or the high art of the Regional Art Museum (a former Augustinian convent).  Non-Mexicans pay a small entrance fee.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

323779974.name: Excellent museum of world quality
323779974.author: a TripAdvisor user
323779974.reviewBody: The exposition and material presentation are superb. The only flaw is - you have to know Spanish as all the notations are in Spanish only.\nThe layout of former convent is also charming. The whole complex is in great condition.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

286965751.name: Great museum to visit while in Quer\u00e9taro
286965751.author: a TripAdvisor user
286965751.reviewBody: Downtown, in the Centro Hist\u00f3rico on Corregidora...large old Colonial building with central patio that has been turned into a museum featuring items from Quer\u00e9taro and close by. Extremely well organized from pre-Hispanic times through Mexico\'s War for Independence, the Revolution, and afterwards. Beautiful pieces of pottery, folk art, paintings, and relics from different periods, and good signage guiding you from one room to another. It took us about an hour to go through the entire museum this morning, and I recommend it to anyone who likes/loves Mexican history. No fee charged for educators with a credential.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

259652677.name: Perspective of Mexican History
259652677.author: a TripAdvisor user
259652677.reviewBody: We especially liked learning more about the history of colonial Mexico and where it fit into the rest of Mexico\'s history, which is why we came to this part of Mexico.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

259556037.name: Lovely Museum
259556037.author: a TripAdvisor user
259556037.reviewBody: A gem in Queretaro, this museum provides a nice overview of the history and culture of the region. The building is very beautiful.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

255625714.name: Nice place
255625714.author: a TripAdvisor user
255625714.reviewBody: Good experience about Mexican History.  When I was in Queretaro, the museum was free for students....

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

249842645.name: Beautiful building
249842645.author: a TripAdvisor user
249842645.reviewBody: This is a must when visiting Queretaro. The museum is located in a beautiful building next to the city\'s cathedral. The internal patios are amazing. The museum is well maintained with a quick view of the state\'s history, one of the richest in the country. Worth the visit!

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

247263963.name: So much history!
247263963.author: a TripAdvisor user
247263963.reviewBody: This is the place to go for Mexican history and art, best museum in the city! Right next to a beautiful church, right in the heart of the city

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

245683877.name: Magnificent structure and fascinating exhibits
245683877.author: a TripAdvisor user
245683877.reviewBody: This museum is located next to the Church of San Francisco and used to be its convent.  Like many properties owned by the Catholic Church in Quer\u00e9taro and throughout Mexico, it was confiscated by the Government in the late 19th century during the historical era known as the la reforma (the reform).  The main interior courtyard of the structure is impressive and the patio is often used for musical events.  The permanent exhibits on the upper explain (in Spanish only) explain the history of the city and nation.  Don\u2019t miss the small-scale models that show the details of the facades of the Franciscan Missions (see the separate entry for this attraction) in the Sierra Gorda region of northern Quer\u00e9taro State.  There are also temporary exhibits on the ground level of the museum that usually focus on contemporary art.  In the rear of the building is a lovely, smaller courtyard called the \u201cPatio de los Naranjos\u201d (Courtyard of the Orange Trees) next to a room used for concerts.  Entrance to the museum is free on Sundays.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

230026165.name: A museum which tells a fascinating  story
230026165.author: a TripAdvisor user
230026165.reviewBody:
Not only is Queretaro - or the Centro Historico at any rate - very beautiful, but it has a long and important history. That history is well presented, with a wealth of fascinating artifacts, at the Museo Regional, right in the heart of the old city.
The chronological presentation takes the visitor from the earliest known settlements in the area, thousands of years ago, to the Spanish conquest, the fight for independence, and all the important events which have happened since.
Even more interesting, to some, will be the breathtaking beauty of the building itself. It is an ex-convent, originating in the 16th Century, and it has been restored and converted with much skill and imagination.
Some museums in Mexico and other countries put too much print on their walls by showing descriptive text in the local language and English. This not only creates clutter but is not kind to visitors whose main language is neither that of the country or English. Museo Regional avoids this trap, and displayed text is in Spanish only, with a little in local tribal languages. But it is important that simple and cheap guide books are available in the languages of all the main groups of visitors, to help them make the most of their displays.
No such guide books appeared to be available at Museo Regional, and this is a serious defect.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

198709416.name: Aweasome museum
198709416.author: a TripAdvisor user
198709416.reviewBody:
This is a beautiful museum. Starting with the architecture of the building.
There was a temporary exposition of a mammoth which was great.
In this museum you can see what Queretaro has to offer. Tons of different ancient cultures with great amount of inheretage.
I enjoyed every single bit of the place.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

197923849.name: A nice decent-size museum
197923849.author: a TripAdvisor user
197923849.reviewBody:
They had the temporary display of the remains of a real mammoth. I had seen it before in Guadalajara but I liked the way they did the display in the Museo Regional, the reading for every piece is VERY SMALL though you can hardly read it. 

The convento building is beautiful and you feel like you can travel back in time, you feel in a big Mexican hacienda! There is not well signaled areas so make sure you don't miss some parts of it upstairs and below the stairways.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

197773172.name: Excellent history presentation
197773172.author: a TripAdvisor user
197773172.reviewBody: As well as a Prehistoric animal display the ethnology display showing past civilisations that inhabited Mexico. Good for Kids and Adults

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

181707211.name: Great Gem of a Museum
181707211.author: a TripAdvisor user
181707211.reviewBody: Queretaro is a historical city, and if you spend an hour or two here, you will walk away with a much better understanding.  From the table in which the U.S./MX treaty was signed to the history of Maximilliano\'s last days in Queretaro, the museum does an excellent job of providing the visitor a complete history.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

174293408.name: must see
174293408.author: a TripAdvisor user
174293408.reviewBody: If you\'re interested in archaelogical diggins, you have to go. Lots of items from local diggins site around Quer\u00e9taro. Amazing building as well, very pretty!

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

169801394.name: Great collection
169801394.author: a TripAdvisor user
169801394.reviewBody: This museum hosts one of the largest collection of local indigenous and religious art of the State. Including samples from the different missions. It usually hosts, but it might be wise to check first, temporary exhibits. Its an old building with good parking (underground across the street) and close to the better spots to walk downtown queretaro, including the best restaurants on walking distance.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

164622942.name: Good Museum, Beautiful Buidling
164622942.author: a TripAdvisor user
164622942.reviewBody: Good museum of the history of Queretaro and the area in a wonderful old convent or monastary.  Not much English but worthwhile just the same.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

158426843.name: AWESOME HISTORICAL MUSEUM
158426843.author: a TripAdvisor user
158426843.reviewBody: I recommend this museum. It has a beautiful building full of history. It offers good exhibitions. I went there to a  music concert. If you go there you can learn a lot from the entire history of Queretaro from time to time.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

156828169.name: Aesthetically Pleasing Architecture
156828169.author: a TripAdvisor user
156828169.reviewBody: Construction on this former Franciscan Convent of Santiago began in the 16th century and further construction was in the 18th century.  It opened as a museum in 1936.  We loved strolling through the exhibits and pictures without flash were allowed.  I have a passion for corridors and this museum had beautiful ones.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

153338151.name: Lovely Small Historical Museum
153338151.author: a TripAdvisor user
153338151.reviewBody: There is a nice historical museum here as to Mexican history, and other exhibits. However, the big attraction of this museum is the lovely building itself, a converted but lovely, former Franciscan convent. The interior courtyard is beautiful and very relaxing.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

149742169.name: Nice Museum
149742169.author: a TripAdvisor user
149742169.reviewBody: We stumbled upon the museum and it was actually a free admission day. It had lovely displays that were laid out quite well and covered a lot of the history of Queretaro. The building itself is quite wonderful and has a beautiful courtyard garden.\n\n

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

140390183.name: Museo Regional - Queretaro, MX
140390183.author: a TripAdvisor user
140390183.reviewBody: Beautiful displays, the architecture is amazing and steeped in history.  Helpful if there were bilingual plaques but with a little pocket dictionary was able to get the gist of it all.  All meseums are closed on Monday, open on Tuesday and FREE on Tuesday\'s.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

130601189.name: Another Must See
130601189.author: a TripAdvisor user
130601189.reviewBody: Great emphasis on the history of Queretaro, especially the Maximilian brief and somewhat sad period. All paintings and other artifacts were exceptionally well preserved and easily viewed.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

125110114.name: Very informative
125110114.author: a TripAdvisor user
125110114.reviewBody: This museum covers the history of Queretero and environs from pre-Hispanic times up through the Mexican Revolution.  As a history buff, I found it very thoroughly detailed with artifacts, art and written explanations.  I speak/read Spanish, but the explanations are only in Spanish which I imagine would be very frustrating for a non-Spanish reader.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

121464723.name: Lovely building and displays
121464723.author: a TripAdvisor user
121464723.reviewBody: While I wish signage had been in English, too, it was still a really nice museum. I learned a lot of the rich history of Queretaro there.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

118199850.name: Reborn of a Franciscan Convent
118199850.author: a TripAdvisor user
118199850.reviewBody:
This is one of the most gorgeus convents in this world heritage city. The Franciscan Convent.

It has been abandoned but through consistent rehabilitation, today is a very beatiful and modern museum.

It tell us about history of Queretaro since prehispanic times up to the revolution.

The "patios" and gardens are very beautiful.

You can also see how use to be the life of the monks in this convent.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

117121862.name: Excellent museum
117121862.author: a TripAdvisor user
117121862.reviewBody: The Museo Regional offers a very thorough presentation of Mexican history with excellent maps, documents and articles from each period along with lots of information. Everything is in Spanish so an English-only visitor should try to make arrangements for a tour -- perhaps a tourist kiosk in the plaza could help. It would definitely be worth the effort. (By the way, the regional museum in Guanajuato is also a must for any history buff.) The museum also hosts a steady stream of music concerts and other events and has a good bulletin board listing cultural events in the city.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

59415891.name: A gem for those who understand Spanish
59415891.author: a TripAdvisor user
59415891.reviewBody: This excellent museum, immediately to the south of the Templo de San Francisco, does not receive the attention it deserves from foreign travelers. The ground floor has exhibits of pre Hispanic Mexico, while the second floor has great exhibits of Queretaro\'s critical role in the Mexican independence movement. Everything in the museum is in Spanish. Too bad that signage is not also in English.

address.streetAddress: Prolongacion Corregidora sur 3

589357170.name: Go if you can spare a day
589357170.author: a TripAdvisor user
589357170.reviewBody: We signed up for an 8 hour day tour to Sierra Gorda because we wanted to see some Franciscan missions. They were lovely but turned out to be the least breath taking part of our tour of this eco preserve. Parts of it -- particularly a short hike to a series of cascades and waterfalls -- were so gorgeous it was like being in a movie set! Make time if you can!

address.streetAddress: Jalpan de Serra No.1

550516926.name: Beautiful place great mountains
550516926.author: a TripAdvisor user
550516926.reviewBody: I went to Sierra Gouda on a 2 days squad trip. Great views and beautiful clean mountains. We started in San Joaquin and went all the way to camp amen to el Jabali. Great luxury camp. No phone, no WiFi. Just relax after the tour. Stop in Buraceli that is a old catholic mission is a must.

address.streetAddress: Jalpan de Serra No.1

437759965.name: Pinal de Amoles, Queretaro, Mexico (Near to the area)
437759965.author: a TripAdvisor user
437759965.reviewBody:
Now while I only past through the area I did stop at this little beautiful town and has so much beauty. From the people to just the location of the area just amazing.

Pinal de Amoles is a town located in Pinal de Amoles Municipality in
the state of Querétaro in central Mexico. It is part of the Sierra Gorda
region which stretches over northern Querétaro into Guanajuato, 
Hidalgo and San Luis Potosí, with 88% of the municipality’s 
land comprising the Sierra Gorda Biosphere Reserve

address.streetAddress: Jalpan de Serra No.1

369213581.name: Amazing reserve with so many different ecosystems
369213581.author: a TripAdvisor user
369213581.reviewBody: Stayed 2 nights there during a field trip. The place is really nice and pristine. Mountains go up to 3,000 meters are covered by trees at this height. In the contrary, the area close to Queretaro is desert-like. Really nice for hiking trips.

address.streetAddress: Jalpan de Serra No.1

339501194.name: Wonderful visit to Reserve with Sierra Gorda Ecotours!
339501194.author: a TripAdvisor user
339501194.reviewBody: We spent 2 wonderful, busy days with Eleno in the Sierra Gorda Biosphere Reserve....and would highly recommend it to people who want to see some of Mexico\'s natural beauty and rural lifestyle.  We only had time for the shorter tour, but in 2 days we were driven all over (the scenery alone is spectacular, the roads very windy, but Eleno did an excellent job driving), and hiked to a great overlook, hiked up a gorgeous river to Puente de Dios waterfall, watched the swifts fly out of the Golondrinas cave at dawn and visited Las Pozas near Xilitla.  The company was very flexible about what we wanted to see and made a custom tour, as we were the only guests.  Eleno was friendly, knowledgeable, spoke good English and seems to really love the area; we felt good knowing locals are working to save the natural values of the area.  We enjoyed visiting local towns and people, which gave us an interesting view of life in these mountains and the hard work people there do--SG Ecotours works with locals for food, lodging and guiding on the tour, so the communities directly benefit from ecotourism.  We hope Sierra Gorda Ecotours continues with success, as they are promoting conservation and sustainable tourism in this area.  Go with them on a tour and support their wonderful work and Mexico\'s Biosphere Reserve system!

address.streetAddress: Jalpan de Serra No.1

124234124.name: Diversity of Nature
124234124.author: a TripAdvisor user
124234124.reviewBody:
We usually visit Queretaro, so we are supposed to be common to the area. But this time we decided to go farther, to Sierra Gorda. I'll have to let behind Tequisquiapan and the wineries and cheese factories in the region. Go find out.

Nice trip i you are pacient.

Next stop from Tequis is Ezequiel Montes, can stop there and have a snack or a full meal if u want.  Exiting Ezequiel starts the half desert you´ll see for at least an hour an a half. Beautiful ride.

The winding road gets to mountains, there you see the change of the landscape. Turns green or sandy every time you round the mountain.

Have to be a serious traveler for this.

There are five 5 missions (Spanish established Missions to covert the Indians to Catholic)to visit: Jalpan, Concá, Landa, Tilaco y Tancoyól.

Basically the same.

Best places to eat and rest are in Jalpan. Try "Cecina" with "guacamole".

if you're adventerous enough, you can follow to Xilitla in San Luis state, but thats another story.

address.streetAddress: Jalpan de Serra No.1

664353656.name: Newborn Lambs and Exquisite Cheese
664353656.author: a TripAdvisor user
664353656.reviewBody:
My wife and I visited Rancho San Josemaria today and toured the property with Martin the owner. He's a former banker turned entrepreneur and along with his wife Catalina has built an impressive Queseria outside the city of Queretaro. 
We had a forty minute Uber ride from the city center to the Rancho and as recommended by Martin we negotiated with our driver to wait an hour and a half for us to finish our visit and cheese tasting, before returning us to the city. Martin greeted us at the front gate along with his dogs and took us inside to explain how he started the business. After showing us the International awards earned by his artesenal cheeses he gave us a quick peek at the wheels of cheese aging in storage before heading outside.
We walked through the garden past the milking stations until arriving at the sheep pens. The first pen had weaned lambs that were a few months old and very friendly. Next we saw the pen of Rams used to breed the ewes in the fall. Then we saw the newborn lambs with their mothers. They were very cute! Finally we saw large pens of ewes which produce the milk used in the cheese production.
Next, Martin explained the cheese making process to us and described the variety of cheeses they produce. After the tour we did an eight cheese tasting. It was fantastic! Each cheese tasted was unique with incredible flavor. We enjoyed a bottle of wine we brought from home and bought several cheeses after the tasting from Catalina. Overall, it was an excellent visit and we highly recommend it. Nice Rancho, friendly owners and unforgettable cheese!

address.streetAddress: Camino La Noria Km 2.5 El Milagro

629760895.name: Wonderful cheese, lovely couple, great visit.
629760895.author: a TripAdvisor user
629760895.reviewBody: Our visit to Rancho San Jose Maria was fantastic. The couple who own and operate it were so warm and welcoming and spoke very good English. The setting was pretty and the cheese was exceptional.

address.streetAddress: Camino La Noria Km 2.5 El Milagro

607231782.name: MUST VISIT: International Awarded Artisan Sheep Cheeses MADE IN MEXICO<3
607231782.author: a TripAdvisor user
607231782.reviewBody:
This has been one of a kind experience.  First getting to know Martin who started up with his wife this project.  Must know by fist hand their story.  It is fascinating to know the proud and enthusiasm they share with people this amazing project.  And after going around the ranch getting all the processes explanations you are able to crown your visit by a choice of 8 or 5 Cheese Tasting, for a fair price. Some of them internationally awarded.  

And finally you are able to purchase some of their exquisite cheeses and take them home. 

P.S.  You are able to take any bottle of wine, fruits, bread  for the tasting.  You only get the cheeses and an exquisite Organic Mesquite Honey to pair with the cheeses and some slices of bread.  Drinks, glassware, fruits, deli meats should be taken by visitors.  AND YOU DO CONTACT THE RANCH BEFORE SHOWING UP, TO SCHEDULE YOUR VISIT.

address.streetAddress: Camino La Noria Km 2.5 El Milagro

604122249.name: Amazing place
604122249.author: a TripAdvisor user
604122249.reviewBody: Had a great time visiting the ranch. The three dogs were so sweet and kept my little cousin entertained as we listened to our tour guide. The tour guide was very welcoming and answered all of our questions surrounding the sheep, the cheese making process, and anything else that crossed our minds. And the cheese tasting at the end was delicious (and very reasonably priced)! So glad we brought a bottle of wine to go with it. I highly recommend this place, it\u2019s a gem right outside of Qro.

address.streetAddress: Camino La Noria Km 2.5 El Milagro

584927211.name: Our visit to the most wonderful cheese ranch!
584927211.author: a TripAdvisor user
584927211.reviewBody: Our visit was thoroughly enjoyed by all of our family! The host was really nice and answered all of our questions. The cheeses are spectacular, especially the one with the red wine crust. And don\u2019t forget to try the honey too. Even the dogs were really friendly. We will surely go back soon!

address.streetAddress: Camino La Noria Km 2.5 El Milagro

579204458.name: Great experience and best cheese ever!!!
579204458.author: a TripAdvisor user
579204458.reviewBody:
I went with my family to visit the farm, which really turned into a great interesting project in Querétaro. We didn’t knew that all tours had to be pre reserved, but we where lucky to join a group that had just arrive are was about to begin. Is important to know that the last 2kms is a dirt road, but is not so bad and it worth the trip. 
The owners are the ones who receive you at the entrance and guide you through the property. We really enjoy all the explanation on how they started business and the sustainable sheep farm they have developed, my kids and I where really impressed and my wife in love with the sheep. 
The cost of the tour includes the cheese that is given at the end, different prices depend on the amount is cheese you want to eat. Also it is recommended to bring your own bottles of wine to share with the cheese at the end.

address.streetAddress: Camino La Noria Km 2.5 El Milagro

567721642.name: Not worth a visit
567721642.author: a TripAdvisor user
567721642.reviewBody:
Difficult to reach. Bad roads and almost total absence of road signs.
Mediocre visitor reception and little variety of cheeses to be tasted.
No tour of the premises.was offered or given.
However, cheeses and ricotta produced here are good. 
So, we asked the wife of the owner about the places in Queretaro where their products are sold. And that was it.

address.streetAddress: Camino La Noria Km 2.5 El Milagro

565592355.name: Springtime lambs and award winning cheeses!
565592355.author: a TripAdvisor user
565592355.reviewBody: My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our visit, tour and cheese tasting at the Rancho San Josemaria! Just outside of Queretaro, we were introduced to this little gem of a sheep ranch, organic, and natural, in that their animals are left to do what Nature does best, with one spring birthing each year in its natural cycle rather than forced breeding and more births a year. The animals are treated humanely and lovingly; even the dogs love the animals! The babies stay with their mother\'s for quite a while before being moved out, and the sheep are kept in their natural groups, the young and adult males patiently waiting for the spring babies to move on without their mothers. Their herd is growing each year, which is good, as their excellent cheese has won many World Cheese prizes, now, and the word has gotten out! After a detailed tour and visit of the fram, we had a little picnic with wine, cheese, honey and the most amazing ice cream, like frozen cheesecake! We were told that large groups and organizations can come here to arrange a large picnic on the site is so desired. We were pleased that we were able to get the tour in English, as it saved our tour guide and translator Uriel from Bike Tour Queretaro of having to do the technical translating! It was his suggestion that we make a visit here, and we are so glad that we did! I am sorry that I do not recall the name of the lovely young woman who gave us our private tour and picnic, but thank you! Merci beaucoup de Montr\u00e9al, Canada! Muchas gracias!

address.streetAddress: Camino La Noria Km 2.5 El Milagro

534186090.name: Delicious Cheese and Ice Cream.
534186090.author: a TripAdvisor user
534186090.reviewBody: This place is very remote.  Andrea, who was originally from Kansas City, conducted our tour.  She quoted us three prices (depends on how many you want to try) for taste testing the cheese made at the Ranch.  Some of the cheeses have won World Cheese Awards in London. We were then given a tour of the farm.  Afterwards, we set outside under shade to eat our cheese.  We were missing our dogs and they had three.  The Labrador will take any attention you will give her.  One of the blue heelers, loves to play fetch.  He will continue to bring you a little pieces of wood for you to toss.  Be careful of the other blue-heeler, he wants to play "keep" and when you hold the stick too long, he will try to assist with getting it out of your hands. Ouch!!!

address.streetAddress: Camino La Noria Km 2.5 El Milagro

665518736.name: Nice, fun and relaxing
665518736.author: a TripAdvisor user
665518736.reviewBody: I went to the bicentennial park in Quer\u00e9taro 3 months ago this is a place that has different attractions such as rides, zip line, pools.  \nThis is a place for the whole family can be visited at any time of year although the best is in spring because the pools are cold water and you can only enter this season.  \nThe mechanical games are very funny for the whole family there is also a very funny scare house that if you go you will leave scared.  It is recommended to take your own food because inside the place it is very expensive.  When I went, the zip line was not enabled but it looked very exciting

address.streetAddress: Calle Bicentenario #10

598919408.name: Good Value, Good Park
598919408.author: a TripAdvisor user
598919408.reviewBody: We visited this park as a family last weekend and i have to admit its way better than the one in Guanajuato.

address.streetAddress: Calle Bicentenario #10

582855486.name: Meh. If your in the area with nothing to do then worth a visit.
582855486.author: a TripAdvisor user
582855486.reviewBody: So the family we went with had a suicidal son so him going on and on about him wanting to kill himself took away some of the enjoyment. Not many rides are free including the haunted house, go carts, boating, most of the rides in the front. Although I must say that the rollercoaster was ok, not the best rollercoaster ever but ok. Please note that kids under a meter can\'t go in the pools, no matter if your a good swimmer or not. Later a woman told us that a poor kid had drowned in the pool I swam in only a week ago, I don\'t know if it was true but It would explain why no kids are allowed in the pool anymore. The pool slides are quite good, although the purple one I felt like it had no air and I was so glad when I found the other end. Also note that only 2 slides are actually running, the others are shut for now.

address.streetAddress: Calle Bicentenario #10

568486974.name: Best Bicentennial park, I know.
568486974.author: a TripAdvisor user
568486974.reviewBody: Including pools from all sizes, picnic \u00e1reas, zoo, farm, birds sanctuary, mechanic games, train, Lake, Wild/wet , river, calm river, simply the best day that you can imagine

address.streetAddress: Calle Bicentenario #10

559092041.name: Excellent value - so impressed
559092041.author: a TripAdvisor user
559092041.reviewBody: We visited this park with local friends when we were staying near Queretaro. I can\'t say enough good things about this place. There was so much to do, and our kids stayed active and engaged the entire afternoon that we were there. At 50 pesos a person, this park represents incredible value.

address.streetAddress: Calle Bicentenario #10

542242193.name: Enjoyable day out
542242193.author: a TripAdvisor user
542242193.reviewBody:
Enjoyable day out with the children. Great for young children. Small rides which were perfect. Only a couple of rides for older children/adults. Entrance was very very cheap, only 50 pesos each.  Nice walk round even if you don’t like rides. There’s a train ride plus some activities on the lake for a small additional cost. Food available inside, lots of food outlets although selling the same types of fast food. Very strict on not letting you take your own food and drink in which is understandable with the minimal entrance fee. 
Live entertainment on when we went on Sunday, although not sure if this was because it was a holiday. 
The water park area was not open.
You could spend two hours here or all day at your own leisure.

address.streetAddress: Calle Bicentenario #10

410159413.name: You will stay busy
410159413.author: a TripAdvisor user
410159413.reviewBody: This is a nice place to go with family. There\'s attractions for all ages and a waterpark! I even got to zipline for the first time. The staff is very friendly.

address.streetAddress: Calle Bicentenario #10

401384652.author: a TripAdvisor user

The park is cheap to enter around 50 pesos and with this you can go on various rides which are very good and you can also enter the swimming pool and slides. The park is really nice and when we went it wasn\'t too busy, which meant very little queuing for the rides.
