368608196.name: Relaxing day at the park
368608196.author: a TripAdvisor user
368608196.reviewBody:
Great park for the FAMILY. if you are looking for a 6 flags or Universal Studios standard, no way. Its a really good family theme park though to keep small kids entertained. 

To get here I took bus 74/121 from the bus stop outside the Northern autobus station. It goes all the way there! 

Apart from the roller coasters etc, there have a water theme park within it as well with water slides and all. I really found it muy divertido most especially because there was not much queue. 

Very affordable. Only 40 pesos which get you on most rides plus 25 pesos for lockers.

These coasters were perfect for this family park, and fun to ride.

address.streetAddress: Calle Bicentenario #10

190846333.name: Nice place for a family and friends day!
190846333.author: a TripAdvisor user
190846333.reviewBody:
I have visited the "Parque Bicentenario" on two ocasions, one in summer and the last was in winter. The first time, we visited the pool area, which has several pools for kids or "chapoteaderos" and big pools for teens/adults. There is staff to help the visitors in some aquatic rides but in every pool the water is really cold (at least for me) even though it was a very sunny day. There are facilities like bathrooms and locker rooms, there are also food vendors with simple food like hamburguers and hot dogs. the place is very affordable for families, with plenty of space to stroll and visit the area with amusement park rides.
My visit on winter was very different. Second day of January, afternoon and lots of cold (almost freezing) winter wind with kids. It wasn't a good choice, however, there were many families with kids, and the day had been sunny enough, with christmas shows for kids on a big tent. 
Due to the weather conditions, we decided to leave early to find a warmer place for the kids.
However, I think it is a very recommendable place to spent a nice day with friends and  family, although a car is needed to get there comfortably. The fee is cheap and bottled beverages are forbidden, only prepared food can be introduced to the park.

address.streetAddress: Calle Bicentenario #10

180479918.name: Nice facility - good day out for a family - if they are open
180479918.author: a TripAdvisor user
180479918.reviewBody: This is a nice government run facility - nice, clean and big with amusement park rides, plenty ot food vendors, giant swimming/aquatic facilities for adults and kids.  Plenty of places to stroll and picnic. Lots of things to amuse children (miniature train, tram ride, etc.) - the only thing is the rather odd schedule - the park is only open from Thurs thru Sun and closed 3 days a week and then the pool and aquatics are closed most of the autumn, winter and spring. Odd - because in Queretaro, that is some of the best swimming weather (today October 10 for example it is sunny with 86 deg F).  Meanwhile it rains almost all summer. Go figure>>>>Only the government could run something with a schedule like that

address.streetAddress: Calle Bicentenario #10

169801704.name: Decent (enough) theme park
169801704.author: a TripAdvisor user
169801704.reviewBody: As the only real theme park in the city, it is very far from its distant cousins in the US, but has a nice lake, and a couple of decent rides for little children mixed with local history. The park has a big pool with slides, a train runaround that surrounds an artificial lake. Big parking. And cheap tickets all year long.

address.streetAddress: Calle Bicentenario #10

162528431.name: Fun Day
162528431.author: a TripAdvisor user
162528431.reviewBody: A really fun day for the entire family.  Lots of swimming activities and great rides -- appropriate for each member of the family.

address.streetAddress: Calle Bicentenario #10

157239211.name: It\'s okay.
157239211.author: a TripAdvisor user
157239211.reviewBody: For the area it\'s located, this park is pretty nice. If you\'re traveling around to visit amusement parks, you may want to skip this one. The park has a small selection of rides, and the coasters are sub-par. Montana Rusa is pretty rough, and you\'ll need a child if you want to ride Selva del Raton. My favorite attraction here was the Reptile House. It was only 15 pesos to see over 80 animals. The food selection here is a decent collection of independent food trailers. Finally, I will give this park props for keeping the place gorgeous. There are plenty of gardens and the paths were spotless.

106102383.name: Fantastic value family-orientated leisure park
106102383.author: a TripAdvisor user
106102383.reviewBody:
Parque Bicentenario is a relatively new municipal attraction around 20 minutes drive to the north of Queretaro city, in the region of Juriquilla and Santa Rosa Jauregui. It's a large site zoned into different areas, with adult fairground rides in one section (rollercoaster, pirate ship, river rapids ride, dodgem cars among others), children's fairground rides in another (small "caterpillar" and "mouse" rollercoasters, traditional carousel, jumping frog ride among others), a lake with pedalo-type boats for hire and a scenic railway around the edge, a small arena for "charro"-type shows, a large covered area for picnics, an aquatic park section with large waterslides, a zipslide across the lake, and other small attractions. Complementing the site are a medical centre, small athletic stadium and school.

 The whole site is clean and well maintained. The cost is currently only 35 pesos, an incredible bargain as it gives you access to all attractions with the exception of the boats and the zipslide, for which there is an extra charge. The site is open from 11am to 6pm from Tuesday to Sunday in holiday season, and Thursday to Sunday the rest of the time.

 General tips:

 1) Public transport from the center of Queretaro is on routes 74 and 121.

2) There are two car parks for the site. The easiest to get to is on the Av 5 de febrero, and is marked for public transport only, although most people that take their own cars seem to prefer to park there too. The other is on the libramiento Norponiente - San Miguel de Allende. This second car park is 1km from the park, there is a shuttle bus, or the walk is very easy (downhill). On busier days the first car park gets very busy with long queues to enter the park. The second car park is much quieter.

 3) You may take your own food into the park if it is already prepared and packaged (in plastic containers for example). No cooking allowed in the park. No glass containers.

4) Nobody may take any drinks or liquids into the park. All drink to be purchased inside.

5) The sun is incredibly fierce and shade is at a premium, take hats and plenty of high-factor sunscreen to apply frequently, especially in the water park.

6) Food stalls are scattered around the park, a burger-fries-and-drink package will cost around 50 to 60 pesos. There are ice cream stalls and plenty of places to buy drinks.

7) Each ride has height restrictions that are strictly enforced. On some rides children must be accompanied by an adult. 

 In summary, this is an wonderful family-friendly and safe attraction, and in comparison with its very low entrance fee offers huge value for money. Just make sure you leave enough time to enjoy all the park has to offer (a whole day at least!).

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

669282622.name: Rigorous climb, but glorious views!
669282622.author: a TripAdvisor user
669282622.reviewBody: We came ready to climb the lower (not professional) part of the monolith.  It was all rock with almost no shade, and we weren\'t used to the altitude, but our efforts were completely worth it!  The path was easy to follow, and it had many hikers - mostly Spanish speaking.  The grand scenery from high up is beautiful, and what a sense of accomplishment!  Would recommend this highly, but use common sense.  If you\'re not relatively fit, it will be hard.   Some people brought babies or little kids and had a hard time managing.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

668456749.name: Wow!
668456749.author: a TripAdvisor user
668456749.reviewBody: My husband and I arranged a private tour to Bernal. The area is beautiful and the "rock" is very impressive. We viewed it from a  distance and then up close, but didn\'t hike up. Afterward we went into town for lunch. The village is lovely and we had a tasty, inexpensive meal at El Negrito.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

662272466.name: No longer charming little town, only a tourist trap
662272466.author: a TripAdvisor user
662272466.reviewBody:
Unfortunately, another small town that fell prey to its own tourism success.  All that is left is a bunch of cheap knick-knacks, drinks or tours for sale.  There is very little soul or a sense of pride still inhabiting the town.  A continuous train of vendors all the way up and down the streets, harassing passersby folks with non-stop selling.  I came early, climbed the monolith as far as allowed and quickly left again, not enjoying the atmosphere.  I couldn’t wait to get out after the climb.  

I am a fit 60-year-old and it took me 30-35 minutes to climb all the way up and 45 to get back down since I had to wait for so many people to pass by before continuing.  Do this early before the heat and the crowd.  Not as difficult as people say but one needs to be careful.  I can’t believe some people come here only wearing sandals, good shoes are recommended for traction on the slippery rocks.  

The view is not that interesting especially since the air is so dirty and dusty.  One does this climb more for feeling of self-satisfaction and accomplishment.  There are good Gorditas Negras (blue corn gorditas) or Pencas de Nopal (family size meal for 5-10 people) waiting at the base of the walk that are well priced and delicious.  

There were some hired helpers lending a hand in the more dangerous spots.  

You are supposed to get a plastic bracelet showing you paid (or in my case free because I am old) or that you have signed in.  I saw many folks bypassed this going up without signing up or paying.  That is sad that people don’t want to support the good work these people do by providing clean-up, some safety, and some upgrade to the path (which can use more but it’s a start).  It’s a cheap price to pay to help the next person as well.  (I noticed it was mostly foreigners who skipped to pay, the locals paid).  What does that say about foreign tourists?  It’s a bit shameful if you ask me.  

Another beautiful spot tarnished by bad tourism.  I wish there was another way.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

662208925.name: Great fun
662208925.author: a TripAdvisor user
662208925.reviewBody:
Very cute village, good food and jovial atmosphere.

The climb is fun and does not require any technical skill, just caution. They sell water at some point along the way, but the sun is intense so best you bring your own to be sure. Sun cream and a hat are also necessary.

The view is not spectacular, but it is a very pleasant outing for the whole family.

Just be careful, the path needs to be improved and can present a risk to inattentive climbers, especially children.

The last bit near the top (as far as you can go without ropes I mean) is a little tricky, so watch out.

Would definitely do it again!

The same artesania as\nQueretaro or Guadalajara, same prices and only some food is local. Not too much advantage over Quer\u00e9taro, which probably has less dust. As for the rock, itself, the climb is only for experts they say. Path is steep and slippery. There are many tour companies with jeeps who will take you part way up. The rest of the way is only for mountaineers. Take pictures, it\u2019s best remembered that way.

In the evening, illuminated \u201cdancing fountains\u201d bring to life the base of the monolith.   The town has a wide selection of shops with local crafts, silver jewellery and textiles.  A variety of restaurants make this a great place for a day visit.

598586623.author: a TripAdvisor user
598586623.reviewBody: You should go yo yhis magical place read first before you go, walk around the town buy some groceries you will have an excelent time

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

591932519.name: Bernal, Mexico, a Pueblo Magico
591932519.author: a TripAdvisor user
591932519.reviewBody: Bernal is a quaint, historic pueblo, about a half hour drive from Queretaro.  Towering above the town is La Pena, a 300 meter rock cliff. It\'s gorgeous to look at and there is a tourist trail that takes you fairly far up. The trail is somewhat strenuous, but you can buy beers and all kinds of trinkets along the way. \nThe town itself is designated by the Mexican government as a Pueblo Magico, which means its a great tourist destination. So on the week end it\'s packed. During the week it\'s really quiet with many shops shut down. \nWe stayed in town at Hotel Posada. Walk to all the restaurants and the tourist trail. We are rock climbers so we climbed to the top of La Pena a couple of times. Fun, scenic and not crowded.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

590269648.name: Very nice cozy place
590269648.author: a TripAdvisor user
590269648.reviewBody: This is a great autentin Mexican place.\nThe little place have great markets and restaurants. The view of the "Rock" is beutifull. It is a must go place if You are in the area

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

579101830.name: Very nice place to spend the day with the family, also if you are looking for adventure, to climb La Pe\u00f1a is a must. Nic
579101830.author: a TripAdvisor user
579101830.reviewBody: Very nice place to spend the day with the family, also if you are looking for adventure, to climb La Pe\u00f1a is a must. Nice restaurants for a tasty breakfast and meals, try Mezcal and Pulque on specialized stores

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

574017841.name: One of the very great spots
574017841.author: a TripAdvisor user
574017841.reviewBody: If you want to climb up, you should be there very early in the morning. Never underestimate the sunny days. If you don\'t want, walking around is a good option , there are various nice spots.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

564915014.name: La Pena de Bernal a lovely day trip from the City of Queretaro
564915014.author: a TripAdvisor user
564915014.reviewBody: La Pena de Bernal is a lovely day trip to make, whether you want to try the hike to the top of the Pena, or wander around the cute little town and visit the stores, boutiques and artisan shops. We really enjoyed the shop where they made blankets and woolen things. The old weaving machines of a bygone era still being used here.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

564358949.name: Natural wonder
564358949.author: a TripAdvisor user
564358949.reviewBody: Beautiful and traditional Mexican town with an incredible Monolith - we will like to go Back with more time to enjoy the area and the climb the Monolith

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

560611813.name: Day trip\ud83c\udf2e
560611813.author: a TripAdvisor user
560611813.reviewBody: Perfect for a day trip when staying in Queretaro. Try the local food and enjoy the unique atmosphere of this beautiful small city.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

560026229.name: It is a beautiful place, a magical town.
560026229.author: a TripAdvisor user
560026229.reviewBody: Pe\u00f1a de Bernal is an excellent place to walk and enjoy an afternoon walking and seeing traditional crafts of Mexico, an excellent view from the heights and an atmosphere of peace, sell delicious food and homemade ice cream, a nice visit.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

558723121.name: great little town
558723121.author: a TripAdvisor user
558723121.reviewBody: the claim to fame of Bernal is la Pena, one of the biggest monolith rocks in the world. It\'s a steep hike but very popular. The town itself is buzzing with tourists and there are little shops and restaurants everywhere. Definitely worth a visit.\n.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

555607630.name: Higher than the Rock of Gibraltar
555607630.author: a TripAdvisor user
555607630.reviewBody: We visited Bernal after a morning in Tequis. It is a short drive from one to the other.  The town is very clean and interesting for a half day visit. We ate gordas at one of the traditional places on the main square near the church, although there are lots of eating options in the town.  The kids took the tour-trip around the stone and said that was fun. Bernal is higher than the Rock of Gibraltar, so that is an interesting fact.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

554288093.name: Out-of-town trip from San Miguel de Allendd
554288093.author: a TripAdvisor user
554288093.reviewBody: We made a Day trip to Tequisquiapan and\nPena del Bernal. It was wonderful to see the monolith appear to rise out of the earth as we approached it. We watched the climbers attempting to get to the top with their climbing gear! We enjoyed seeing the precious and semi-precious stones of the region for sale. Some of our party walked up to the level at which the climbers with their gear start to the top of the monolith.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

553866190.name: Don\'t miss this place - Great day trip
553866190.author: a TripAdvisor user
553866190.reviewBody: This place is for you if you like great weather, culture, crafts, gifts and souvenirs.   The Pe\u00f1a de Bernal is a nice quaint place to visit and spend some quality time.  It\'s about 45 minutes from the center of Queretaro and easy to reach by car.  My wife and I spend the better part of a day here to take in the sights and have a great meal at the Terracielo restaurant.   Kind of hard to find but well worth the view, experience and a nice meal on the roof.  We saw many hiking the mountain and would like to try it some day when we are back.  It definitely looks like a challenge.  Parking can be a bit of a challenge but we found a spot on the main road coming in and walked in.  Tours are offered but we chose to explore on foot on our own.  This is a unique experience worth the time and effort.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

552277596.name: Fun family stop
552277596.author: a TripAdvisor user
552277596.reviewBody: Had fun! Saw the monolith and climbed part way up. Take a minute and enjoy a \u201cpaleta de tamarindo con chamoy\u201d from a local vendor if you are adventurous!!!

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

551211228.name: Worth hiking
551211228.author: a TripAdvisor user
551211228.reviewBody: This mountain is a nice excuse to get some exercise and fresh air.\nThere is trail to the middle of this mountain so you can easily climb it.\nIf you want to go beyond this point you should sue proper equipment and maybe get a guide. After this you can eat and drink something at the bottom of the mountain and even but some handicrafts.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

548498651.name: Great panorama
548498651.author: a TripAdvisor user
548498651.reviewBody: This is a great place to go out early and planning on staying around most the day. Plan on bringing friends and enjoy the hiking to half to the top. \ud83d\ude2cyes i didn\u2019t do my research before going so my friends and I could climb to the top on a weekday!\nOnly on weekends you can climb to the top with a tour guide... but the view even from halfway is amazing!! I wasn\u2019t very upset about not going to the very top because along the way there are several places that sell drinks (concessions). Overall it was a great experience. Would definitely go again and highly recommend it.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

547744034.name: A lovely traditional Mexican hillside village.
547744034.author: a TripAdvisor user
547744034.reviewBody: Really a must-see if you\'re visiting Queretaro.  A short 45 minute drive, you can just stroll and grab a bite, you can spend the night at several different spas, or you can hike up La Pena if you\'re feeling athletic.  It;s the third biggest megalith in the world, after Gibraltar and Ayer\'s Rock.  Your photographs will take themselves!

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

536765473.name: Fountains to music
536765473.author: a TripAdvisor user
536765473.reviewBody: the fountains set to music and all lit up in the middle of the square were truely worth a visit - with free parking just around the corner

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

533471029.name: Terrific views from the platform
533471029.author: a TripAdvisor user
533471029.reviewBody: The hike to the platform can be a bit challenging in spots but well worth the effort. You can see for miles from this point. \nThe town is clean and very friendly with great food options - they are known for their gorditas!

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

532174059.name: Interesting
532174059.author: a TripAdvisor user
532174059.reviewBody: We enjoyed not only the view but also the town of Bernal. This is well worth your time. If you\'re pressed for time and have an afternoon flight you can take an Uber out and back comfortably. We paid $1100 pesos for the Uber.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

530940597.name: Wonderful place
530940597.author: a TripAdvisor user
530940597.reviewBody: The natural beauty and to see 1 amongst the 7 monolithic rocks is amazing. Unfortunately the weather was not good and we could not take a walk but still the place is great with good Mexican foods, crafts and a church. Perfect place to spend a day

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

529377722.name: A most see in Queretaro if you are a nature enthusiast.
529377722.author: a TripAdvisor user
529377722.reviewBody: Cute little town in Queretaro where you will see and can climb a big monolith. There is plenty of restaurants to enjoy a nice meal after walking around the town or climbing the rock.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

528502890.name: Day trip from Queretaro
528502890.author: a TripAdvisor user
528502890.reviewBody: Well worth the trip (about an hour) from Queretaro. This is a small town with a striking natural monolith rising up at the edge of town. It\u2019s a popular and busy spot with many people making the \u2018pilgrimage\u2019 to the (almost) top. It\u2019s tricky under foot and gets hot - so best done early with a decent pair of trainers/ sneakers.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

524082899.name: I didn\'t feel the magic
524082899.author: a TripAdvisor user
524082899.reviewBody: The second largest monolith in the world is the Bernal. It is in the magical town of Pena de Bernal. I thought I might feel some mysticism, but I didn\'t. It is a nice little town with crafts and restaurants.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

522057193.name: Lovely colonial town with great view of natural rock
522057193.author: a TripAdvisor user
522057193.reviewBody: Short drive from Tequisquiapan - enjoyed some local ice cream as we walked around. Did some shopping for locally made wool garments. Fun time visiting and buying some regional candy. Hope to return to eat some of the "gorditas" which Bernal is known for. A nice afternoon visit.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

518356547.name: Beautiful
518356547.author: a TripAdvisor user
518356547.reviewBody: One of the biggest natural rock formations in the world. Great little gift stands to buy your perfect mementos and even a little restaurant to enjoy a cool beverage and maybe some lunch. You\'ll love this part of your trip.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

514565560.name: Beautiful town
514565560.author: a TripAdvisor user
514565560.reviewBody: If you go to Queretaro, Bernal is just about 45 minutes driving, is worth viisting this small town, with great food, people, shopping areas

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

510735685.name: Very good way to spend a Saturday or Sunday
510735685.author: a TripAdvisor user
510735685.reviewBody: Pena de Bernal is really awesome you can go and walk to half of the pena or if you have all the skills and equipment you can go to the top. it has a very beautiful view and you can also walk around the village and have lunch in the different restaurants. \nThere are a lot of restaurants but my favorites are Piave (Italian food) Los Mezquites (mexican food with excellente view of the Pe\u00f1a) or go to taste the gorditas there are several but I do not have a favorite one. \nIf you can you can also plan to visit the nearby vineyards, like Freixenet. If so I will go to Freixenet first and then to the Pena and then to have lunch and later on to visit the town.  I am sure you will enjoy it!

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

509181499.name: Loved the place and the kids enjoyed as well!
509181499.author: a TripAdvisor user
509181499.reviewBody: Excellent place to go with the whole family. My 2 young kids loved the tour with the four wheeled bikes that goes close to the Pena. Everyone very friendly and the small village is very pleasant.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

506221831.name: Beautiful town of Bernal
506221831.author: a TripAdvisor user
506221831.reviewBody: Worth to stop for lunch to end our day of activities at the wineries. Love  local delicacy "Nopal en su Madre"

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

505442511.name: So Awesome !
505442511.author: a TripAdvisor user
505442511.reviewBody: Pe\u00f1a del bernal was one of my favorite things that I did while I was in Mexico. A group of us ranging from 7 years old to a 40 years old, were all able too do it! When we got to the top it started raining and it did get a TINY bit slippery in many places but there are also many places to take cover and wait for the rain too pass. It was a medium size mountain with a view of a huge mountain. Would DEFINITELY go back!

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

503974999.name: Large Monolith (sign says 3rd largest
503974999.author: a TripAdvisor user
503974999.reviewBody: We made a morning trip to Tequisquiapan and then went to Pe\u00f1a de Bernal in the afternoon. In the traditional religions it is considered a power point for rituals.\nScaling it is possible with proper equipment. Kinds of quartz and other semi-precious stones are on sale and there are opals as well!\nThe stones below are rose quartz and lapislazuli quartz.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

499065023.name: Amazing Experiene,
499065023.author: a TripAdvisor user
499065023.reviewBody: If you want a high adrenaline experience this is it. Great but challenging hike and then climb to the top followed by a fun repelling rock bouncing way down. Our guides were super  with our safety being number one. Lunch afterwards at a local cafe hit the spot. Oh, by the way, did I mention that I am 79?

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

493097837.name: Bernal is enchanting
493097837.author: a TripAdvisor user
493097837.reviewBody: Took an hour Uber trip from Queretaro to Bernal on a lovely Sunday for less than $500 pesos. The driver waited for us for a peso per minute. This spot is rather magical, you can climb La Pena with a guide and the market and surrounding shops have nice quality semi-precious stones and hand made clothing. \n\nDon\'t miss Bernal!

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

492069521.name: amazing
492069521.author: a TripAdvisor user
492069521.reviewBody: Only 60 min outside of Queretero,  this place is freaking awesome.  the town is shockingly beautiful.  and the rock is a world class attention.  get the tour. it\'s cheap and you\'ll never get the details without out.  read up on the geology off the rock too. you\'ll be amazed to learn how it formed.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

486864389.name: Worth a stop
486864389.author: a TripAdvisor user
486864389.reviewBody: We passed through this town during our trip in Queretaro.  Quaint and small town with a host of beautiful artisan goods.  The monolith is one of the world\'s tallest and you can hike up to a certain point.  Keep in mind the heat of the day though for hiking (morning would be best) and the town closes down at 6pm, so shop earlier in the day if you want to stroll along to see everything.\n\nSide note:  this town is known for unusual activity (UFOs appearing in sky and on film, spirits, etc.), so if you like or are interested in these things, keep your eyes open!  I actually caught some unusual pics during my visit as well.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

486716087.name: Good
486716087.author: a TripAdvisor user
486716087.reviewBody: You shall visit this town . It is mixed of old culture and modern life . Make time to climb the rock . And try to bargain for your merchandise . Lots of ic cream to try out .\nInteresting

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

485494112.name: Must go in Queretaro
485494112.author: a TripAdvisor user
485494112.reviewBody:
To be honest, la Peña is just a big rock. From what our tourist guide told us, it's the third biggest rock in the world. So, you must go see it.
La Peña has a small town "magic town" near it. The town is very beautiful. Its architecture has been preserved and you can evem go to tours that tells you some local myths and stories.
A must go to site if you visit the state of Queretaro.

As a bonus tip, if you go to Bernal, please try its gordita of blue corn and their very own apple beer.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

482728762.name: Great to visit but be careful when!
482728762.author: a TripAdvisor user
482728762.reviewBody: We went with a group of friends but it was a very hot day and a long weekend; so the place was like a zoo and too much for my 6 year old. Defiant worth a visit, I think it\'s the 2nd or 3rd largest rock in the world. The town is very quant and picturesque! The restaurants were full but we found a place that had a roof top restaurant that was great! I didn\'t even try to climb the Pe\u00f1a..... the view from the roof top restaurant was enough for a doused good photos and a cold drink.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

479615417.name: Beautiful
479615417.author: a TripAdvisor user
479615417.reviewBody: Really cool climb on a beautiful piece of nature. The centre is cosy and fun to go shopping or just walk around.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

476362651.name: Small town away from the city
476362651.author: a TripAdvisor user
476362651.reviewBody: This is a quaint town several hours away from Mexico City.  I went during the week, and it was a great trip, not crowded.  Small businesses all around, cool shopping, touristy.  The monolith is viewable from all around, but do go close to it to get some better pics!  Interesting place to visit.  There are some shops where you can view weaving, there are some shops with jewelry, opals are common in these shops.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

475293368.name: The Rock
475293368.author: a TripAdvisor user
475293368.reviewBody: We would have never gone here had it not been for our local friends in San Miguel. They drove us here to Bernal to experience a local Mexican town complete with an incredible view of the rock formation that looms over the town. A visit here will get you away from the Gringos and expose you to the local experience of this Mexican town.\nThe shops are unique, the street cafes will dazzle you.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

469214249.name: Beautiful, cozy little town
469214249.author: a TripAdvisor user
469214249.reviewBody: Loved this place, they have great, black corn sopes, they were dulicious.... Shopping was great and inexpensive

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

465922084.name: A nice sightseeing trip ...
465922084.author: a TripAdvisor user
465922084.reviewBody: La Pena de Bernal is a rock formation, one of the tallest on earth ... the nearby town is a tourist mecca ... quaint shops and cafe\'s around a lovely manicured plaza ...

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

465601190.name: Beautiful Views
465601190.author: a TripAdvisor user
465601190.reviewBody: While visiting Queretaro with my Fiance, he took me to Bernal because it was where some of his family is from. The town is so beautiful and there is so much culture there. This is definitely a great day trip idea! We didn\'t walk all the way up but we still got some great views and photographs! Expect to spend some time in the town just wandering around and eat some wonderful Gorditas while you are there!

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

464681070.name: Perfect one day trip
464681070.author: a TripAdvisor user
464681070.reviewBody: We took a one day trip from Queretaro to Bernal. Local bus takes 45 min and costs around 65 pesos per person one way trip. We got there at 11 o\'clock in the morning which is a bit too late since sun is very strong already. I strongly recommend to get there at 8, have some breakfast there and then head to the monolite to climb. The mountain is only like 1,5 km approx from the bus stop but the last part is quite climby so if you see a small kind of tuc tuc taxi by the road take it to the foot of the mountain. You will climb enough. (30 pesos for 2 ppl) It is possible to climb half the mountain without any special Equipment. It is quite steep and warm but with plenty of resting spots along the way. Bring water and maybe a snack. It is a quite physically challenging walk since the steps can be high. Interesting to read about the mountain on the several info boards also. We enjoyed a perfect Italian coffe at Caf\u00e9 del Cielo and had great food and service at Meson the la Roca restaurant. I can warmly recommend both. If you would like to stay a night we visited briefly hotel Centenario very nice old hotel that also arranges horse back riding tours and Temazcal experiences.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

463349517.name: Very beautiful point of view
463349517.author: a TripAdvisor user
463349517.reviewBody:
Very nice touristic place, only 40min from Queretaro.
You. An hike to the top or just walk down the valley and in the pittoresque village.
Many good tacos places.
Best to go at sunset where the light on the rock is beautiful.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

461697017.name: Queretaro Trip 2017
461697017.author: a TripAdvisor user
461697017.reviewBody: Beautiful place to visit, open markets, great taquerias, weather was fantastic, trip to the mountain was fun. Will come back for sure.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

459301083.name: Fun day out at the Pena de Bernal
459301083.author: a TripAdvisor user
459301083.reviewBody: The town where the Pena is located is small but charming. There\'s a nice square with lots of shops, food stalls and places to shop. The Pena is beautiful, you can climb and do some hiking but only do it if you have enough experience. If you are not into climbing up, you can wait at the bottom having a cold beer in one of the many restaurants. There\'s also a tourist bus that takes you around town. it\'s a fun experience as the bus is a bit big for some of the narrow and steep streets!\nThe town also has lots of old houses that are open to the public to visit, don\'t be shy and go in, some of them have kept the original room decorations from the 1900s.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

458342094.name: Nice views from the town
458342094.author: a TripAdvisor user
458342094.reviewBody: The town is great for a weekend visit. Plenty of food types and restaurants to choose from if you want to try regional cuisine. Take the tour bus if you want a quick overview of attractions. You can find different type of activities or tours to the monolith. If you are driving there,Plan to arrive early on high season to find parking space available.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

458317097.name: Lovely town
458317097.author: a TripAdvisor user
458317097.reviewBody: If you go to Quer\u00e9taro, the visit to the town of Pe\u00f1a de Bernal is a must! Very lovely colonial town, with a variety of shops and restaurants to spend a day or more.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

456690850.name: Great Place.
456690850.author: a TripAdvisor user
456690850.reviewBody: I\'ve been there more than 10 times and I won\'t stop because is a place full of magic and great place to spend time with family or friends.  Do not hesitate to visit this place because you won\'t regret.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

455778344.name: definitely worth a visit!
455778344.author: a TripAdvisor user
455778344.reviewBody: We went on a  Sunday in mid-January , taking a one hour bus trip from Quer\u00e9taro. The bus is not difficult to navigate from the central bus station, but it helps if you speak some Spanish.  (Note that the last bus back to Queretaro leaves  at 6 pm.)\n We had been told that a lot of the stands in Bernal are only open on Sunday and that is the best day to go.  That is probably true;  but it was pretty crowded.  That didn\'t effect the shopping, but if your purpose in going is that you  want to climb to the summit with some privacy, it would be best to go a different day of the week. \nThe town itself was very lively, and family oriented, and there are lots of local crafts and interesting food choices.  Definitely a fun place to walk around and have lunch.  The hike up the Pena is beautiful. Not an easy walk for sure but great views along the way.  Definitely a memorable experience!

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

451100567.name: very  nice and magnetic
451100567.author: a TripAdvisor user
451100567.reviewBody: excellent view, a lot of energy, excellent food, very romantic for couples, beautiful handcrafts, colorfull and wonderful to walk around

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

450714224.name: BRING WARM CLOTHES
450714224.author: a TripAdvisor user
450714224.reviewBody:
The temperature was close to freezing in the evening and morning, and we were unprepared. I think this was an unusual cold snap, but make sure to check the forecast before coming. We were there on a Sunday and there were crowds of people going up the Peña. It would be best to start your hike well before noon to avoid the crowds and the heat. By noon it was very hot on the mountain and we were peeling off our newly-bought layers. You do not need to be particularly fit to do the first part of the hike up. 

It was disappointing to see all the empty water bottles left behind on the upper slopes of the Peña.

All along the approach to the Peña there are food and (of course) souvenir stands. The first ice cream place you come to has flavours made from various cactus fruits  and also from flowers (rose petal, jasmine, violet and lavender). At the second place,  flavours include Bailey's and red wine.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

449690209.name: Magical!
449690209.author: a TripAdvisor user
449690209.reviewBody: Worth the drive from Queretaro (about 30 minutes). Be sure to take a jacket and scarf if you stay past sunset! The fountain and lights are stunning!

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

447652121.name: Small nice town
447652121.author: a TripAdvisor user
447652121.reviewBody: If you are traveling here expecting to see little towns such as Tequisquiapan or San Miguel de Allende, you\'re up for a disappointment. This is a small town and as such, it has its own charm. I\'d say plan a half day visit, eat nice food and if you like extreme sports such as rappelling, you can do it here because the Pe\u00f1a is a huge rock-mountain that you can climb on some of its sides.\n\nOne of the town\'s specialties are the wool clothing you can get here. Another highlight are the typical crafted goods and of course, the "gorditas" which are thick small tortillas filled with specially prepared pork skin aka chicharr\u00f3n; it can be accompanied by other prepared foods, being my favorite "tinga" (pulled beef or chicken, a bit hot, prepared with red salsa) with cheese. Lastly, if you like to collect stones and crystals, there are many tiny stores that sell just that; but there\'s this place that sells you cheap and nice goods. I just can\'t remember the name, but it\'s close to the main "plaza" or public square, where the church is. It\'s the biggest store that sells almost only rocks and crystals...

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

442736080.name: Worth the trip to see the monolith
442736080.author: a TripAdvisor user
442736080.reviewBody: At least during weekdays Bernal is a very quiet town.  There is not a lot to do in this charming town other than shopping and admiring the huge monolith.  But the trip is worthwhile for this alone.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

440986843.name: Pena de Bernal, a monolith, stands out and adorns the colorful walls and old villas below.
440986843.author: a TripAdvisor user
440986843.reviewBody: It is a small city which can be experienced and appreciated in a day.  Pena de Bernal, the tallest monolith surpassing the Rock of Gibraltar stands out and can be seen peeking above the colorful walls and buildings, many are refurbished old villas.  I was dazzled by the color of the buildings and narrow walk ways.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

438406325.name: Beautiful
438406325.author: a TripAdvisor user
438406325.reviewBody: Totally recommend this place, its beautiful. You can access some boutique hotels to have a drink. \nWeather was perfect. \nTry the "gorditas" really good ones, don\'t be afraid to try the salsa! Really good!

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

435394209.name: My simple day trip
435394209.author: a TripAdvisor user
435394209.reviewBody: This was just a simple day trip and I did on the way and as it turned out to be pretty nice. It was a very hot day and the view was very good besides being hot. I made the climb half-way up. I was not to ready for the altitude as I was not used to it. besides that it was a fun day.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

433803405.name: Surprise
433803405.author: a TripAdvisor user
433803405.reviewBody: Didn\'t expected anything of this place were we were intended to spend the night... and which is 40 minutes from Queretaro, I\'ve visited here before a couple of times and it\'s a good idea to spend the evening but ONCE you spend the night... everything changes ... they have night tours, colorful fountain show, the power of the pe\u00f1a feels strongly and with the help of airbnb you can make a espectacular weekend

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

432676763.name: This is a fun little day trip/tourist town
432676763.author: a TripAdvisor user
432676763.reviewBody: Pena de Bernal is a very big rock (third largest in the world) sticking up from the ground. It can be seen for miles around and has a town next to it San Sebastian Bernal. They know the tourist keep their town alive and work to keep us coming. Town square is quaint typical old town Mexico. It also has hiking for the who feel like some exercise

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

429725770.name: I bit of a drive, but interesting small town!
429725770.author: a TripAdvisor user
429725770.reviewBody: I visited La Pena Bernal while staying in Queretaro.  It was a bit of a drive, maybe an hour or so. The town of Bernal is very quaint and picturesque. You can climb the monolith to a certain point, but I did not. Overall, it is worth a visit.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

429458953.name: A very cute and cool town
429458953.author: a TripAdvisor user
429458953.reviewBody: Pe\u00f1a de Bernal is an awesome place near Queretaro with a lot of history and an awesome mercado. The plaza is very pretty and La Pe\u00f1a is a great place to hike. Recommended specially on weekends.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

427399128.name: Perfect for one day visit.
427399128.author: a TripAdvisor user
427399128.reviewBody:
There are many things to do at Peña de Bernal, depending on the type of activities you like to do.
You can go hiking, or just taking a walk.
You can go up the Peña and take some pictures, or just sit in the lower part and eat an ice cream.
You can go with friend, family, coupe, young children, teens, by yourself.
You can rest in a boutique hotel, or stay in a hostel.
You can have a good dinner, or a spiritual encounter with different realms.

Excellent for one day adventure.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

427065883.name: TRULY A PUEBLO MAGICO (Magic Town)
427065883.author: a TripAdvisor user
427065883.reviewBody: This colonial town has a magic vibe to it - that you will feel within the first hour!  We are building a house in Tequisquiapan (about 30 minutes away) which is also classified as a Pueblo Magico - and this is where we go to really relax.  There are countless great restaurants - especially Italian, but you have to try El Mesquite.  The food is great Mexican traditional, but the view of the monolith is the best in town.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

420010426.name: A BiG Rock!
420010426.author: a TripAdvisor user
420010426.reviewBody: You can either climb yourself or pay the tour for 200 pesos they do not go all the way to the top. Great for hikers, nothing but rocks...

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

419143347.name: Little magic town with a big rock
419143347.author: a TripAdvisor user
419143347.reviewBody: Pena de Bernal is a 45 minutes from Queretaro. It is a small magic town with little shops and restaurants. Not as big as San Miguel de Allende but It has a big rock. According to locals it isthe second largest in the world. There is a hike you can follow to climb one third of the rock. It is nice place for a day with family. Near by there are wine shops. The area is considered a little Napa valley. Consider the whole day if you come to visit this area. Bring comfortable shoes since streets are not totally flat.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

418886028.name: A must see if you go to Queretaro.
418886028.author: a TripAdvisor user
418886028.reviewBody: Third largest monolith in the world. Do not attempt to climb unless you are extremely fit. The town of Bernal is quaint and worth a visit. Not sure if I would buy any opals or quartz. Better buy them in Queretaro.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

418053960.name: A big rock... In a dirty little town
418053960.author: a TripAdvisor user
418053960.reviewBody: I love going to Mexican towns for weekend trips. This town is not worth the drive. Other than la Pena de Bernal there is nothing else to see. Rather than offering Mexican artisans the store fronts are selling cheap Chinese crap. \n\nThe food was terrible and the town itself was full of cables... Which blocked the view of the famous rock.  If you are in the area go to San Miguel or San Juan del Rio.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

416564542.name: Visit later
416564542.author: a TripAdvisor user
416564542.reviewBody: Bernal is very charming but right now they are still in the process of rebuilding most of the village with road and building construction everywhere.  So traffic is horrible, parking almost non-existent.  From what has been done so far it looks like the new image will be gorgeous when it\'s finished.  There seems to be a village wide color scheme of taupe, eggplant, and sage green - unusual but it works well.  We\'ll definitely go back when it\'s finished.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

415960522.name: Magical
415960522.author: a TripAdvisor user
415960522.reviewBody: What might be so special about a rock, a big one. Well is the 3rd biggest one after the one in Gibraltar and the famous sugarloaf in Rio de Janeiro however this one is next to a Magic town with settings that belong to another time yet are well preserved and ready to be enjoyed by visitors from all ages, yes my two teenager daughters ended up enjoyed the city tour, the shopping and the food. Try to stay one night at this magical place and don\'t forget to buy local sweets and handicraft.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

415815605.name: Please visit La pe\u00f1a...
415815605.author: a TripAdvisor user
415815605.reviewBody: traditional small town with a very mexican taste. Tours of La pe\u00f1a are interesting to get to know the history of the region

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

415521673.name: Amazing monolith
415521673.author: a TripAdvisor user
415521673.reviewBody: Easy to get to from Queretaro. It is just about an hour bus ride with many buses going daily.Very touristy little town with lots to buy and lots of foods to eat. Good for souvenir shopping. We hiked a good way up the monolith but not to the top.  We went earlier so our walk up was nice as it wasn\'t as crowded. On our walk down it was definitely a lot more crowded. It was really hot that day so I recommend water but plenty of vendors to buy it from at the base. Gorgeous views and just something fun and different to do!

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

409736135.name: the best in town
409736135.author: a TripAdvisor user
409736135.reviewBody: This is the best attraction i really enjoy thw views, the people are friendly and the gorditas are a must try for everybody.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

407901410.name: Incredible Monolith that is 1,150 ft at an elevation of 8,250 ft.
407901410.author: a TripAdvisor user
407901410.reviewBody: We didn\'t climb the huge boulder. However, we could see people climbing it to reach a chapel at the top of the monolith.  La Pe\u00f1a de Bernal is in a small friendly town that is ready for visitors called San Sebastian Bernal in the State of Queretaro, Mexico.  You will find many vendors selling crafts and wares from around Mexico including textile weavings and art from around the country.  There is a restaurant called Do\u00f1a Teresa that was DELICIOUS!! We found the  town to be extra friendly.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

397670767.name: Nice little stop
397670767.author: a TripAdvisor user
397670767.reviewBody: Great little town to visit if you are around. This place has a great charm and is located and the foot hills of the mountain. \nTake a motorcycle(tri) to the view point and enjoy the view over the town. \nWe had lunch in town and was very quiet as we were there on a week day. Weekends are VERY full of people they say.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

397277093.name: Amazing!
397277093.author: a TripAdvisor user
397277093.reviewBody:
Friends had told me about this trip and I wasn't quite sure what it was all about.  Years passed and I thought if I ever go to Queretaro again I would go see it.  Well, it was an absolutely awesome trip!  It was more than I was expecting.

La Peña de Bernal is located approximately 30 minutes outside the city of Quretaro.  As you drive closer, it is pretty amazing to see.  There are a couple of entrances which are pretty rocky and steep.  The main entrance is very nice.  The town is colorful with stone streets and lots of things to see and buy.  There are many restaurants that are very good and clean.  There is parking lot availability for just a few pesos.  Right outside parking you can ride a trolley that takes you all around town.  

We went up to climb the main attraction, the monolith.  We had a great time climbing up and coming down as well.  It is an all day affair.  The place really gives you energy.  There are lots of little places to eat and drink, especially after after such a climb!  Just dress comfortable.  It is a must see!

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

394742138.name: Crowded and over rated
394742138.author: a TripAdvisor user
394742138.reviewBody: Went on a Sunday and couldn\'t move for the crowds. The town has become a collection of souvenir shops and tourist restaurants and little else.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

391108585.name: What a surprise!
391108585.author: a TripAdvisor user
391108585.reviewBody: I visited only because of Trip Advisor, thought it would be interesting... But never expected a "gee whiz" moment!  Can\'t wait to go back, and look around .

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

390560757.name: Beautiful little town
390560757.author: a TripAdvisor user
390560757.reviewBody: This is a beautiful place to visit if you want to know more about Mexico or want to feel an authentic Mexican atmosphere. The little town is fantastic and the Pe\u00f1a is a natural wonder that would amaze you!

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

389963358.name: Pueblo Magico
389963358.author: a TripAdvisor user
389963358.reviewBody: Bernal is one of the Mexican Pueblos Magicos - magical towns with a special kind of atmosphere and feel. It\'s a short trip from Queretaro and well worth making it. Make sure to enjoy a rooftop drink with the view of the nature surrounding the town. Many arts and crafts stores.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

389741680.name: Great  Atmosphere
389741680.author: a TripAdvisor user
389741680.reviewBody: Bernal is a place of its own ...great place to visit...the people are very nice they have great shopping ...great eateries.. awesome views ...a must see place and visit ...It is worth the wisit and time..no regrets

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

387828848.name: Natural wonder
387828848.author: a TripAdvisor user
387828848.reviewBody: If your a lover of nature you need to go here. It is a wonderful, peaceful town where people live many years and attribute it to te power of the pe\u00f1a. Also UFO\'s have been seen here. One of the wonders of Mexico and the world

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

387593876.name: Do not miss this
387593876.author: a TripAdvisor user
387593876.reviewBody: It would be easy to miss seeing this location while touring central Mexico. Fortunately we have freinds that live in the area that suggested we visit this place.  My family and I had a great day that included a walk in the beautiful pueblo and a hike up the largest Boulder I have ever seen.  I will not say it was an easy hike but it could be done by the entire family.  If you are in this region of Mexico I highly reccomend you spend a day and bring some good walking/hiking shoes.  You will be rewarded by a very pleasant surprise!

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

381746252.name: Really impressive monolith
381746252.author: a TripAdvisor user
381746252.reviewBody: The monolith is very cool, but the town itself is also worth seeing.  We spent one night here and that was perfect.  Couple of nice places to eat, and great tourist shopping.  Highly worth a visit.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

378857749.name: Do the tour
378857749.author: a TripAdvisor user
378857749.reviewBody:
First to get to the pena, you can take a bus from Queretaro terminal de autobus building B. Stop t the town of bernal.
Now. The rest should be easy. Just go towards the rock and follow the sign.

Normally, people will just climb the rock. However, at the parking area, there is a tour company offering a tour. I went to bernal 4 times but only the last time I did the tour and it was worth it. They bring you to another side of the rock and explain how people years ago lived here. It's really fascinating. 

Don't forget the last bus back to queretaro is 6pm.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

377994540.name: Magic Town
377994540.author: a TripAdvisor user
377994540.reviewBody: You can\'t miss this little town when you are visiting Quer\u00e9taro. Fresh air, nice views, cute buildings, friendly people.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

377746805.name: Great food and shopping in town center
377746805.author: a TripAdvisor user
377746805.reviewBody: Great little carts can take you on a ride if you don\'t want to hike it.  The town center has wonderful shopping area and good quality restaurants, unexpected finds.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

377112347.name: fascinating
377112347.author: a TripAdvisor user
377112347.reviewBody: It looks like a mountain! There is a nice market along one of the streets, too.\nDo not go on a Wednesday as most of the restaurants are closed.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

376240488.name: Excellent day trip out of Queretaro
376240488.author: a TripAdvisor user
376240488.reviewBody: Pena de Bernal is a easy bus ride from Queretaro, MX.  A pleasant little town, cute little shopping areas, quaint restaurants and the \'mountain\' leaves yu wondering how or where did that come from!  Nice place to take little strolls

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

372163414.name: Pretty impressive rock!
372163414.author: a TripAdvisor user
372163414.reviewBody: We drove to Queretaro in our car so we thought we should go to see the rock at least and we did. We did not hike up it and we did not stay for lunch but we enjoyed the trip and we are glad we went. It is pretty impressive.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

371880660.name: Beautiful "magical pueblo"
371880660.author: a TripAdvisor user
371880660.reviewBody: We spent the afternoon here so did not see the Bernal lit up at night, but it was a fun stop even though it was very touristy. There are some good boutiques selling very good gourmet and local products.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

369739525.name: I almost touch the sky
369739525.author: a TripAdvisor user
369739525.reviewBody: Such an amazing experience, I almost lost my breath and I realized my condition is not that good and I need to work out a little bit more but the view was outrageous and I felt free!

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

369708561.name: An interesting small town for a few hours stopover
369708561.author: a TripAdvisor user
369708561.reviewBody: We spent a few hours visiting Bernal and enjoyed our time.  El Mezquite is a great place for lunch or dinner --- beautiful, good service, great view, good food.  Ask around, it\'s a bit hard to find.  The Pe\u00f1a is very unusual, striking and impossible not to photograph.  The town\'s main streets are touristy and often bustling but fun to prowl around.  A restaurant on an upper level street has three statues from "earlier days" in the U.S. with stereotypical portrayals of black persons, shocking to see but part of American and Mexican culture.  I recommend Bernal for a stopover of a few hours.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

368576490.name: Awesome natural wonder
368576490.author: a TripAdvisor user
368576490.reviewBody:
This towering monolith stands above the sleepy village of Bernal. It is a great day out and accessible to most levels of fitness and age. You can visit the shops and restaurants at the base of the Pena to soak up the atmosphere or you can attempt the walk up to the rock itself. 

The path varies from steep and rocky to flat and easy. It actually gets easier walking the higher you get up as you contour the rock.mountain. 

We saw families of all ages the day we went.

It gets hotter as the day goes on so I would recommend walking up in the morning and having lunch when you get back down making the latter both a reward and a rest.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

357724797.name: A must if you\'re in the area
357724797.author: a TripAdvisor user
357724797.reviewBody:
If you love hiking la Peña de Bernal is one of those places that you'll love. It takes 2 hours to climb It, but it is just a great experience. After, the tradition says that you should go to bernal to have a beer or a michelada to rest and remember the long walk that you've done, every effort has its reward!  

If you don't have time to climb la
Peña, just chill around the little town, it's worth it to have a walk around the central plaza and take some pictures. The food, as it happen in all Mexicans places, is just great and tasty.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

357173508.name: Easy hike, nice view
357173508.author: a TripAdvisor user
357173508.reviewBody: The hike is pretty easy. We went up in less than 30 minutes. It is a bit rocky so converse might be uncomfortable but I saw people in shoes rather than sneakers and they seemed to be doing fine. At the end there is a little climbing of rocks involved but it is definitely worth the view. If you don\'t do this it still pretty nice up to that point without the rock climbing.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

356588916.name: Nice place for a day off
356588916.author: a TripAdvisor user
356588916.reviewBody: This is one of the towns in the State of Queretaro under the "Pueblos Magicos" program to enhance tourist attractiveness.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

356440606.name: My first time hiking for real.
356440606.author: a TripAdvisor user
356440606.reviewBody: The view is beautiful and its fun to go there with friends. Loved it being my first real hike because it isn\'t too hard,  yet not too easy.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

355137351.name: Get here before the herd
355137351.author: a TripAdvisor user
355137351.reviewBody: We took a tour from Queretaro that had Bernal as a stopping point. La Pena is a giant monolith, apparently the third largest of its type in the world. It is extremely photogenic in the bright sunshine from a Calle that leads to the central square in this quiet, colonial era town. There is also a trailhead on a lower slope where you can find drinks, snacks, gifts and raw mineral samples for sale. Though I did not hike up to the top, it is apparently a strenuous walk requiring good shoes, a hat and water. There seems to be a lot of work being done to prepare or more tourists. As part of a tour, Bernal is a pleasant place to spend an hour or two.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

348500135.name: Fountain show that rivals Vegas!
348500135.author: a TripAdvisor user
348500135.reviewBody: Climbing the mountain is one thing, fun and a little challenging but a must. The views are fantastic. Go a little before sunset so that you\'ll see the fountains on the way down. I couldn\'t believe how well done the show was, how long and how designed to go with the music. Well done!

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

348404701.name: Amazing
348404701.author: a TripAdvisor user
348404701.reviewBody: This was an amazing experience and really enjoy see the La Pena de Bernal and also a very nice village attach to this Penal the people were warm and friendly there is one thing they are missing is a English speaking guide as all the presentation is in Spanish... To attrack more tourist they need English speaking guides but for the rest it was amazing

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

347238349.name: A giant rock!
347238349.author: a TripAdvisor user
347238349.reviewBody: Enjoyed a day trip out to this rock monument and the neat little town. Went on a Tuesday so not overflowing with people. Good shopping. Bought wonderful little mouse pin cushions and wool scarves..picturesque village.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

347189091.name: A fabulous old-fashioned Mexican village, in a splendid natural setting
347189091.author: a TripAdvisor user
347189091.reviewBody: The village of Bernal is as cute as any of the "Pueblos Magicos" in Mexico -- I prefer it to Patzcuaro, the most famous of them, in fact.  It is a very charming old-timey Mexican village, well preserved, now a haven for shopping tourists, but still evocative.  It sits at the foot of the world\'s 3rd largest megalith (after Gibraltar and Ayer\'s Rock, I believe), which you can climb about halfway up if you\'re feeling energetic.  It\'s an easy half hour drive from Queretaro.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

344569300.name: Nice little town
344569300.author: a TripAdvisor user
344569300.reviewBody: Less than an hour from Queretaro, you will find this little old town that is worth to visit... If you are an active hiker, you can walk up to the rock but if you feel more like touristing in the town you will find lots of hand made crafts, a variety of local cheese makers stores, nice restaurants and a couple of regional artisan sweet crafters.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

343130908.name: Great place!
343130908.author: a TripAdvisor user
343130908.reviewBody: It is a small town known for its pena (small mount) that you can hike or climb or ride your way up to the top. The view uo there is spectacular! Also the food is delicious and very traditional of the area.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

342455890.name: Excellent for exercising!
342455890.author: a TripAdvisor user
342455890.reviewBody: Not so far from Mexico City, near queretaro, it\'s located Bernal mountain (pe\u00f1a in Spanish) and la Tortuga (turtle mountain). The way is very clear to arrive and climbing the mountain is, as for my opinion, very good exercise, even if you follow the established way to go up. We didn\'t make it to the very top, but it\'s not really necessary to get there to take amazing pics. During climbing up, a bottle of water is good idea. Once you get the downtown, you can walk and see many local and beautiful places, local shops, souvenirs and plenty of local food, our recommendation are the gorditas and local sweets such as glorias queretanas. We did a one day trip and was OK to do these activities. Very recommendable to go on weekdays, not so crowded and people let you take all the time you want to see the town. Btw, everything is very cheap, and the town is really small and beautiful

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

339006083.name: Pena de Bernal - Fantastic Rock Climbing and Culture
339006083.author: a TripAdvisor user
339006083.reviewBody: We have made two separate trips to Pena de Bernal, most recently in December 2015. The rock climbing is great and the town is wonderful! There are dozens of places to stay in town and likely a hundred places to eat. The micheladas and gorditas at the Pena trailhead are cheap and  make a great end to a day of climbing on the Pena. It\'s also an easy walk from the trailhead to town.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

338007854.name: Excellent Pueblo Magico!!
338007854.author: a TripAdvisor user
338007854.reviewBody: We decided to spend a day in Pe\u00f1a de Bernal as there was some time we went and my children didn\u00b4t remember the place. It was crowded because of the season but this was not an obstacle to enjoy a walk to the skirt of the Pe\u00f1a and also to have the chance to enjoy the Gorditas and the bread made there. The sightseeing of the Pe\u00f1a while walking to it are fantastic!!

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

335433099.name: Day tour
335433099.author: a TripAdvisor user
335433099.reviewBody: A must visit quaint little micro town with a stone monolith as its background. You go here on a day tour. Great little shops of all types.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

334684574.name: Tourist trap
334684574.author: a TripAdvisor user
334684574.reviewBody: Cool little town with a lovely monolith. The town seems to have exploded with the designation of Pueblo magico. I found it painfully tourist oriented to a fault, with more people treating me like a tourist and a source of money than anything. Also, the town is tiny and I didn\'t see a whole lot to explore. I thought it was not really worth the time.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

334437549.name: Third largest natural monolith in the world + scenic town
334437549.author: a TripAdvisor user
334437549.reviewBody: Pe\u00f1a de Bernal is the third largest natural monolith in the world which is impressive in its own but also Bernal town is very scenic with a very nice downtown with places to have a good meal, buy handcrafts, taste local candies and natural jams. Good for a one day visit but better for a weekend getaway in a local boutique hotel to enjoy the town at night.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

332330560.name: Nothing better to do
332330560.author: a TripAdvisor user
332330560.reviewBody: Went here out of boredom,  Cool town, don\'t miss the centro hist\u00f3rico.  The light and fountain show is nothing to wright home about but something to do.  Try the Gordon as at the far end of the light show they were good.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

330426872.name: Wonderful
330426872.author: a TripAdvisor user
330426872.reviewBody: My friend and I decided to go on a short one-day trip to Bernal. You can reach the place easily with a bus from the central autobus station of Guanajuato (about 1h15). The place is super clean and well maintained. There are few restaurants and arrisanal shops around the Pe\u00f1a of Bernal. This is a cute, small and nice place with a Wonderful View, even if, like us, you don\'t climb the monolithe.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

330026006.name: Hire A Guide
330026006.author: a TripAdvisor user
330026006.reviewBody: A good climb for someone who has never climbed before but hire a guide.. My wife, who had never climbed before, found it challenging but do able. For me it was easier than described it felt like a 5.3 or 5.4

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

329652387.name: Energy at its best
329652387.author: a TripAdvisor user
329652387.reviewBody: It is a very nice village with beautiful colours and a beautiful view to the rock. I had nice mexican food there and small shops invite you to bring something back to your relatives and friends.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

329550373.name: Great view, charming small town
329550373.author: a TripAdvisor user
329550373.reviewBody: One day us enough to visit this attraction. \nBeautiful view and very small town, where you can try local street food and shop in a small artesanial stores.\nIf you are in the area - have to visit!

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

327838885.name: Amazing views!
327838885.author: a TripAdvisor user
327838885.reviewBody: This is a very interesting place. It seems that a meteor landed here years ago and people from miles around come to visit - some for its "energy", some for the adventure (repelling, zip lining, hiking) and some for the views. The steps up to the "observation deck" are steep and narrow, but the view is well worth it. Many Mexicans make a day of it by climbing up, buying a snack or drink and enjoying the day.  This is a tourist attraction but worth the visit.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

325923578.name: A natural wonder!
325923578.author: a TripAdvisor user
325923578.reviewBody: Is not common to find a lovely small town with a great monolithic stone behind. The views are unbelievable.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

323534805.name: Beautiful place!
323534805.author: a TripAdvisor user
323534805.reviewBody: A beautiful town to visit.  The monolith is quite impressive and the town is very well kept.  Very charming place .

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

323081337.name: VISIT FOR DINER
323081337.author: a TripAdvisor user
323081337.reviewBody:
It is the first time I go, it's a magic place it was raining stores where closed we find 3 restaurant open, we can hardly see the mountain, but the small town is so unique and magic that I want to go back, 
Not to clined but to walk around ,,,! 

For sure I am back,,,!

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

320867858.name: Beautiful place to visit.
320867858.author: a TripAdvisor user
320867858.reviewBody: My associates and I stopped off here before our flight back to the US. The place is beautiful, but we did get lost on some of the back roads trying to get there. I would love to return someday, and hike up to the chapel which is supposed to be at the top.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

320368938.name: Great hike.
320368938.author: a TripAdvisor user
320368938.reviewBody: We loved the town and the monolith hike which was free!\nThe town is magical and full if the best Mexican taste, this stop is a must if you like typical mexican towns, hiking and nature.\nWould recommend this visit for any family with older kids as the hike can be a bit treacherous at times.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

318981064.name: Interesting place
318981064.author: a TripAdvisor user
318981064.reviewBody: A lot of things to do. You can\'t miss their food, wines and cheese products. Many shops to visit and of course, you cant miss a climb to the Pena (mountain)

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

318562238.name: Fun family experience
318562238.author: a TripAdvisor user
318562238.reviewBody: Unlike other reviewers I loved the whole experience.  I loved the food stands and the plaza, and the vendors and the safari tour for those not willing to do the climb, I loved the town and the whole feel of the monolith and what the local people have done with it.\nI\'ve been to several of other famous ones: P\u00e3o de A\u00e7\u00facar, Rock of Gibraltar, Uluru, Torres del Paine, Devil\'s Tower... and I\'m unsure which others that may or may not considered monoliths.  My happiness to this place is that it\'s there to be enjoyed by everyone.\nNo cable car to take you to the top, no ridiculous distances to get to it, no mythical mumbo-jumbo. The rock has caves and paintings and a history from the past, But it is also vibrant and alive with the people of today.  Great for bikers, or for romance, or for friends, or to climb solo, or to experience culture.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

317670052.name: Go there, meet with nature and wonders
317670052.author: a TripAdvisor user
317670052.reviewBody: Nice town, excellent food and nice people to be with. One of the bigger  monolits in the world... I thinh is the 3rd.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

315479827.name: Nice town
315479827.author: a TripAdvisor user
315479827.reviewBody: This was a Nice surprise! The Pe\u00f1a is the third  you monolith  in size in the world. Hughe rock. You can climb all the way up, just bring comfortable shoes.  If you do not want to climb, choose the tour by car where they explain everything and show you a cave. There are lots of craft stores around the town so you can do some shopping afterwards. Quartz are cheap and beautiful jewelry found everywhere.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

314914017.name: A True Magical Experience
314914017.author: a TripAdvisor user
314914017.reviewBody: From the train ride to the candy museum,  this town is truly charming. The tour guides are completely bilingual.The light show is dazzling.  Nice Experience!

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

314872868.name: Great hike!
314872868.author: a TripAdvisor user
314872868.reviewBody: We went on a weekday, early in the morning.  If you like to avoid crowds, I highly recommend you visit in the AM during the week.  It was deserted on our way up, and almost as empty on the way down.  For me, I prefer to hike in solitude so this was perfect.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

314295484.name: Rugged trail by American standards
314295484.author: a TripAdvisor user
314295484.reviewBody: The trail is more rugged and rocky than expected.  The views were excellent and it is worth the climb but it is not a easy hike especially is you are coming from a sea level environment.  Remember this area is the height of Denver.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

314000267.name: Challenging but worth it
314000267.author: a TripAdvisor user
314000267.reviewBody: The experience of visiting this small pueblo and then climbing to the top of La Pena was one of my favorite travel experiences. I recommend allowing at least half a day to explore the village, eat some gorditas, and make the climb. If a challenging climb isn\'t in comfort zone, you can take a nice tour in a tram-like vehicle. Even though it\'s a tough summit, I found it totally worth it.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

313217331.name: A challenge for free climbers
313217331.author: a TripAdvisor user
313217331.reviewBody: This is a unique semi-monolith that can be spotted from several miles away in the middle of this plain just a few miles from Queretaro. There are free and easy paths up to a given hight, but then you are not allowed to climb to the very top because of security reasons (unless you wanna do it when no one\'s looking - I know people who did).
