The journey to the area is nice and interesting and seserves a day of visit, especially if you love trekking and open nature.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

305163109.name: Too many food stands
305163109.author: a TripAdvisor user
305163109.reviewBody: Its An amazing view, but its amazingly challengers by food and souvenir stands. \nImposible to take pictures.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

304210844.name: Live the experience!
304210844.author: a TripAdvisor user
304210844.reviewBody:
It could be interesting if you really get involve with the whole environment and get in the mood!  There are very few thing to do in Bernal.

The town is magical but small!! All you´ll get is small hotels with little comfort and small restaurants, nothing fancy!

However If you are one of those who like these things, then you can have one or two amazing days!  Don´t forget to visit the cheese factory and freixenet.

My best tip for you, go there just to do nothing but living the experience!

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

303317144.name: Pe\u00f1a de Bernal
303317144.author: a TripAdvisor user
303317144.reviewBody: Amazing view, the only thing is that the city itself seems to me that needs a Little more maintenance, and a lot of stores are close... But it is cheap :)

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

301652084.name: Surprising small town.
301652084.author: a TripAdvisor user
301652084.reviewBody: This is a Pueblo M\u00e1gico, 40 minutes away from Quer\u00e9taro City, it is awesome and very charming. I enjoyed eating at La Terreza, I also rode a Carcachita that gave us a tour of the town. I would definitely go back and stay for a night or two at La Pe\u00f1a de Bernal, it is worth it.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

299373297.name: Nice look at a big rock from a \'tourist town.\'
299373297.author: a TripAdvisor user
299373297.reviewBody: I enjoyed my day spent in Bernal, mostly because of the hour I spent talking to a local taxi driver, who was washing his vehicle, and a woman that ran a shoe store near the bus stop.  The town itself is interesting, especially the woolen factory.  If you are into geology, you\'ll like the big rock.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

298947792.name: Pueblo Magico - Great place to visit!
298947792.author: a TripAdvisor user
298947792.reviewBody: This is considered a "Pueblo M\u00e1gico" by the Mexican Government and it really is! This is a beautiful town next to the Pe\u00f1a de Bernal, there is great food, local stores and hotels you can stay the night!

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

298478572.name: Breakfast at Bernal
298478572.author: a TripAdvisor user
298478572.reviewBody:
A lovely weekend at Tequisquiapan brought to the table the idea of closing a romantic weekend with a quick trip to Bernal, my wife was very enthusiastic as she has always loved the idea of hiking and having a typical breakfast at Bernal.

We drove for about 20 minutes from Tequisquiapan and the road is amazing, as we neared our destination memories from old trips came to my mind, on which my parents made me go with them and spend an evening over there, but this time I had a great time as the place has been overhauled and conditioned to receive tourism.

Lots of parking lots charging about 2USD for a full day, and lots of clean restaurants to have typical and real Mexican food.

From a brochure I learned that there is a light show on evening/night and some places near offer romantic diners for couples visiting the place.

Prices of souvenirs range from really accessible to slightly overpriced, so I would recommend anyone to buy confident you'll get a great deal.

You can find candies, shirts, wood toys, stones, jewelry and many other options to take back home as a gift.

I hope you enjoy this review as much as I enjoyed my trip over Bernal.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

297057145.name: No photos completely capture the enormity of the monolith
297057145.author: a TripAdvisor user
297057145.reviewBody: This is an enchanting city. Maybe because it is home to this incredibly huge monolith--a giant rock jutting up from the ground and hovering over the quaint little city. Nice shops, great food items (try the local candies!) unique to the area, and a natural wonder. There is something magical about this place, and the locals think so too. Worth a side trip when visiting one of the other larger cities in the region.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

296489561.name: Fascinating town
296489561.author: a TripAdvisor user
296489561.reviewBody: Love the Plaza, Church.. Pueblo Magico!! and the home made bread"conchitas y pan de queso" The textil worshop.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

294667559.name: Cool monolith and a tourist town
294667559.author: a TripAdvisor user
294667559.reviewBody: Quaint village, amazing scenery but pretty much geared to tourism. There are some average eateries and lots of shopping.  Can get very crowded on weekend afternoons.  If you get there early, hike the trail up the Pena while it is still uncrowded and cool.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

293159158.name: Impressive sight
293159158.author: a TripAdvisor user
293159158.reviewBody: Impressive day trip with great scenery. many interesting restaurant and shops. Many new stores and new streets

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

288396427.name: A truly beautiful sight and town
288396427.author: a TripAdvisor user
288396427.reviewBody:
La Peña de Bernal is not only the humongous monolith that peacefully watches besides you. The town from which the rock got its name is also what makes the experience spectacular. The people in town are kind; I’m not surprised it’s a mayor tourist location in the region. 
Villa de Bernal is not a fancy place; it’s a small town. I make and emphasis over this for people that expect to have a 5 star hotel in the middle of the village (Not as far as I know). Still this is a “must” place to consider if you ever stay in Querétaro. You’ll probably want to give the trip a full day though.
 The main plaza in town will give you a great taste of how traditional Mexican towns are. Check the Mexican government page for “Magical Village” the town is in the list.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

283399018.name: FANTASTIC !!
283399018.author: a TripAdvisor user
283399018.reviewBody: One of the most beautiful places to visit in M\u00e9xico ! Everybody should visit this wonderful site ...

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

281822749.name: Amazing.....
281822749.author: a TripAdvisor user
281822749.reviewBody: This is a must do for everyone. The climb is really not that bad and once you get up there the views are amazing! All you have to do is take it easy and everyone will get up there. I definitely reccommend this to everyone.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

277685451.name: Charm town besides the world\'s 3rd largest monolyth
277685451.author: a TripAdvisor user
277685451.reviewBody: An excellent town to visits besides the rock climb. The clean streets and good maintenance of the town makes it look charming and relaxing. New hotels have openned recently so it is recommended to stay at least one night to smell the fresh air in the morning and to stand astonished about the sunset.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

277614345.name: Beutiful Mexico
277614345.author: a TripAdvisor user
277614345.reviewBody: Best time to climb is early in the morning before the Sun gets hot. There\'s a cold beer in the town afterward with lunch. Great beginning to the Day

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

277080839.name: Unique rock to visit
277080839.author: a TripAdvisor user
277080839.reviewBody: Magic town in Mexico / unique rock / typical dishes / wonderful artcrafts / spectacular views while eating / beautiful town / delicious typical candies

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

269391356.name: A must visit and make the climb if you can... 3rd largest monolith in the world!
269391356.author: a TripAdvisor user
269391356.reviewBody: Easy bus ride from Queretaro.  You get off on the side of the road and walk through the town. If you want to actually hike the mt, you need good shoes. Many times I was scrambling on all fours and came back down sliding on my bottom. The altitude and steep climb are a challenge, but families and many out of shape people were making the climb. Our group included 3 AARP people AND WE MADE IT! The view is incredible.  The town is charming and worth walking all around.  There are beautiful (and cheap) woolens and handmade scarfs, sweaters, rugs, blankets, etc.  if I had more space, I would have bought one of the incredible rugs. I did buy a beautiful alpaca shawl and handmade silk, beaded scarf.  We ate some wonderful gorditas full of grilled meat and Huatlacoche (corn smut but tasty delicacy)  food was awesome and view was even more spectacular.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

267730727.name: wish we had climbed to the highest point
267730727.author: a TripAdvisor user
267730727.reviewBody: This is a pretty village with an interesting mountain to hike up. There is a path winding up the mountain and along the path are small tiendas and places to buy snacks. The actually mountain climb begins at the last tienda.  wish we had gone further up.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

266502646.name: Charming town, Tough hike up the monolith
266502646.author: a TripAdvisor user
266502646.reviewBody: This was a must see on our site-seeing list when visiting the heart of Mexico area.  Wear good hiking shoes, as the climb up the monolith is fairly treacherous...and bring your water.  It\'s a lovely view of the valley from just about anywhere on the hike.  We visited in April when the weather was about 75 degrees.  The sun was strong, so it was fairly hot.  The town is lovely...pastel painted buildings all around.  The famous church is exactly as the pictures show...the adjacent park is a gathering place for the locals.  The gardens in the park are lovely.  Several fun shops to pop into.  It\'s a nice day trip.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

266235147.name: As charming as it gets
266235147.author: a TripAdvisor user
266235147.reviewBody: I climbed the Pe\u00f1a de Bernal.  Shopped in the town.  The scenery and culture is top notch.  The town itself, kids riding horseback, shops with a variety of decent things and clothes, and the view from the top of the monolith are what makes this place a must-see&do if you are in the area, or even wanting to venture out from Quer\u00e9taro or Guanajuato.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

265239833.name: Lovely little hill.
265239833.author: a TripAdvisor user
265239833.reviewBody: We hiked up without a guide. It\'s a very straightforward walk. Not too strenuous. The hill isn\'t very big but gives a incredie view from the top. There are lots of stands selling hings on the way but if it sunny please remember water.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

264247177.name: your classic "Pueblo Magico" - great views
264247177.author: a TripAdvisor user
264247177.reviewBody:
this is the place to experience the true Mexican "pueblos" at it's best... their center plaza and the surroundings are just great... the ladies can do a lot of shopping for Mexican crafts, from your cheap things to very trendy jewelry or clothing, walking around the town center is great... you can also walk all the way to almost the top of the monolith, I just didn't do it because didn't have the time, but all whom I asked said it has stunning views of the town and surrounding towns as well on a clear day.

when visiting queretaro, you must come to Pena del Bernal for a day... 

you can also find a lot of good restaurants, classic Mexican cuisine, and your traditional cheap eateries (gorditas, huaraches, quesadillas, tacos) and all are very good...

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

264013071.name: Beautiful town
264013071.author: a TripAdvisor user
264013071.reviewBody: an amazing place to visit, the views are unique and people really friendly.\nlots of hand made items with hundreds of colours\nall you may want for a nice place to visit

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

262762640.name: great attraction,
262762640.author: a TripAdvisor user
262762640.reviewBody: worth the trip from queretaro, visiting the champagne winery, cheese factory along the way.. great day out

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

262370803.name: Magic town
262370803.author: a TripAdvisor user
262370803.reviewBody:
Its really a lovely two or three street town... With old colorfoul mexican houses. 
This three streets are filled with hat stores and artcraft. And restaurants too Many sellers in the street are from nearby towns, and they are dressed as their old customs style. Long skirts, and very bright blouse colors. Its so lovely to see them.
And to top it all you have this amazing monolite... I think is the No. 2 in the world!!
Amazing......

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

260778479.name: An Easy Hike and A Pretty View
260778479.author: a TripAdvisor user
260778479.reviewBody: Well, I didn\'t go up all the way as I was enroute to Freixenet for some wine tasting, but the hiking path is not too hard to walk on, and the view is pretty. \n\nIf you are in the area, by all means pay a visit. After all, it is the tallest freestanding rock and the third largest monolith in the world!

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

258228807.name: Unique Little Town
258228807.author: a TripAdvisor user
258228807.reviewBody: Great place for a short day trip about 50 KM east of Queretaro to see one of the three largest stone monoliths in the world from the terrace of one of several good restaurants.  Nice shopping for local crafts.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

257143837.name: Monolith with charming town center
257143837.author: a TripAdvisor user
257143837.reviewBody: 3rd largest monolith in the world--pretty cool. It is a rigorous climb, probably best done in the morning when cooler and when the sun is lower. The views are good, not great. I really liked the charming town center and its shops. It is a small place but nicely maintained.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

255696840.name: Wonderful but exhausting climb
255696840.author: a TripAdvisor user
255696840.reviewBody: If you are not in good shape don\'t attempt the climb. They are dirt and rock paths and some are very steep. Lots of the path is slippery. But just keep climbing. Keep climbing. and the view gets better and better.  The views are astonishing. TAKE WATER. It is easy to get dehydrated.\nTAKE WATER. And remember to go slow.  Don\'t over do going up because coming down, when you are tired and thirsty, can be dangerous also. And don\'t worry about going to the top, listen to your body. You will have a tremendous experience.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

254969763.name: Fabulous view and quirky little town
254969763.author: a TripAdvisor user
254969763.reviewBody:
We spent a lovely afternoon having lunch on a rooftop terrace and looking at the monolith - a great view in my opinion.
Didn't climb it but will definitely do next time!
Overall, a nice experience.
Be prepared not to have phone and 3G signal!!!

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

254908866.name: Great place and a must when in Queretaro
254908866.author: a TripAdvisor user
254908866.reviewBody: La Pe\u00f1a de Bernal is a great way to spend a day outdoors, you can walk up this huge rock formation or just stay at the small town below. If you like rock climbing you can do this too once all the walking path ends you can climb your way to the top with the proper gear. When at the base don\'t forget to try Gorditas, or in the town go for some churros or any of the nice colonial restaurants that you\'ll find there.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

252835960.name: Special little place
252835960.author: a TripAdvisor user
252835960.reviewBody: I love to visit this charming little town.\nWalking around is just it... in and out of store, good restaurants with honest good food... and the people are so friendly.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

252271081.name: Very nice little town
252271081.author: a TripAdvisor user
252271081.reviewBody:
The Pena de Bernal, is really a visit to the whole town in it self.  It is a very nice little place. Stone covered streets. 
The Pena the biggest monolithid in America, very close by from Queretaro, Tequisquiapan. Not far from Mexico City.
You can climb it with out been an expert.
Afterwords you can have a nice lunch in some of the town restaurants.
If you have the time and are in the are, is a pretty visit.

Enjoy!

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

252115903.name: Lovely colonial village
252115903.author: a TripAdvisor user
252115903.reviewBody: The village is an awesome place to walk around, it is extremely cute with amazing colonial architecture. There are also quite a lot of nice stores to buy things. The mountain/hill itself is a recommended climb. It is not that far but it is quite steep so walking shoes are recommended. I went on a weekend so the climb was pretty crowded as Mexicans like to bring their entire family on trips.\nThe good thing about Bernal is that so far not many international tourists go there, it mainly seems to be geared towards the local tourism. So it does not feel as touristy as San Migel.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

248861382.name: Cute and authentic town
248861382.author: a TripAdvisor user
248861382.reviewBody: We really enjoyed our day trip from Queretaro to Pe\u00f1a de Bernal. It was an easy drive, about 40 minutes. We parked just outside the entrance to town and paid ~ $4. We enjoyed walking around and looking at the artisan crafts such as pottery and woven clothing/ pillows/ blankets. The prices are fantastic, much more reasonable than other places in the vicinity. We were told it takes about 2 hours to climb the monolith and that it is for serious hikers only, so we did not choose to do it. This little town is well worth a visit of about half a day.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

248373066.name: Really nice
248373066.author: a TripAdvisor user
248373066.reviewBody: Very good a bit tough if you are not the fittest but overall a very nice we\'ll spend day, the town is full of good food and people

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

247065999.name: not much to see if youre not a hiker
247065999.author: a TripAdvisor user
247065999.reviewBody: its a nice thing to see but if you wont climb it , don\'t waste your time, long drive, very poor village, nothing moreee

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

246743529.name: Wonderful site
246743529.author: a TripAdvisor user
246743529.reviewBody: This site is one of the three rock formations of it\'s type in the world: the others being in Gibraltar and in Brazil. You can get to the top after walking 45 min to 1 hour (it is not so easy), Nearby there is a small town where you can find local \'delicatessen\' such as \'gorditas\' and \'Nopal en Penca\'. Interesting place to visit.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

246562987.name: Highest monolith in the world
246562987.author: a TripAdvisor user
246562987.reviewBody: Formerly the third highest after the Rock of Gibraltar and Sugar Loaf Mountain, La Pena de Bernal has now been declared the highest. It is a pretty impressive rock which many people climb. Up to a certain height you do not need special equipment. The surrounding town is very busy, full of shops and restaurants.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

246187197.name: 1 day trip
246187197.author: a TripAdvisor user
246187197.reviewBody:
Great for a relaxing day got to have "gorditas" several to choose for but it's a gamble to pick from really good to average. Follow the rule of the most people waiting the better. 

Buy some candy from the local factories.  

Getting a tour to the actual Bernal is a must.

Enjoy the stay since the traffic going back might be a little longer depending on day and time. Plan for that too.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

245381469.name: Perfect for the weekend
245381469.author: a TripAdvisor user
245381469.reviewBody: This place is awesome! Is better if you go in the morning and start climbing the rock early since it can get very hot. On top of the rock you have a great view it is worth all the climbing. For lunch there are many places with traditional Mexican food but the best ones are the "gorditas" in downtown. They are always packed with people but the service is very fast and the food tastes great

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

244438158.name: Impressive rock formation and pleasant town
244438158.author: a TripAdvisor user
244438158.reviewBody:
First of all, visitors should note that this destination is actually the “Peña” de Bernal, and not call it the “Pena” which means something quite different.  It is a dramatic rock formation located less than a one hour drive from Querétaro on excellent roads.  You can walk to the base of the rock or, if prepared for a more strenuous climb, hike to near its summit.  

The town of Bernal is a nice place with various accommodations for visitors, such as restaurants and artisan shops selling a wide variety of products.  You can spend a pleasant afternoon in Bernal by dining at one of the restaurants at the end of town that look up at the peña, or enjoying the gorditas (tortillas filled with your choice of meats or vegetables) sold in the shops on the street leading to the path going up to the summit.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

243749192.name: Mid-week visit
243749192.author: a TripAdvisor user
243749192.reviewBody: Mid November, on a wednesday, we bussed to Bernal to find that most places were closed. We were told that hotels and restaurants open only for the week-ends. The place itself is cute, very small and considering the circumstances we took the bus back to Queretaro just after midday. A bit disappointed:

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

243483360.name: Great place to escape the city and just relax
243483360.author: a TripAdvisor user
243483360.reviewBody:
This place is magical, it offers a small challenge to climb (up to about half, after that you need ropes and equipment). The view is amazing and you get a chance to just take it easy. 

It is recommendable to go early as later on there is no shade and many people going  up so that could be a little tiering

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

242452541.name: Perfect to learn rockclimbing and visit for a good trekking
242452541.author: a TripAdvisor user
242452541.reviewBody: All routes for rockclimbing are very good protected , bolts on the right and logic movement , good food , hotels and camping around for all prices

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

240361590.name: I was waiting for close encounter
240361590.author: a TripAdvisor user
240361590.reviewBody: Nice little village fresh air native food just to relax had some of the cactus cuisine black tortilla stuffed with chopped cactus and the other with chopped chili haven\'t been the same

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

239531547.name: Wonderful town of Bernal and La Pena
239531547.author: a TripAdvisor user
239531547.reviewBody: This is a magical place.\nThe town is charming, with a pretty plaza. The main attraction is the monolithic rock, which one must see. There are trips to thre base of the rock, during which you will see marvelous views of the town and desert landscaping. Try the local Dulce de leche sweets. Good shopping is also available. A magical experience!

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

237912259.name: Lovely colonial town, great food , great hiking! Perfect for a quick roadtrip.
237912259.author: a TripAdvisor user
237912259.reviewBody: I love La Pe\u00f1a de Bernal. Its the world\'s third biggest monolite. Just a 30 minute drive from Queretaro , you can expect a nice walk through the town center and for the more athletic ones , a great hike of the Pe\u00f1a itself. Dont miss the local street food "Gorditas de Migaja" and for dessert some red wine icecream . \n\nThis town is ideal for a quick roadtrip if you are staying in Queretaro.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

237769679.name: Magnificent natural site
237769679.author: a TripAdvisor user
237769679.reviewBody: The pena itself is a monolyth woth to see, and the small village of Bernal is a nice place to see except the week-ends! So crowded that the visit is hardly enjoyable. On the other hand, if you take the road towards the sierra gorda and visit the rock from a camping in its back, the perspective changes completely, even during week-ends, making a very enjoyable trip and hike / trek simple and not difficult at all, even with kids (8 - 10 years on)

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

237689530.name: Another place to visit in Mexico
237689530.author: a TripAdvisor user
237689530.reviewBody: And another beautifull site to visit in mexico. About 200 km north of Mexico city near Queretarro. The third largest Monolyth in the world located near a very nice little village. Just beautifull. In the evening there was a water show at the foot of the mountain. It was worth staying for. When entering the village on the right site is a very nice candy store.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

234924033.name: Pena de Bernal (Monolito)
234924033.author: a TripAdvisor user
234924033.reviewBody: It is so great. One single stone. Nice little town. Food in downtown delicious. We took the trolley.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

233629801.name: Impressive monolith!
233629801.author: a TripAdvisor user
233629801.reviewBody: People saw my pics there and thought I was in an extraterrestrial movie! Nice quaint town surrounding the rock.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

226643866.name: "Magical Town"
226643866.author: a TripAdvisor user
226643866.reviewBody: Bernal is definetely a magical town only 45 min away from Queretaro City. Colorful town and deilicious food like tradicionales Gorditas and cant miss a good Michelada. A lot of amazing artists if you know where to look beyond the touristy goods they sell on the street. I got an amazing framed photograph by Sergio Pineda (National Photographgy award winner) and my gf got some amazing hand made earrings for relatively cheap. Climbing the Pena is a must for sure since the view up there is amazing, just make sure to wear comforatable shoes and to register at the entrance.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

226314898.name: Just OK
226314898.author: a TripAdvisor user
226314898.reviewBody: When driving from Puebla to Queretaro, we decided on a side loop via Tequiusquiapan and Bernal.  After all we had read on Bernal, we found it to be a bit of a disappointment.  Definitely tourist oriented and the town character just seemed to be missing something?

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

226243144.name: Outdoor magic
226243144.author: a TripAdvisor user
226243144.reviewBody: Magic place that\'s all I can say but apparently they. Want more characters, full of vibrant life, friendly people good food and outdoor climbing! A must go if you are in the area

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

226162714.name: Great spot in for a half day visit in Quertaro
226162714.author: a TripAdvisor user
226162714.reviewBody: Charming Puebla Majica "Majica Town" in Querataro. Great day trip from Mexico City, 2.5 hour drive, or side trip from San Migel de Allende or Queretaro City. Monolith makes for unique views from the charming village at the base. City has the San Miguell de Allende feel, (Colonial, clean with lots of charm and great architecture) with less tourists. Shop specialize in wool, lace, artisanal cheeses. Shops have some unique items from Mexico, not found in other spots. Zocalo/city center is a great spot to enjoy a Sunday afternoon. Enjoy some shopping and relax on a  bar with great views of the mountain. El Negrito, is a great spot with courtyard and rooftop bar over looking Zocalo and the mountain. million dollar views. great place to visit for a half day, unless you want to hike the mountain. probably not much to do for more than a half day, but some quaint hotels available. If you like San Miguel de Allende or Colonial towns with world class geological sites/views, Bernal is perfect place to visit.could be easily combined with a visit to a dairy or winery on the Cheese and Wine Route / Ruta de queso y vino.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

225741771.name: Quaint little town
225741771.author: a TripAdvisor user
225741771.reviewBody: It\'s a must see when in Queretaro. Beautiful little town with lots of small shops. 3rd largest rock in America. Very interesting to see. Love walking to cobble street and eating in cute restaurants. Plenty of cute things to buy. Had a great day!

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

224252659.name: Enchanting Little Town
224252659.author: a TripAdvisor user
224252659.reviewBody:
La Peña de bernal is a lovely little town not far from QuerÈtaro, mexico and two hours 30 min from Mexico City, it's very near to visit.
First we went to see the monolithic rock, that it's impressive, the 3 largest in usa/Latin America.
And then we went to the town, beautiful, full of shops! So lovely we had lunch at the arrayan delicious.
Don't forget if you take a car to park it. Most of the town I s pedestrian.
P

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

223433198.name: What a view
223433198.author: a TripAdvisor user
223433198.reviewBody: Quaint little town a little over an hour from San Miguel and worth the trip. Plenty of shopping, local food and music with a fantastic view of one of the largest monoliths in the world. If you are looking for a nice day trip, this should be on your list.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

222303652.name: Impresive!
222303652.author: a TripAdvisor user
222303652.reviewBody: Quite a nice placed, enoyed our visit, you can take a motorcycle-cab that can take you there for 30MXP 1-3 passengers, the only bad thing is that there is no full access to climb it up, unless you have proper climbing equipment, there\'s no way to hike it

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

222029838.name: Non traditional place to visit.
222029838.author: a TripAdvisor user
222029838.reviewBody: Huge monolith in the middle of the state of Queretaro. Good place to visit with several restaurants to choose from. I enjoyed an Italian place called The Piave really worth visiting. Ask the owner to prepare you a special meal.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

220859975.name: Been there, seen it, done it.
220859975.author: a TripAdvisor user
220859975.reviewBody: Read about so made the detour and now ticked it of. Not up to the Pueblo Magico label. Need to improve the directions to and in the town, especially to the famous Pe\u00f1a. Centre needs coffee shops and places to sit . Not many good options for dining, but for curiosity the Gorditas. Blue tortillas filled with varios ingredients are delicious.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

217229734.name: It\'s more than just a rock
217229734.author: a TripAdvisor user
217229734.reviewBody:
Interesting site to visit.  Pictures make this look so big; then flying in and driving up it looked smaller,,, as their are taller hills/mountains close beside.  But once we drove and parked above town and at the base; you realize how much higher it actually is.  

I'd recommend driving up the hill that leads to the base of La Pena.  Their was a parking lot/field, and it only cost a dollar or two to park. (beats walking up the steep roads just to get to the base)    Looking up you can see just how high persons are able to climb without ropes,,, and it is much higher than what I expected.  (The people looked like ants they were so far up)

I'd recently rolled my ankle and knew we wouldn't climb; but I still followed the path up to the end of the dozens of small souvenir huts along the path.  Was nice to spend a few minutes at the fountain towards the beginning of the climb; and listen to the music they put to the fountains. 

Would have loved to hiked up to the plateau, but still had some amazing views of the area.  Can't wait to go back sometime and get to the top.  

FYI this is probably a quick 20-25 minutes from the winery Cavas Freixenet.  We stayed at an awesome little hotel/boutique in Tequisquiapan "Boutique La Granja" and it's about the same time and distance away.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

214885206.name: Nice place
214885206.author: a TripAdvisor user
214885206.reviewBody: We stopped at La Pena de Bernal on our way to visit some of the missions in Queretaro.  It\'s worth visiting for the views,and to take an hour or so to walk through the town, which has lots of shops for tourists and restaurants.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

214001052.name: Wonderful Way to Spend an Afternoon away for Queretaro
214001052.author: a TripAdvisor user
214001052.reviewBody: The mountain is I pressive; I for one could not climb up it very high - The town, however, is just as pleasant, so do not neglect it\'s charms - Try the gordita\'s!

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

210966867.name: a surprising must see not far from Queretaro
210966867.author: a TripAdvisor user
210966867.reviewBody: The biggest ant hill (no ants) in the world surrounded by a wonderful cultural environment. A must see when in Queretaro and heading for Pachuca

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

210495167.name: Mexico Magico
210495167.author: a TripAdvisor user
210495167.reviewBody: Another exciting and beautiful and exciting Mexican town in Queretaro that is froze in time!! As you walk through  the town you  can not help  feeling that your are be taken back to Colonial Mexico. And a must is to try the cites famous Gorditas!!

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

208268338.name: Great vibes
208268338.author: a TripAdvisor user
208268338.reviewBody: It is a great natural \u00e1rea, with a magical vibe. They also have a market \u00e1rea just near there that sell great rocks and geodas for people that like this is super nice.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

207425278.name: Incredible !!!
207425278.author: a TripAdvisor user
207425278.reviewBody: You feel in La Pena de Bernal, like if you where in another world. Is like you transport yourself to the past. It\'s a little colonial town that looks that was frozen in time.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

206335482.name: It\'s a big rock.
206335482.author: a TripAdvisor user
206335482.reviewBody: I can\'t wait to tell my friends. They don\'t have a rock this big.\n\nOk, Buffy quotes aside, this is a nice town to visit and if you enjoy the outdoors it\'s a good thing to see, after all, it is a huge rocky formation, one of the biggest in the world.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

206322669.name: amazing!
206322669.author: a TripAdvisor user
206322669.reviewBody: We were amazed at the size of la pena ... we didn\'t venture up it, but many did ... supposed to be the most amazing spot for viewing sunrise!

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

198818327.name: An exceptional outcrop of rock
198818327.author: a TripAdvisor user
198818327.reviewBody: A great and interesting surprise close to the colonial city of Queretaro with in ease reach of local wines.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

197923385.name: A nice hike... was worth the effort!
197923385.author: a TripAdvisor user
197923385.reviewBody: It was a chilly day but with the exercise of climbing up got warm! It is worth the while and effort to go up there. Bring your water since you won\'t find any up there... only some ice-Popsicle and snacks that will get you more thirsty. \n\nThe "harder" part is going down! Not so much going up. The view is really cool. You have to try the ice-cream they sell in the bottom of the pe\u00f1a before you get to the "vendors" area. Obviously, bring your hiking shoes and make sure you break them in before the climbing!!

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

197193413.name: Close Encounters Mexico
197193413.author: a TripAdvisor user
197193413.reviewBody: Hiked up the mountain with a work colleague from Mexico.  At the end of 2013 I worked several weeks in Queretaro \u2013 long hours and not much was going right.  However on the off Saturday my friend took me to this attraction.  The walk up is not for the faint of heart -  I\u2019m in decent shape but would call this a difficult hike.  Several places along the way where if you fell it would be all over very fast.  After we had dinner in the town.  Should add we didn\u2019t do the guided mountain climb to the top with gear / ropes \u2013 just the walking part.  However we did go as far as you could which required some places on your hands and knees \u2013 last \u00bc mile is very difficult.  Make sure you bring water and guard shack at the bottom requires you sign in / out.  Believe you must start up the mountain before 6 pm .  Run by what would be equivalent of a parks service in the USA.  They ask for a donation but don\u2019t think it\u2019s a requirement.  Likely over 40 if you get my title.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

196785638.name: Climbing the pena, great fun!
196785638.author: a TripAdvisor user
196785638.reviewBody: This is a easy pena to climb. We are 60+ and made it almost to the top. It has jagged rock exposed so make sure you wear decent hiking boots.  Great views of the area. We took a bus from the station in Queretaro. I had trouble finding the departure times, took a chance, arrived at station  9:30, and did get a 10ish am bus, 40P about 1 hr. There is quite a approach to the trailhead, where you sign in,  with little huts selling souvenirs (most closed this day)  But there was this tiny booth that sold yummy ice cream in homemade wafers. I know it was homemade because the smell was too enticing! Barnel, itself was a disappointment. Maybe on a weekend, but on a weekday the town was dead. Many shops had closed and as a pueblo magico, this town did not have much magic on this day! ie, except for the ice cream cups as a treat for a great climb!

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

196187890.name: Get ready for a climb!
196187890.author: a TripAdvisor user
196187890.reviewBody: Amazing views and well worth the climb!  Amazing chili powdered fruit on the way down after hike.  Bring plenty of water.  A couple approach us to rock climb and rapel down, it was 3 hours and $40 US.  We decided not to go because we did not have time.  After climibing Bernal I was glad I did not rock climb.  Very scary!  Wear hiking shoes/sandals.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

194696162.name: day trip to La Pena de Bernal
194696162.author: a TripAdvisor user
194696162.reviewBody: This was a great day trip to a totally charming little town ... one of the "Mexico Magico" sites.... over which towers stunning Bernal peak...third largest monolith in the world. One can either walk up the base of the monolith or catch a taxi part way.... steep hike, so wear good walking shoes. There are lots of fun places to eat in town and the view follows you everywhere. Easily accessed by bus from Queretaro

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

194577944.name: Beautiful
194577944.author: a TripAdvisor user
194577944.reviewBody: I had an awesome experience climbing the rock. It was a great work out and had markers along the way to show different plants and animals. Breath taking view whenyou reach the top. Also very inexpensive jewelry sold here as compared to the airport, same items for far more money. A must see!

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

194452214.name: Excellent short hike
194452214.author: a TripAdvisor user
194452214.reviewBody: A wonderful short hike (1hr round trip) that is well marked and maintained. 2 lookout platforms along the trek. Really quiet on the weekdays. Busy on the weekends, but there is a water fountain that runs then.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

193897434.name: Go on the week-end
193897434.author: a TripAdvisor user
193897434.reviewBody: Lots of action on Saturday and Sunday.  La Pena (the third largest monolith in the world)  Climb as high as you can for a great view.  Enjoy the scene in the town center.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

193420028.name: Pueblo magico
193420028.author: a TripAdvisor user
193420028.reviewBody: Good experience to visit a tipical mexican town with very nice mexican food and details. Interesting place.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

192852631.name: A must in QRO
192852631.author: a TripAdvisor user
192852631.reviewBody: A must in QRO ... the town is nice with amazing goat milk sweets and quaint liitle buildings plazas and a nice church. The Pe\u00f1a is nice with a decent trail that you can climb and the view from the top of the trail is very nice.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

186242892.name: Puebla magico
186242892.author: a TripAdvisor user
186242892.reviewBody: It\u00b4s a great trip to Bernal and additionaly it\u00b4s very easy to acces by bus. After a one hour busride, you just hop of in Bernal and you can climb the Pena de Bernal. The few from there ist just awsome and afterwards you can enjoy the beautful village.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

185965936.name: A place to relax
185965936.author: a TripAdvisor user
185965936.reviewBody: Nice Little old town with arts and crafts, restaurants and a natural view of a great rock that you can climb.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

185894890.name: Great place, friendly people, good exercise
185894890.author: a TripAdvisor user
185894890.reviewBody: I recommend parking in town. Its a longer walk, more exercise, greater selection of restaurants after the climb.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

185799500.name: 3rd World biggest monolith, Only 45 minutes away from Queretaro city
185799500.author: a TripAdvisor user
185799500.reviewBody: A very charming small town with all levels of small personalized service Hotels (I recommend Casa Mateo). You may take a Trolley ride to know the town stories (like Chucho el Roto, a mexican Robin Hood). Also You definitely would like to take the Mexican legends Walking tour at night, in which you will hear stories with live actors. To eat you cannot miss the "Gorditas" (Thick Tortilla style (Corn meal) stuffed with different kind of food). You may also want to try some restaurants with Italian or American menus. The biggest attraction is to contemplate the 3rd biggest world monolith. You can get to almost any place in this town without a car but walking and enjoying street shopping and Sightseeing.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

185795394.name: Worth the trip!
185795394.author: a TripAdvisor user
185795394.reviewBody:
The peña de bernal & the town of bernal are definitely worth the 45 minute trip from queretaro.  

The peña is the second or third largest rock in the world (I'm not sure what that means, but it's a big rock) and makes for a nice hike with good views or a good climb (with proper equipment).  The village is charming and nice to walk around.  

If you are in queretaro and tired of churches and want to get outside a bit, bernal is a nice change.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

185017753.name: Lovely Little Town
185017753.author: a TripAdvisor user
185017753.reviewBody: It was, indeed, a Pueblo Magico, small but quaint. I think it would be difficult going for people with handicaps, but most people can easily do the walk around town on the cobblestone streets (there are hills).  If it is a three-day weekend (puente) go early.  We got there around 10:30, and already most of the parking lots were full!  We thought we would be the only ones there so early!  When you go, drive the short way on to Tequisquiapan, too, to enjoy another Pueblo Magico.  We didn\'t do the walk up the rock formation, but allow more time than I mentioned (1-2 hours) if you do.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

184933585.name: Half-way up!
184933585.author: a TripAdvisor user
184933585.reviewBody: What a nice little place to go on a quick and challenging hike. La Pe\u00f1a de Bernal is a lonely pe\u00f1a--reminded me of Sedona but with few professional hikers. Here, hiking is done Mexican style! how is that? with whatever you have on--the point is to get to the top! And you find small stands selling not only water but jewelry and other nick-knacks you may not want or need for your hike up or down. The point, the only point is to get up and down without killing your feet or your shoes! There are few photo spots so be patient with the crowds; all want the same thing--get to the top!\nOnce the hike is over, you can get back in town on foot or by motorbike. I walked down and enjoyed the vendors along the way.  I also enjoyed a delicious gordita with a cold beer at one of the many "gordita stands" that line up the only street to the Pe\u00f1a. Quite an accomplishment to get tot the top and back without losing your feet in the process. Enjoy the views!

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

184879004.name: nice day trip
184879004.author: a TripAdvisor user
184879004.reviewBody: it is a short drive form Queretaro. Take the local little bus ride to take you all around the city and tell you the history. The stop at the candy factory is great. You don\'t get to see any candy making but buy candies, these are the best candies in the area!!!

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

184771407.name: Lovely day out, beautiful and mysterious town.
184771407.author: a TripAdvisor user
184771407.reviewBody: If you are in the area, Bernal is well worth a visit. The little shops and cafes in the early evening are really nice.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

182034576.name: Beautiful town and spectacular monolith
182034576.author: a TripAdvisor user
182034576.reviewBody: We drove up from San Miguel, not too far for an afternoons trip, although its an easy ride up from Queretaro, and there are plenty of companies who will take you there. Coming from the Highland of Scotland, spectacular mountain are a standard view for me, so I was surprised and delighted as you turn the corner on the highway and this large lump of rock (a description which I realise does not do it justice) comes into view, with the small town sprawled out below it. The town is lovely, with the standard Mexican square that\u00b4s lovely and colourful, with sellers and small shops with artesan wares and small restuarant. It has a very laid back feel and the prices were not standard tourist ones (over priced), so we\u00b4d recommend visiting if you are in the area. We didn\u00b4t climb the monolith, but would go back to do so in the future (it was a particularly hot day and we were there in the early afternoon). \nOverall, well worth a visit!

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

181705834.name: Fantastic Day Trip!
181705834.author: a TripAdvisor user
181705834.reviewBody: The beautiful setting of the monolith and town pretty much says it all. It was my favorite part of guided day trip from Queretaro.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

181050313.name: A Climb worth making
181050313.author: a TripAdvisor user
181050313.reviewBody: This was my second time climbing the rock and I would highly recommend it to all travelers.  The first time I was with a group of young people and they left the trail and we climbed some dangerous spots.  This trip I was with a family with young children.  The great thing about the climb is it can be done by people of various ages and abilities.  Even making a partial climb gives one a great view and a feeling of accomplishment. If you forget to take water for your climb there are places to purchase it along the way and unlike most tourist areas they do not overcharge you. Some of the best gorditos in Mexico can also be eaten there in the park at the restaurant - I believe it was Senorita Dona\'s.  \nMake sure that you plan enough time to visit the town as well as climbing La Pena.  There are numerous artisans and local items which are worth a look.  Also the candies of the town are famous and fabulous.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

180981646.name: A fun day out or even good for a 3-day
180981646.author: a TripAdvisor user
180981646.reviewBody: La Pe\u00f1a de Bernal is about a 45 minute to an hour drive from Queretaro (city) - a nice ride on good highway.  Plenty has been written about the rock (monolith itself) - well worth the look. The town is cute - touristy, but in a tasteful way. It is a very good walking destination whether for easy strolling (shops, restaurants and cantinas)  or - for the more athletic  - the big rock itself, which has a nice, and somewhat challenging, trail for a good work-out and awesome vistas. Quality of food and restaurant selection is excellent with regional and international fare. Small and romantic hotels and posadas with colonial features, and an abundance of gardens and stonework. Prices, rather modest, for the value. Safe and no real security issues. Easy to park and secure parking is available and cheap. A good destination for a romantic getaway or a day out with the family.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

180951836.name: Charming town
180951836.author: a TripAdvisor user
180951836.reviewBody: Must see ..60 miles out of town.  shops food great its like you go back in time 300 years. The mountain at the foothills is the 3rd largest rock outcrop in the wowld

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

179632289.name: Beautiful and impressive site, well worth the trip
179632289.author: a TripAdvisor user
179632289.reviewBody: A beautiful spot near the magical town of San Sebasti\u00e1n de Bernal, also worth a visit, especially if you\'re shopping for opals. Try a "gordita" while you\'re there, especially one filled with "chicharr\u00f3n". The Pe\u00f1a, the third largest monolith in the world is certainly impressive.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

179217754.name: Worth climbing the crag!
179217754.author: a TripAdvisor user
179217754.reviewBody: From the bus Central Terminal in Santiago de Quer\u00e9taro, there are buses run by the "flecha amarilla" company that for 38 pesos and in 45min. they leave you in the town of Bernal. From there you can walk till the foot of the mountain (you don\'t need to take any transport). Once there, you can start climbing La Pe\u00f1a. If you are not an expert, you cannot get to the top, but you can arrive to the middle of the crag and it\'s completely worth it!  It can take you around one hour (depending on how fit you are). \nThe town is very beautiful but you don\'t need more than half an hour to see it.\nTake into account that to go back to Quer\u00e9taro, the buses run every hour and there\'s not an official stop. The bus simply stops in the middle of the main road.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

177708422.name: la pena de Bernal
177708422.author: a TripAdvisor user
177708422.reviewBody: very beautiful "pueblo magico", special food, traditional handmade goods and sweets,. Special chocolates with different sabores.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

175760339.name: A Fun Day Trip
175760339.author: a TripAdvisor user
175760339.reviewBody:
My wife and I have a home in San Miguel de Allende, GTO.  A fun day trip from SMA is to travel to Bernal (approx. 1 1/2 hours).

Once there you can hike about 3/4 of the way up La Pena de Bernal, now certified (as of July 2013) as the highest natural monolith in the world.  If you want to go all the way up, you will need climbing gear as the trail ends.  The climb is moderate, the biggest issue being the overall altitude of the site (over 6500 ft.).

After hiking go to the town square and do some shopping and have comida.  The shopping is good for nice quality at a very reasonable price.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

175139515.name: Great place to hike up the rock
175139515.author: a TripAdvisor user
175139515.reviewBody: There is a trail at the edge of the town of Bernal, where you can park your car and take a nice hike up to the base of the rock. Climb is reasonable steep, but not strenuous. Take your time and take some water with you. Lots of desert vegetation around, with nice panoramic views of the valley where you can see for miles as it is very clear.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

174956321.name: Great day trip from San Miguel de Allende
174956321.author: a TripAdvisor user
174956321.reviewBody: Defi Italy worth visiting.  We started off by walking through the lovely, cute town of Bernal to get to the base of the hiking trails.  Very picturesque.  Hiked up halfway, for about an you or so.  Spectacular views, rocky easy climb tha far.  Headed back down to town for lunch of gorditas, which were wonderful.  Lunch for the four of us, including soft drinks for all was under $10!  We never saw another gringo in town.  There\'s an info booth in the center of town, the gal there does not speak English, which we thought was kind of cool.  It\'s a very different feel in the town than San Miguel.  I asked one restaurant if their beautiful clay mugs were for sale, they said yes.  I asked how much and no one knew, so I couldn\'t buy any!  It was just fun and an adventure and seemed so much more of a sleepy, small Mexican town.  We all loved it.  From there we drove on a back road to the Flexinet Winery.  The drive was wonderful, but the winery didn\'t seem anything special.  Bernal is definitely worth visiting.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

174293864.name: beautiful
174293864.author: a TripAdvisor user
174293864.reviewBody: Bernal is a cute little village. The ambiance is very nice and ideal for quiet, relaxing moment. Lots of handcraft booths and stores. Very nice architecture.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

173235998.name: A nice location with a few good restaurants.
173235998.author: a TripAdvisor user
173235998.reviewBody: The central historico area was small nice with a couple of good restaurants which I will preview.  This is little to do except hike toward the Pena, although some hikers do hike a good distance up the rock.  The area is nice for a day or so.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

171928494.name: Great rock and a lovely little town
171928494.author: a TripAdvisor user
171928494.reviewBody: We thought we were driving in just to see the "Monolith of Mexico" and then leave, but we were so enchanted by the rock and the little town that we stayed a night.  There is not a lot going on in Bernal but it was wonderful to walk thoughout the town and always have a good view of the big rock nearby.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

170888945.name: Awesome
170888945.author: a TripAdvisor user
170888945.reviewBody:
This is the third largest monolith in the world, after Gibraltar and SugarLoaf in Rio de Janeiro. When you reach its base, you are in awe because of its size. When the sun shines on it, it is bathed in gold. We didn,t climb it all the way up because we only had 1 hour and I wanted to see the fine stones offered in the tienda Piedras.
This visit was part of a tour that included Pena de Bernal, San Sebastian de Bernal, Tequisquiapan, a botanical garden and Freixenet. I strongly recommend this tour. 
You can book it in front of the Corregidora monument (20.59402,-100.39253)in the historical center of Queretaro.
This is ranked 2 of 18 attraqctions in Queretaro and has 255 reviews. This is because it not only merits a review but a visit. Believe me, no photo will give you the majestic sight of the real thing.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

170372638.name: Family at the Pena
170372638.author: a TripAdvisor user
170372638.reviewBody: I love Bernal, having scaled to the top twice to write my name on the board, I love it. I have taken students and family up the rock. I have visited it around 20 times. The town is gorgeous as is the garden and red and yellow church in the center. Costs 38 pesos one-way per person. Last bus back must be taken where dropped off by 6pm, get there early so you don\'t miss it.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

170053546.name: Beautiful views and a quaint town
170053546.author: a TripAdvisor user
170053546.reviewBody: Having lived about an hour away, I\'ve visited Bernal several times. The hike up to the viewing platform (about half way up the pe\u00f1a) is not terribly difficult. It is certainly a climb, but it is a well maintained trail. The view is impressive. The town, famous for its gorditas, is enjoyable to wander around. It is definitely a worthwhile day trip from Quer\u00e9taro, possibly combined with a visit to Tequisquiapan and/or the wine caves of Freixenet.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

169800022.name: One of the beautiful must-see sites of Queretaro
169800022.author: a TripAdvisor user
169800022.reviewBody: Bernal\'s Rock is very close to the town of Bernal. It is a steep rock to climb so be sure of having the right shoes and physical condition. If you don\'t plan to climb it, though, the town is a nice site to walk, sit on a cafe or have a good meal. Lots of photo ops.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

168726081.name: very intereseting place...
168726081.author: a TripAdvisor user
168726081.reviewBody: can you climb to the top? sure you can!   an interesting old volcano skeleton. town is very quiant.  been twice now and still injoy the views.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

168656935.name: Excellent day trip from Qro or Mexico City
168656935.author: a TripAdvisor user
168656935.reviewBody: The town of Bernal is a picturesque pueblito set at the foot of the majestic Pena de Bernal monolith. The Pena itself is much more imposing in person than in any photograph. It is also worth the climb for its amazing views and for the challenge itself. The town is charming and there are some nice textile and pottery shops as well as the local dulceria. There is also a small castle built in the XVII century that now houses local government offices. I was very pleasantly surprised by Bernal and can\'t wait to visit again!

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

163868098.name: Great for a day trip, but overnight is fun too!
163868098.author: a TripAdvisor user
163868098.reviewBody: The city of Bernal, although tiny, has a few nice restaurants that cater to people of all nationalities and ages. You can also rent a cabin nearby (forgot the name) to stay in for the night. The monolith, being the second in the world, is quite the climb. I would suggest climbing in the early evening or morning.  It is not a dangerous climb and there are many stands to get drinks on the way up, selling both alcoholic drinks and others. At night theres a cool light and fountain show that changes color with different types of music.. very cool indeed.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

161348860.name: big rock with a charming pueblito at its foot
161348860.author: a TripAdvisor user
161348860.reviewBody: The Pena de Bernal is apparently the thrid larges monolith in the world (per tourist brochure). It is about 30-45 min by car from Santiago de Queretaro. If you go on a hot day, take a lot of fluids with you as it can get really hot especially if you decide to climb it (or even a part of it.) I went half way on a cloudy day and it was a really good and tireing workout. The highlight for me was the little town of Bernal at the foot of the rock where I had the delicious gorditas served at Dona Coco place. I recommend the gorditas or sopes made with the blue corn tortillas. They have a different taste to the regular corn, at least for me. The town was a set for several Mexican movies and still is used for such purposes as it is very picturesque. THey also have some nice shops with souvenirs... but take cash with you as credit cards are not accepted everywhere.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

160915524.name: Worth a trip.
160915524.author: a TripAdvisor user
160915524.reviewBody: Very impressive third largest volcanic plug after Gibralter and Sugarloaf Mountain. The town is a bit touristy but also has pretty, tradition buldings.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

160096831.name: Pueblo Magico - Magic Town
160096831.author: a TripAdvisor user
160096831.reviewBody: Officially designated as such by the Mexican Ministry of Tourism and well deserved.  It\'s about half an hour away from Quer\u00e9taro.  It\'s a small town that\'s known for two things mainly: the Pe\u00f1a de Bernal, the world\'s third-largest monolith (after Gibraltar and Sugarloaf) and crafts (primarily textiles, wood carving and candy-making).  On the main square is a textile store called La Aurora and you can ask to go behind the sales counters to check out the actual workshops where 100-year-old looms are still in use...you can see the raw wool, the dying vats and the craftsmen working the looms making carpets, ponchos, etc.  The more adventurous and physically active of you will enjoy climbing up the side of the Pe\u00f1a but the day we were there the temperature was over 25 degrees Celsius so we passed on that experience.  There are several restaurants and quaint hotels in town - Gorditas seem to be a local favorite and they are delicious; they are made with blue corn masa and filled with a variety of fillings ranging from beans to steak.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

156197633.name: Quaint little town and spectac views
156197633.author: a TripAdvisor user
156197633.reviewBody: Short bus trip from Queretaro\'s bus terminal.  Pena de Bernal is a quaint little town with spectacular views of the \'mountain\'.  I can see why people think there are mystical powers.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

155532051.name: A nice place to visit !
155532051.author: a TripAdvisor user
155532051.reviewBody: We enjoyed an afternoon in Pena de Benal,I feel very thankfull that our friends showed us this place.Probably for everybody is a nice place to visit but being a tourist is maybe even more interesting becouse there you can exactly find what you will consider to be very typical of Mexico..The buidings,restaruants ,souvenirs shops,the church,music,people dressed in traditional dresses etc..and of course the biggest attaction is the big Pena,a huge mountain-rock that makes this village even more pintoresque.We hat a very good coffee,Chocolate and cakes across the church. After that we drove to Tequisquipan which i also recomend.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

155072390.name: Sunday Hike
155072390.author: a TripAdvisor user
155072390.reviewBody: The energy, short drive from Queretaro, lot\'s of families hiking the mountain, great views from the mountain, lot\'s of cafes and resaurants in town, culture

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

154693604.name: A spectacular view from the town or from the air.
154693604.author: a TripAdvisor user
154693604.reviewBody: Bernal is a small colonial town.  Great to wander around and take in the local sounds and sites.  The Frexinet vinyard is also close to Bernal.  Worth a visit there.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

154094519.name: 3rd Tallest Monolith in the World
154094519.author: a TripAdvisor user
154094519.reviewBody: Pe\u00f1a de Bernal At 350 m it is the third tallest monolith in the world, after the Rock of Gibraltar and Sugarloaf Mountain in Rio de Janeiro (not Maine <grin>).  While the rock is impressive, the surrounding town is a great place to walk around, have a good meal, shop local crafts and enjoy a nice day outdoors.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

153310169.name: Nice Time
153310169.author: a TripAdvisor user
153310169.reviewBody:
Close to Queretaro, this "magic town" offers unique experiences such as gastronomic and beautiful views. Maybe is just a one day trip, but I think you can discover more if you spend a night there and of course you have to climb the "peña". 
A lot of local business to watch, wine to drink (here is a wine region) and excellent cheeses.
You will find boutique hotels and nice restaurants.
Take your time, walk a lot and take photos¡¡¡

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

150302761.name: Great day trip!
150302761.author: a TripAdvisor user
150302761.reviewBody:
I traveled by myself, from Queretaro for a nice little day trip. I put a lot of time into researching and trying to figure out how to do it, but it's very easy :)

I just took a cab to the Queretaro bus station, terminal B (for second class buses -- I don't think any first class ones go to Bernal!) I walked up to the desks and asked for buses to Bernal -- the first line I asked had one in two hours, but they kindly directed me toward a line that had a bus in 30 minutes, so be sure to check around if it seems like you'll have to wait too long. My bus was at 10:35AM for 38 pesos. It was a bit of trouble trying to find which bus it was, but ask as many friendly faces as possible to make sure you're getting right info. The trip itself was very pleasant, somewhere over an hour. After an hour, you should be able to see the huge rock out of the left side of the bus. Maybe 10 - 15 minutes later (estimate, didn't pay close enough attention!), the bus will stop in the little down where there are some restaurants and rows of shops -- it should also be the stop when most people get off. Even though the rock looks far away, it's an easy walk! I'm terrible at finding my way, but the town is so small and simple that I managed perfectly. Don't hesitate to ask shopkeepers along the way which way to go. The town is very calm and safe and I never felt uncomfortable (as a solo woman traveler). Soon, as you come to the base of the mountain, you can just follow the crowd of people and up you go :) There is no entrance fee or anything. Don't forget to reward yourself with some gorditas after you've made it back down! Then, just retrace your steps kinda where the bus dropped you off -- look for the Barbacoa restaurant, ask around. It is on a corner. Ask the people waiting there to make sure that you're on the correct side of the street. I'm not sure what the bus schedule is, so I just waited around. I got there around 4PM (I think) just because I don't know when the last bus back is (also 38 pesos).

Easy, cheap, refreshing day trip :)

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

150211968.name: Great hike!
150211968.author: a TripAdvisor user
150211968.reviewBody: Great hike if you\'re in the area. Beautiful city below too.\n\nIf you can, wear your pants. The hike isn\'t too hard and the locals climb it to have picnics in their Sunday best. I wore basketball shorts and the locals thought I was ridiculous.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

149469883.name: Great day trip
149469883.author: a TripAdvisor user
149469883.reviewBody: Great day trip from Queretaro, and the town is small with a lot of character.  It is just over an 1 hour drive, and easy to get from Queretaro

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

148866162.name: Largest Rock in North America, in quaint state of Queretaro
148866162.author: a TripAdvisor user
148866162.reviewBody: It is magestical to see and the town is gorgeous and colonial. Worth spending an afternoon.  Try to call ahead of time if you like to rapel. I hear people can come down the mountain on a rope.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

147811768.name: Really good adventure, but it\'s a tough walk if you aren\'t used to the altitude.
147811768.author: a TripAdvisor user
147811768.reviewBody:
Took the Flecha Amarilla bus from Queretaro for about $5, and got off on the main road.  It's a little hike through the village (really quiet mid-week), with lots of little snack bars and souvenir stands.  Then you kind of wind your way up through the streets to the base of the Pena.  There's a really good ice cream place half way up on the left where samples are offered.  It just looks like a small open room, so keep an eye out. 
We followed (we thought) the trail to the right at the base up the hill, but then got told by a park warden on a ATV that the trail was closed, and we had to go back down.  Then we found the other trail, which was far more rocky.  It's fairly steep and rough in places, and after coming from almost sea level, I found the air quite thin.  I needed to take a break every couple of minutes, as I just couldn't get enough oxygen with each breath.  By the time I got to the final look-out (maybe about 30 minutes from the base), my legs felt dead.  Really nice view from there, and I went past the look-out onto the open rock face, but felt with my now-wobbly legs, I shouldn't be taking too many chances on a steep face with no railings.  So I didn't get to see over the other side, but at least I survived to tell the tale!  It's not really that tough, but if you haven't acclimatized to the elevation (about 2500m), then you might find it challenging.  My teenagers were really tired, but we saw a 2 year old walk up, so I guess it depends on what you are used to.  
Nice BBQ restaurant on the main highway across from the bus stop on the way back.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

147394623.name: LOVE IT
147394623.author: a TripAdvisor user
147394623.reviewBody: been many times, quaint little town, good restaurants and the pena is always fun to climb!  highly recommended

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

146242188.name: Beautiful
146242188.author: a TripAdvisor user
146242188.reviewBody: La piedad esta muy bonito y el pueblo muy pintoresco.  //  The boulder is amazing and the town is very cute.  The town has cute, little shops filled with handmade goods.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

144619262.name: just an outstandinng view
144619262.author: a TripAdvisor user
144619262.reviewBody: been the second bigest rock in the world this outstanding monolite rises in fron of you to amaze and fill up with its energy. climbing it during the day its reconfortating but watch it at night iluminated by power color reflectors, its just breathtaking. this magical town its just 2 hours away from the capital but youll fell in other planet.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

142015761.name: The Third Largest Monolith in the world!
142015761.author: a TripAdvisor user
142015761.reviewBody: It was such a neat experience to go there early in the morning, but any time would be great.  There are two larger.  One is The Rock of Gibraltar and the other is in Brazil.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

137392477.name: One of the most beautiful little towns
137392477.author: a TripAdvisor user
137392477.reviewBody: The scene from the main street is awesome. The church square is beautiful. The town takes you back to when life was easier and more laid back. It is good to lower your stress. Just do not climb the rock or your stress level would be higher than when you arrived. But it is also avery good adventure.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

137211060.name: the best "gorditas" ever
137211060.author: a TripAdvisor user
137211060.reviewBody: Great for hikers, if you like climbing rocks this is your place. Also the town is very peaceful and pretty and you can to eat the best gorditas (mexican dish) ever.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

135729621.name: Good exercise and a nice little town to enjoy
135729621.author: a TripAdvisor user
135729621.reviewBody:
I started climbing at 9:15 am on a Monday. I left my car in the parking lot at the base of the Peña. You can reach it by taking the Corregidora street up. 

It took me 35 minutes to reach the top of the Peña. Well, you can’t get to the top without equipment, but you can get pretty close. The path is easy to follow, wide at first and it gets narrower as you move up. It’s not hard to climb, just go at your own pace. Just before the top there’s a steep rocky climb, but it’s very doable. When I arrived at the top there was a family with a couple of kids between eight and twelve years old. 

I stayed at the top for 15 minutes or so, just sitting on some rocks enjoying the view after the effort. I just wished I had taken something to drink!

Going down was tricky, I thought it would be faster but it really took me the same time to go up than to go down as I had to be careful on some of the steeper zones.

I highly recommend to climb the Peña, you get up close and personal with the rock. Afterwards, you can have something to eat and drink in town. The Mezquite is a good option with a small menu of traditional mexican food and with view to the Peña.  For a more elegant alternative, the restaurant on the boutique hotel Casa Mateo (just around main square) is a good choice with a contemporary approach of mexican food. The Bernal town is very small but very enjoyable.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

134533931.name: Hot!
134533931.author: a TripAdvisor user
134533931.reviewBody: It\'s accessible by public transport and is apparently the second largest monolith in the world. The path up is straight forward with a few slippery points (don\'t wear sandals as it\'s hard)! There are some stalls at the bottom with good foos.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

134290169.name: Well worth the visit
134290169.author: a TripAdvisor user
134290169.reviewBody: A real feel of Mexico, popular attraction among locals

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

133144907.name: Bernal
133144907.author: a TripAdvisor user
133144907.reviewBody: This site has great geological properties, a decent church and adjacent buildings. There are enough restaurants to satisfy your Mexican palate

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

131291586.name: Nice little town
131291586.author: a TripAdvisor user
131291586.reviewBody: Perfect for 1 night or as an excursion out of Queretaro.

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

130435019.name: Loved the town and the monolith
130435019.author: a TripAdvisor user
130435019.reviewBody: I wasn\'t expecting to enjoy this visit as much as I did.  The town was absolutely charming, with a great variety of shops, restaurants, and hotels.  The shopping was great ... lots of jewelry, art work, gemstones, and artesan crafts.  The setting was very beautiful, with the 3rd largest monolith in the world towering over the gardens and quaint buildings of the town "centro."  We were able to drive about 1/4 of the way up and park the car and continue the journey on foot.  We climbed maybe 3/4 of the way to the top, to the point where it really became unsafe to climb without safety equipment.  I had to take several breaks to make it up that high, but there were small children and elderly people climbing as well so I think it is something that most people could handle.  The view was well worth it.  I highly recommend a visit here!  Additionally, Bernal is said to give off good energy, and that is something I am always in need of:)

address.streetAddress: Ubicada en Villa De Bernal, No En Querétaro

129146002.name: The town is great!
129146002.author: a TripAdvisor user
129146002.reviewBody: In theory you should get good fibs when you visit.  I didn\'t have the energy to climb up but I really enjoyed walking around the little town and eating at an Italian restaurant (can\'t remember the name but the only one there) and people watch.

128310441.name: art art art
128310441.author: a TripAdvisor user
