123254358.author: a TripAdvisor user
123254358.reviewBody: Wonderful place to really see and understand the colonial times in Mexico.  Lots of history, a must if you visit Queretaro.

address.streetAddress: Juarez y Angela Peralta

121180146.name: Need to go with a guide to understand the importance
121180146.author: a TripAdvisor user
121180146.reviewBody:
From outside it doesn't look like much but the symbol is great:
- first national song
- decision to shoot Emperor Maximilien
- signing of the constitution

address.streetAddress: Juarez y Angela Peralta

120274336.name: Beautiful building
120274336.author: a TripAdvisor user
120274336.reviewBody: If you can read spanish then there is plenty of info on display inside. The building itself is well preserved and lovely to look at. If you are in the Centro you should have a look round. The facade is also beautiful. It cost nothing to get in, but you did have to sign the visitor book and wait for the security guard to allow you upstairs.

address.streetAddress: Juarez y Angela Peralta

116678967.name: Awesome place
116678967.author: a TripAdvisor user
116678967.reviewBody: I attended a symphony concert and an opera recital in the Teatro. It\'s beautiful and the history is central to any student of Mexican history. It\'s where Maximiliano received his death sentence and it\'s the place where the 1917 Constitution was signed. It was built sometime around 1820. Even if you don\'t go to a concert, the hall is open to visit during the day. Don\'t miss it.

address.streetAddress: Juarez y Angela Peralta

59286411.name: Nice Theatre - Great Concert
59286411.author: a TripAdvisor user
59286411.reviewBody: Since the theatre was  important in some hight points of Mexican History we asked for permission and were allowed to walk up a flight and take a peek at the theatre. The next day we returned for a concert with their symphont orchestra and a couple of guest artists. The price was reasonable and we had a chance to hear some great music. On the backdrop of the stage there were many names from around Mexico when they wrote the country\'s constitution there. I think a judgment also sentenced the short time Emperor Maximilian to death at a different time.

address.streetAddress: Juarez y Angela Peralta

365799918.name: Teatro with class in Queretaro
365799918.author: a TripAdvisor user
365799918.reviewBody: Easily accessible, great parking, just on the outskirts of town. If you have no car an easy taco ride.  Beautiful, modern building with gorgeous theatre. If there in the evening, the view is worth the drive!

666061106.name: Touristic walk
666061106.author: a TripAdvisor user
666061106.reviewBody: The government has made much to improve this archeological zone. If there is something that I would change, will be definitely the person giving the bilingual tours. She is polite and friendly, just not as it, keen in English, which makes it hard to enjoy the visit and get to know the history.

address.streetAddress: a 7km del centro de la ciudad de Santiago de Queretaro

653360333.name: Closed Saturday - Monday
653360333.author: a TripAdvisor user
653360333.reviewBody:
We were in Queretaro City over the weekend and tried twice to see El Cerrito.  Once on Saturday afternoon and once on Monday late afternoon.  Both times the gate was locked.

We went to the nearby municipal center and the guard told us it was closed Sat/Sun/Mon.  Just unlucky!  

Looks great though!

address.streetAddress: a 7km del centro de la ciudad de Santiago de Queretaro

651372971.name: Pyramid close to Queretaro city -- easy and quick trip
651372971.author: a TripAdvisor user
651372971.reviewBody: If you\'re in Queretaro City and have a couple of hours to spare, you should definitely take a quick trip to see the El Cerrito Archaeological Zone (the pyramid is sometimes also referred to as the El Pueblito pyramid). It\'s only 15 to 20 minutes outside of the city, and taking an Uber will only cost you ~ US$4 or less. There was no entry fee when I visited. The site is rather low-key, and there are relatively few visitors (it\'s peaceful and you can enjoy the scenery and the views without jostling with the crowds). It looks like they\'ve built a visitor\'s centre (although it wasn\'t operational when I visited in February 2019... so maybe the construction is not yet complete). The signage is only in Spanish (hopefully in future they will add English), so if you don\'t read Spanish, make sure to read up about the site before visiting (or during your visit, on your smartphone). Although the pyramid and surrounding structures aren\'t as magnificent as the ones you see at Teotihuacan or Chichen Itza, El Cerrito is still worth a visit since it\'s free, you don\'t have to contend with hordes of other tourists, and it\'s easy/convenient to get to.

address.streetAddress: a 7km del centro de la ciudad de Santiago de Queretaro

648351582.name: underated and well worth the short trip from the city center
648351582.author: a TripAdvisor user
648351582.reviewBody: Seeing a Toltec period pyramid was high on our list while visiting central Mexico.  We didn\'t have time to get to Mexico City.  We were thrilled to discover this gem just a few km from the Queretaro city center.  We used Uber to get there and back with ease.  The visitor center isn\'t quite open yet.  We\'d be interested to see what that might have to offer for better explanation.  The existing signage is only in Spanish.  It would be a wonderful improvement if signage could be in both Spanish and English.  Or, maybe offer a self guided audio tour in both languages in the future?  We muddled by with our basic Spanish skills and reading the article on Wikipedia as we toured the site.  Restoration is ongoing.  I\'d definitely go back.

address.streetAddress: a 7km del centro de la ciudad de Santiago de Queretaro

644998260.name: Very cool pyramid!
644998260.author: a TripAdvisor user
644998260.reviewBody: They\'re in the process of building a museum to go along with the site.  The pyramid itself is much larger than I expected and has a very long and interesting history.  Not to be missed if you are in the area!

address.streetAddress: a 7km del centro de la ciudad de Santiago de Queretaro

641139576.name: My First Pyramid
641139576.author: a TripAdvisor user
641139576.reviewBody:
First - word of caution - GPS sent Uber driver to the backside away from entrance.  The entrance is at the “Y” in the road and had no signage - simply a long path heading directly towards pyramid.  

Short Uber ride (and cheap) from city center - area is a bit rundown but felt safe (although houses are all behind high fences and thick steel gates)

The path has been very nicely paved (they were still working on the plants along the edge)

Sign in on the visitors book and a gal instructs you on path to follow and warns you not to climb on the pyramid.  

At that point you are free to wander - no guides or docents - simply plaques explaining things (Spanish only)

Visit takes 40 mins - 1 hr 

I wobbled back and forth between average and very good - I would have liked to have seen more about the time is was built - how it was built - what they did there - and would have LOVED to climb it (if they are worried about erosion - have a path up the unexcavated back side)

But it was still COOL to see

address.streetAddress: a 7km del centro de la ciudad de Santiago de Queretaro

622670790.name: Check first\u2014will be closed for 2 months!!!
622670790.author: a TripAdvisor user
622670790.reviewBody: Was very excited to check out my first Mexican pyramid, but only found out it is closed after a cab ride out there. Check first! We will have to come back another time. My friend went a few weeks ago and said it was super cool!\n

address.streetAddress: a 7km del centro de la ciudad de Santiago de Queretaro

602242660.name: Nice little park
602242660.author: a TripAdvisor user
602242660.reviewBody: Nice, small archaeology park not far from centro. A few scattered buildings and a nice pyramid make up the site. Lots of construction at entrance, right now you have to park on road adjacent to park and walk up dusty road about 200m. Looks like  site museum is about to open soon as well. At this point you\'ll need 30-60 minutes or so to see everything. Nice to see improvements coming.

address.streetAddress: a 7km del centro de la ciudad de Santiago de Queretaro

547961577.name: Site seeing. Must see.
547961577.author: a TripAdvisor user
547961577.reviewBody:
Okay the signage stinks and I wish there was more to explain history.  But it’s like food you don’t need to be chief to know great food  

This place is absolutely amazing and makes you think.  The methods used to construct should be used today. This place stands strong and will for many more years.  

Go see it.

address.streetAddress: a 7km del centro de la ciudad de Santiago de Queretaro

541231080.name: El Cerrito site is definitely worth a visit
541231080.author: a TripAdvisor user
541231080.reviewBody: Beautiful structure and surroundings. Fascinating history. I lucked out and had a personal guide (Leticia!) that was knowledgeable, spoke english very well and was very accommodating. You can take the #65 bus to the site; a nice ride through a variety of neighborhoods.

address.streetAddress: a 7km del centro de la ciudad de Santiago de Queretaro

499257662.name: Nice small pyramid
499257662.author: a TripAdvisor user
499257662.reviewBody: If you have some extra time then take taxi to El Cerito. After nice walk you come to small, well preserved pyramid. It is nice and peaceful place. Don\'t forget your sunblock and cap.

451101361.name: Very interesting pyramid
451101361.author: a TripAdvisor user

address.streetAddress: a 7km del centro de la ciudad de Santiago de Queretaro

446100024.name: Surreal as Mexico usually is...cultural mix
446100024.author: a TripAdvisor user
446100024.reviewBody: make sure you go there, since it is a one-of-a-kind place: a Toltec site with a pyramid that has a house on top. You don\'t need a lot of time, and it is a very interesting site to visit, not only if you\'re an archaeology enthusiast, but if you want to see a particular mix of cultures.

address.streetAddress: a 7km del centro de la ciudad de Santiago de Queretaro

442737171.name: Well worth a visit if one is in Queretaro
442737171.author: a TripAdvisor user
442737171.reviewBody: This impressive pyramid receives very little attention.  While the signage leaves much to be desired the pyramid is definitely worth a visit. If you don\'t have a guide you should probably do some online research before arriving

address.streetAddress: a 7km del centro de la ciudad de Santiago de Queretaro

415820286.name: A quick visit to clash of cultures
415820286.author: a TripAdvisor user
415820286.reviewBody: easy to get in and out. But is only 1 piramid but is a great story of it. Is a very quick tour and short time to get to know this isolate piramid

address.streetAddress: a 7km del centro de la ciudad de Santiago de Queretaro

369083661.name: El Cerrito
369083661.author: a TripAdvisor user
369083661.reviewBody: An archaeological site with one of the largest pyramids in the region, on the northern edge of Mesoamerica. It dates primarily to the Late Classic after the fall of Teotihaucan and before the rise of the Toltecs in Tula, Hidalgo. There is some evidence of other temples and plazas and a ball court. Work is ongoing and the growth of El Pueblito has encroached on most of the site. There is a nice, but small museum and guided tours. Worth a visit, especially if you do not plan on visiting any of the other archaeological sites in the area.

address.streetAddress: a 7km del centro de la ciudad de Santiago de Queretaro

368595613.name: Small but perfectly formed
368595613.author: a TripAdvisor user
368595613.reviewBody: This is a small site with one main pyramid and surrounding structures. The grounds are beautiful. We really enjoyed the energy and ambiance and would recommend this as a day out from Queretaro. It is easy to get to on the no 65 bus  or a taxi will cost around 60 pesos.

address.streetAddress: a 7km del centro de la ciudad de Santiago de Queretaro

288356249.name: Quick Selfie
288356249.author: a TripAdvisor user
288356249.reviewBody: It isnt the best pyramid in Mexico.  You cannot climb it and it has not been rebuilt.  But it is worth a quick selfie

address.streetAddress: a 7km del centro de la ciudad de Santiago de Queretaro

260456511.name: Wonderful Archaeological Zone
260456511.author: a TripAdvisor user
260456511.reviewBody: Taking the city bus #65 near the Alameda Park @ Constituyentes & Corregidora (6.5 pesos per person), we rode about 40 min. to an area, El Pueblito, 7 k. from the Historical Center of Queretaro. Approaching the area, you could see the enormous pyramid, "El Cerrito", looming    in the distance. Arriving at the site, you sign in,  but there is no entrance fee. You are provided a guide, also gratis. (Tips are appreciated.) Our guide was very knowledgeable, as well as personable, but I needed to translate, as she didn\'t know a lot of English. However, you can appreciate the pyramid without a guide, as just viewing it is quite a treat. If you can read Spanish, there are many plaques along the walkway, giving details & pictures of the excavations. Also, you can learn more at the Queretaro Regional Museum, where our guide says excavated artifacts from the area are located. To return to the Historical Center/ Alameda Park, you just take the same bus #65, which you get on the other side of the street from the pyramid. Visiting hours are: Tues.-Fri. 9:00-15:00; Sat.- Sun.9:00-17:00.

address.streetAddress: a 7km del centro de la ciudad de Santiago de Queretaro

252836665.name: Worth a visit
252836665.author: a TripAdvisor user
252836665.reviewBody: It is a small but very special pre-Hispanic zone, located just outside of Quer\u00e9taro. Well kept and it is worth a visit.

address.streetAddress: a 7km del centro de la ciudad de Santiago de Queretaro

211772661.name: Better than I expected
211772661.author: a TripAdvisor user
211772661.reviewBody: This recently excavated pyramid was more impressive than I thought it would be given some other reviews that called it "small.". It is really pretty grand in scale.  There are some nice plantings along the walkways, too.  The signage gives a pretty good description of the history of the sight.  There are also tours available.  That said, you can\'t climb the pyramid, so don\'t expect that.  Also, the statues that once decorated the facade are in a warehouse somewhere and there aren\'t even any good photos of these items to bring it to life.  Still, if you are interested in the Mexican pyramids, and you are in the area, and have transportation, this is definitely worth a visit.

address.streetAddress: a 7km del centro de la ciudad de Santiago de Queretaro

184535459.name: Great Food and excellent location
184535459.author: a TripAdvisor user
184535459.reviewBody: I am a vegetarian. They have great salads and guacamole. Just make sure you ask them to remove Pork skin.

address.streetAddress: a 7km del centro de la ciudad de Santiago de Queretaro

174293158.name: nice pyramid in Quer\u00e9taro
174293158.author: a TripAdvisor user
174293158.reviewBody: Small but nice pyramid in Quer\u00e9taro. Easy acces, either by car (30 minutes) or by bus (45-60 minutes). The village around it is quite nice too, nice central place

address.streetAddress: a 7km del centro de la ciudad de Santiago de Queretaro

171672299.name: History
171672299.author: a TripAdvisor user
171672299.reviewBody:
This archeological site is very close to Queretaro (7 km). (20° 33′ 3″ N, 100° 26′ 33″ W)
If you are close by, it is worth seeing.
It was inhabited by Chichimecas, Toltecas and Chupícuaro. It dates to 300 AD. It comprises many structures: The great pyramide, the palace, the square platform, the danse plaza and the cultural plaza. As of july 2013, you were not allowed to climb to the top but the view is very nice anyway. 
There is also a museum where you can see some of the artifacts discovered here. For those who want to know about Mexican culture, this is a must.

address.streetAddress: a 7km del centro de la ciudad de Santiago de Queretaro

673503153.name: Very nice green space
673503153.author: a TripAdvisor user
673503153.reviewBody: This garden is a very nice place, full with plants and nice statues. There are plenty of flowers also and places to relax. During the night this park is closed.

address.streetAddress: Ave Ignacio Zarazoga, Corregidora y Constituents

671919214.name: Green oasis in the city
671919214.author: a TripAdvisor user
671919214.reviewBody: This is the perfect place to get out of the sun for  a peaceful afternoon stroll. it is guarded at all entrances, which keeps vendors out. I\'m sure this contributes to the peacefulness.

address.streetAddress: Ave Ignacio Zarazoga, Corregidora y Constituents

655396636.name: A Closed Canopy City Park
655396636.author: a TripAdvisor user
655396636.reviewBody: This is one of the best maintained city parks in Mexico.  The grass areas are roped off giving the grass a chance to grow.  Make sure to visit the bronze sculpture at the north entrance.  This is a sculpture of the buildings in the historic district.

address.streetAddress: Ave Ignacio Zarazoga, Corregidora y Constituents

650971425.name: Peaceful Oasis
650971425.author: a TripAdvisor user
650971425.reviewBody: The work on upgrading the park that I saw when I visited last year is now complete.  The Avenida Zaragoza side has been cleared of vendors and the sidewalk repaired.  There is an interesting model in brass of the historic center near the entrance.  The park paths have been nicely redone with new pavers. The green areas are being restored.  Another impressive example of urban improvements!

address.streetAddress: Ave Ignacio Zarazoga, Corregidora y Constituents

534186429.name: Peacefull
534186429.author: a TripAdvisor user
534186429.reviewBody: For a park that was created in the XIX century, it is very well-maintained. Hopefully, they pay the gardeners well.   It is also huge and so peaceful.

address.streetAddress: Ave Ignacio Zarazoga, Corregidora y Constituents

671985822.name: un buen paseo
671985822.author: a TripAdvisor user
671985822.reviewBody: si te gusta conocer este tipo de lugares, vale la pena su visita, si ya has visto otras grutas estas no hacen gran diferencia, el area adaptada para conocerlas no pasa de 30 metros, pero esta en una zona boscosa y es interesante el paseo.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Estatal 120 San Juan del Río-Xilitla

666816556.name: A comer chicharros de res
666816556.author: a TripAdvisor user
666816556.reviewBody: Los chicharrones de res, es carne cocida en la propia grasa del animal, consta de menudencias y viceras; se pueden consumir principalmente los fines de semana por la ma\u00f1ana en San Joaqu\u00edn, lugar donde se encuentran las grutas, justo afuera de las mismas pasa la carretera que nos lleva a casa de m\u00e1quinas de la hidroel\u00e9ctrica Zimap\u00e1n en el margen del Rio Moctezuma.\nSi el auto es autom\u00e1tico se recomienda bajar en velocidad1, se baja desde los 2800 m hasta los 900 msnm, no utilizar demasiado el freno, es decir despacio; por el camino en los paisajes impresionantes se encuentran otras grutas que pueden explorar,

address.streetAddress: Carretera Estatal 120 San Juan del Río-Xilitla

666022096.name: INTERESANTE
666022096.author: a TripAdvisor user
666022096.reviewBody: Esta grutas se encuentran a la entrada del pueblo m\u00e1gico de San Joaqu\u00edn y es un lugar Imperdible.\nLa entrada es en forma de caverna y ya dentro est\u00e1 dividido en diferentes salas donde se podr\u00e1n observar las estalactitas y estalacnitas con diversas im\u00e1genes seg\u00fan la imaginaci\u00f3n.\nConsidero que han hecho un buen trabajo al conservarlas y promoverla ya que es un lugar muy atractivo.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Estatal 120 San Juan del Río-Xilitla

658137357.name: Muy interesante y divertido
658137357.author: a TripAdvisor user
658137357.reviewBody: Es un lugar muy interesante, los gu\u00edas te explican muy bien, adem\u00e1s de que es seguro y est\u00e1 bien acondicionado. Tienen puestos de artesan\u00edas alrededor y palapas para quienes desean comer o convivir un buen rato, adem\u00e1s de unos columpios muy divertidos! \nEs muy f\u00e1cil es acceso ya que est\u00e1 a la entrada del pueblo de San Joaqu\u00edn.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Estatal 120 San Juan del Río-Xilitla

656177412.name: Una maravilla escondida
656177412.author: a TripAdvisor user
656177412.reviewBody: Unas impresionantes grutas se esconden en el Municipio de San Joaqu\u00edn, Quer\u00e9taro. Un lugar lleno de m\u00e1gica y formaciones incre\u00edbles; sus columnas, estalactitas y estalacmitas pondr\u00e1n a prueba tu imaginaci\u00f3n para encontrarle forma. Sin duda alguna una visita obligada ideal para ir con la familia o con tu pareja.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Estatal 120 San Juan del Río-Xilitla

651335941.name: Lugar muy interesante en San Joaqu\u00edn
651335941.author: a TripAdvisor user
651335941.reviewBody: Una interesante atracci\u00f3n tur\u00edstica para quienes visitan el Pueblo M\u00e1gico de San Joaqu\u00edn. Bien iluminadas y con buen mantenimiento. Los gu\u00edas son adecuados y el precio muy razonable. Se ubican a la entrada de San Joaqu\u00edn.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Estatal 120 San Juan del Río-Xilitla

645424241.name: Muy interesante! Vale la pena!
645424241.author: a TripAdvisor user
645424241.reviewBody: a la entrada de la carretera a San Joaqu\u00edn, son grutas muy interesantes y f\u00e1ciles de visitar, no se requiere equipo especial. Al final del pueblo de San Joaqu\u00edn est\u00e1 la zona arqueol\u00f3gica Las Ranas, muy interesante, vale la pena llegar a verlas.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Estatal 120 San Juan del Río-Xilitla

601870954.name: Experiencia al interior de una gruta extraordinaria y muy c\u00f3moda.
601870954.author: a TripAdvisor user
601870954.reviewBody: En el poco conocido municipio de San Joaqu\u00edn, Quer\u00e9taro, se puede visitar, adem\u00e1s de este antiguo pueblo minero y lleno de tradici\u00f3n guateque los sitios arqueol\u00f3gicos abiertos al p\u00fablico de Toluquilla y el de ranas. Con un extraordinario complemento que es la visita a las grutas de los Herrera.  \u00c9ste \u00faltimo lugar, muy bien se\u00f1alado, con buenas facilidades c\u00f3modo estacionamiento y un acceso extraordinario con una escalinata de concreto hacia la puerta de entrada a estas brutas extraordinarias. El interior se puede visitar con toda comodidad y seguridad, a trav\u00e9s de un sendero de concreto  con barandales de metal y una extraordinaria luz dise\u00f1ada para resaltar los atractivos de las Estalactitas y estalagmita has de este maravilloso lugar. Altamente recomendable.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Estatal 120 San Juan del Río-Xilitla

516307756.name: SORPRENDENTE CORAZ\u00d3N DE LA TIERRA
516307756.author: a TripAdvisor user
516307756.reviewBody: Hermoso lugar en medio de la Sierra Gorda, el recorrido aunque breve te permite disfrutar de la maravilla que encierra las entra\u00f1as de la Sierra, echar a andar la imaginaci\u00f3n y descubrir en las rocas formas que nos son familiares, el respirar la humedad y el fresco que emana de las rocas es algo simplemente sin igual.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Estatal 120 San Juan del Río-Xilitla

507476266.name: Aprovechando el paseo
507476266.author: a TripAdvisor user
507476266.reviewBody: Aunque el recorrido dentro de la grutas es corto, bien vale la pena visitarlas y complementar con algunos de los lugares cercanos, como las zonas arqueol\u00f3gicas.\nUna felicitaci\u00f3n a los gu\u00edas y espero sigan conservando este bello lugar.   \nPor ultimo el costo de acceso a las grutas aceptable.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Estatal 120 San Juan del Río-Xilitla

477736477.name: De pasadita
477736477.author: a TripAdvisor user
477736477.reviewBody: Muy bonito lugar para ir de paseo corto, el recorrido dura solamente unos 20 minutos pero muy recomendable, de ah\u00ed se pueden ir a la Zona de Ranas, esta a 15 min en autom\u00f3vil. La verdad vale la pena pagar mejor el recorrido tur\u00edstico que ofrecen las grutas, el bus los lleva a varios lugares y esta muy bueno para tomarse muchas fotos, es muy buena opci\u00f3n para que dejen su auto estacionado en el parque de las Grutas, el costo es aproximadamente de $50 por persona pero recorres muchos sitios.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Estatal 120 San Juan del Río-Xilitla

456212276.name: Hermoso!
456212276.author: a TripAdvisor user
456212276.reviewBody: El lugar esta muy padre, excelente opci\u00f3n para convivir con el medio ambiente, una belleza natural en todo su explendor! \n

address.streetAddress: Carretera Estatal 120 San Juan del Río-Xilitla

407193254.name: Bonitas formaciones
407193254.author: a TripAdvisor user
407193254.reviewBody:
Qué agradable lugar,tranquilo,limpio,iluminado,con letreros informativos y seguro
No hay daños todo esta cuidado y pudimos hacer recorrido solitos sin prisas de más visitantes
El encargado de entrada nos recibió amablemente y todo fue bien
Me encantaron las lozas de entrada,te llevan a imaginar cómo fue hace miles hace siglos,todo inundando y tanta vegetación hace del lugar agradable

address.streetAddress: Carretera Estatal 120 San Juan del Río-Xilitla

392678406.name: Vale la pena visitarlas.
392678406.author: a TripAdvisor user
392678406.reviewBody: Es un parque muy bonito ,justo antes de llegar al pueblo de San Joaquin. el costo es muy econ\u00f3mico y las grutas est\u00e1n muy bien , est\u00e1n muy bien iluminadas y los pasillos y escaleras al interior de las grutas esta todo muy bien hecho, no es resbaloso ni nada x el estilo, y son muy grandes el detalle es que solo son como 200 mts de recorrido ya que la caverna sigue pero en desniveles y adentro hay muchos acantilados , obviamente esto es para profesionales certificados, pero lo que es lo familiar bien vale la pena, pidan a un gu\u00eda  que por una propina les explica  y ense\u00f1a todos los secretos de la gruta, un dato muy importante es que hay una costumbre de que cierran a las 4:30 pm sea s\u00e1bado o domingo o festivo , as\u00ed es la tradici\u00f3n , asi que lleguen temprano por que esta un poco retirado de la cd. de queretaro ,el museo que hay en el pueblo tambi\u00e9n lo cierran temprano , en este pueblo todo es temprano. jejeje. tambi\u00e9n les comento que es una atraccion para ni\u00f1os y j\u00f3venes hay muchas escaleras y las personas mayores se desaniman , espero les sirva viajeros...

address.streetAddress: Carretera Estatal 120 San Juan del Río-Xilitla

391208815.name: Interesante
391208815.author: a TripAdvisor user
391208815.reviewBody: Apto para los aventureros. Fui en una excursi\u00f3n escolar y me la pas\u00e9 de lo mejor. Los gu\u00edas te explican de una forma didactica y los columpios son algo fenomenal

address.streetAddress: Carretera Estatal 120 San Juan del Río-Xilitla

374655017.name: Excelente opci\u00f3n para un domingo
374655017.author: a TripAdvisor user
374655017.reviewBody: Se encuentra a hora y media de la ciudad de Quer\u00e9taro, la carretera es espectacular pero tiene muchas curvas. La recomendaci\u00f3n es llegar temprano, disfrutar las grutas que son impresionantes, bien cuidadas  y despu\u00e9s ir a las cascadas Maravilla, Hay se\u00f1alamientos de las cascadas y estan como a 3 km antes de llegar a las grutas. Para llegar a las cascadas Maravilla hay que bajar caminando como 2 km. Ser\u00e1 un paseo muy grato, pero requerir\u00e1s de buena salud y condici\u00f3n fisica. Te recomiendo llevar un traje de ba\u00f1o abajo de tu ropa. Tambi\u00e9n llevar tenis y ropa muy comoda y ligera. En el pueblo de San JOaqu\u00edn podr\u00e1s encontrar varios lugares donde comer comida tipica de la regi\u00f3n. No lo recomiendo para quienes tienen ni\u00f1os de brazos o muy peque\u00f1os.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Estatal 120 San Juan del Río-Xilitla

349297448.name: BONITAS PERO CON UN RECORRIDO MUY CORTO
349297448.author: a TripAdvisor user
349297448.reviewBody: En general es un buena experiencia conocer las grutas a pesar de que el recorrido es corto, no nos dejan de asombrar las formas que la madre naturaleza nos regala, despu\u00e9s de visitar las grutas uno puede disfrutar de un d\u00eda de campo en las \u00e1reas verdes que est\u00e1n afuera, hay una serie de columpios r\u00fasticos y un puente colgante de aproximadamente unos 30 mts,

address.streetAddress: Carretera Estatal 120 San Juan del Río-Xilitla

323497519.name: Parada obligatoria
323497519.author: a TripAdvisor user
323497519.reviewBody: Las grutas de los Herrera es un lugar al que tienes que ir si te gusta la aventura y conocer la historia de la tierra, est\u00e1n muy bien acondicionadas, el precio de acceso es de menos de 30 pesos.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Estatal 120 San Juan del Río-Xilitla

257877472.name: Vale lo que cuesta, hermosas formaciones
257877472.author: a TripAdvisor user
257877472.reviewBody: No es muy grande pero por $25 es genial, estalactitas y de las otras dos. Lugar cuidado y con un poco de artesan\u00edas en su exterior. Chulada

address.streetAddress: Carretera Estatal 120 San Juan del Río-Xilitla

249049503.name: impresionan
249049503.author: a TripAdvisor user
249049503.reviewBody: estas grutas estan muy bien cuidadas el lugar al llegar es hermoso, hay un columpio que da hacia un avismo y las grutas adentro son enormes

address.streetAddress: Carretera Estatal 120 San Juan del Río-Xilitla

220666010.name: Parada obligada si, pero no para todos los gustos.
220666010.author: a TripAdvisor user
220666010.reviewBody:
Si eres una de esas personas que lleva varías visitas a diferentes grutas a lo largo del país, lo más probable es que en ésta ocasión la misma termine siendo un tanto decepcionante. Y no porque sea un mal lugar o termines con una mala experiencia, en realidad no se trata de nada desagradable, pero lo cierto es que existen opciones que algunos podríamos considerar como más atractivas incluso muy cerca y en la misma zona.

Yo calificaría ésta atracción como "la más accesible" que conozco en su tipo básicamente porque es muy fácil dar con ella (se encuentra a pié de carretera, nada de terracerías, empedrados o falta de señalización); los accesos son de lo mejor realizados en su tipo (la entrada amplia y segura, las escaleras perfectas, la iluminación ideal); y en cuanto a la atracción en sí, a los que gustamos de maravillarnos con la belleza de propia de la naturaleza nos dejará satisfechos.

Lo bueno. Todo está tan controlado que termina siendo perfecto para una visita de TODA la familia, incluyendo niños y adultos mayores.

Lo malo. Es demasiado "sencillo" el recorrido, sin elementos rústicos o de aventura como en Grutas Xoxafi o La Estrella o sin la grandes formaciones de Cacahuamilpa. 

Si quieres algo más rústico pero con más caprichos de la naturaleza están las grutas "La esperanza" a 11 km de "Los Herrera" tomando la primera desviación a la izquierda saliendo en dirección a Querétaro.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Estatal 120 San Juan del Río-Xilitla

219917363.name: Bien acondicionadas para grupos
219917363.author: a TripAdvisor user
219917363.reviewBody: Estas grutas est\u00e1n a la entrada a San Joaquin. Buen paseo de aventura y de imaginaci\u00f3n, limpio y bien organizado. Programate un d\u00eda de campo despu\u00e9s en el \u00e1rea anexa, donde encuentras adem\u00e1s unos fabulosos columpios donde sientes como si volaras. Otras actividades cerca ruinas arqueologicas, campismo, senderismo, vista a la sierra gorda desde este bonito pueblo t\u00edpico de monta\u00f1a donde se encuentran productos de manzana. Checa clima por posible fr\u00edo o lluvias

address.streetAddress: Carretera Estatal 120 San Juan del Río-Xilitla

166454139.name: Grutas de Los Herrera
166454139.author: a TripAdvisor user
166454139.reviewBody: Lugar incr\u00edvel, m\u00e1gico, diferente, cheio de surpresas... Grutas gigantescas, escadas, passagens secretas, caminhos estreitos, frios, \u00famidos, esculturas lindas criadas pela perfei\u00e7\u00e3o da natureza...

address.streetAddress: Carretera Estatal 120 San Juan del Río-Xilitla

162781708.name: Una buena atracci\u00f3n en Quer\u00e9taro
162781708.author: a TripAdvisor user
162781708.reviewBody: Estas formaciones geol\u00f3gicas se encuentran a unos 55 minutos pasando Cadereyta de Montes rumbo al poblado de San Joaqu\u00edn. De hecho la entrada est\u00e1 unos 500 mts antes de este pueblo. Para llegar hay que pasar entre 20-30 minutos de curvas y m\u00e1s curvas por la carretera pero bien vale la pena adem\u00e1s de que en el camino los paisajes son muy bonitos tambi\u00e9n. Como referencia para llegar, pasando la desviaci\u00f3n a Toluquilla siguen unos 300 o 500 metros m\u00e1s y ver\u00e1n la entrada al parque. Creo que la se\u00f1alizaci\u00f3n podria mejorar pero las grutas en s\u00ed est\u00e1n muy bien. El parque cuenta con ba\u00f1os limpios, una peque\u00f1a cafeter\u00eda, algunos puestos de artesan\u00edas, columpios un tanto r\u00fasticos pero funcionales y tamb\u00e9n hay lugar para quien lleve algo de comida preparada. Hay gu\u00edas que te dan el recorrido por las grutas a trav\u00e9s de escaleras y pasamanos ya instalados lo que hace el recorrido seguro y f\u00e1cil de hacer. Las formaciones son impresionantes y nuestro gu\u00eda hizo bastante amena la b\u00fasqueda de diversas "figuras" que se pueden ver en las formaciones. Tambi\u00e9n ofrecen tours que pueden incluir visitas a las ruinas de Ranas y Toluquilla. En resumen lo recomiendo mucho.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Estatal 120 San Juan del Río-Xilitla

154805688.name: Los Herrera: excitantes formaciones naturales
154805688.author: a TripAdvisor user
154805688.reviewBody:
Sitio de impresionantes formaciones geológicas, obligado para quien prepara una visita a los sitios arquelógicos de "Ranas" y "Toluquilla" en el Municipio de San Joaquín. Y también para quien realiza algún recorrido por la Ruta de las Misiones.
Estas excitantes formaciones naturales producto se encuentran acondicionadas para realizar un recorrido seguro y divertido con la familia, amigos o en solitario.
En el Municipio de San Joaquín (altitud: 2,440 msnm) hay varias Posadas para pernoctar, opciones para distintos presupuestos y exigencias.
Este punto se considera la puerta de entrada a la Sierra Gorda al oriente del del Estado de Querétaro.

http://www.de-paseo.com/SierraGorda/SitiosInteresSG/LosHerrera.htm

address.streetAddress: Carretera Estatal 120 San Juan del Río-Xilitla

150632845.name: Una visita muy ilustrativa
150632845.author: a TripAdvisor user
150632845.reviewBody: Visite en 2005 estas grutas que est\u00e1n en la sierra gorda, cerca del poblado de San Joaqu\u00edn, y son formaciones muy peculiares me gust\u00f3 mucho el recorrido.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Estatal 120 San Juan del Río-Xilitla

141188746.name: Naturaleza a todo esplendor
141188746.author: a TripAdvisor user
141188746.reviewBody: Un hermoso lugar cerca de San Joaqu\u00edn,un recorrido ameno e ideal para disfrutar en familia,hermosas formaciones rocosas hechas por la naturaleza,el hospedaje y comida se puede hacer en San Joaqu\u00edn o a media hora esta un parque llamado Aventura Park con caba\u00f1as tipo safari muy recomendable

address.streetAddress: Carretera Estatal 120 San Juan del Río-Xilitla

137274202.name: una obra de arte natural
137274202.author: a TripAdvisor user
137274202.reviewBody: Definitivamente estas grutas son una obra de arte que vale la pena visitar adem\u00e1s de probar el rico licor de manzana que venden a las afueras de las grutas y visitar las cascadas cercanas al lugar. Yo las visit\u00e9 ya dos veces y regresar\u00eda.\nLo \u00fanico malo es que se dificulta encontrar hospedaje por lo que tuvimos que manejar un buen tramo rumbo a Queretaro para dormir.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Estatal 120 San Juan del Río-Xilitla

135458127.name: Asombroso espect\u00e1culo de la naturaleza
135458127.author: a TripAdvisor user
135458127.reviewBody: Asombroso espect\u00e1culo de la naturaleza. Incre\u00edble concepto de luz y sonido.  Recorrido seguro para toda la familia.  En el Municipio de San Joaqu\u00edn. Localizado 2 kms antes de llagar a San Joaqu\u00edn. A media hora de los sitios arqueol\u00f3gicos de Ranas y Toluquilla.  San Joaqu\u00edn ofrece varios hoteles y posadas pernoctar.  A una hora de la ciudad de Quer\u00e9taro y Tequisquiapan por la carretera a Jalpan. Para desayunar se puede hacer una parada en Cadereyta.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Estatal 120 San Juan del Río-Xilitla

542264638.name: A very interesting place
542264638.author: a TripAdvisor user
542264638.reviewBody: As far as I know, this was an old factory or warehouse, I really don\'t know.However, this is a very nice place. It is like the owner only cleaned it up a little bit, painted a small section of the wall black, hang some mirrors and paints, arranged some chairs, tables, and a central kitchen. Then, he opened a restaurant with a BIG serving area. And it works perfectly. I loved this place. It is in a very nice location, a very classy neighborhood, also, get ready to see the widest variety of people, not a single person looks the same. I really liked this feature.\nAnother important thing regarding this place is the music. On Wednesdays, they have this group of jazz that combines it with Cuban Son. It is such an interesting experience. I enjoyed it a lot. The food was good too.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Industrializacion No. 4 Col. Alamos 2da Sec.

523798839.name: Interesting venue
523798839.author: a TripAdvisor user
523798839.reviewBody:
This is an interesting venue. Here you can find a nice restaurant, an auditorium, a few stores and even you can get a yoga class.

In addition, during weekends you can find a farmers market and other type of activities.

The restaurant is a great choice for the weekend

address.streetAddress: Avenida Industrializacion No. 4 Col. Alamos 2da Sec.

470306113.name: Stopped for Casual Dinner
470306113.author: a TripAdvisor user
470306113.reviewBody: Hipster ambience, decoration, waiters and dishes. Good bread or more than good for the normal Mexican restaurant.... you can even buy it. Some galleries to take a look and OPEN spaces. Several options for Vegetarians and although not cheap is not pricey.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Industrializacion No. 4 Col. Alamos 2da Sec.

547744562.name: A nice trip, particularly en route to the House of Edward James
547744562.author: a TripAdvisor user
547744562.reviewBody: The missions are all identical, more or less, and the one in Jalpan is a good place to spend the night after leaving Queretaro and visiting Bernal or Tequisquiapan.  The one in Landa is right off the highway en route to Xilitla, and one other is easy access as well, but that should do it, you really don\'t need to see all 5.  Just continue on past Xilitla to Las Pozas and the House of Edward James, for a truly unique experience.

address.streetAddress: Sierra Gorda de Queretaro Jalpan de Serra. B. juarez no. 29 col centro Jalpan de Serra, Qro.

398189620.name: Where Fray Junipero de Serra got his start
398189620.author: a TripAdvisor user
398189620.reviewBody:
Californians all know about the missions that Fr. Junipero de Serra founded in California, but before he did that he founded five in the Sierra Gorda, now a protected biosphere, and collectively the missions are a UNESCO World Heritage site.

The two we saw, in Jalpan de Serra and Concá, were beautiful, well preserved, and functioning.  We came in at the tail end of mass to one of them.  

The region itself is underdeveloped, touristically speaking, but with adequate accommodations for pocket books of all sizes, and lots of wilderness options. Despite being at 2,500 ft, Jalpan de Serra in summertime is pretty hot and steamy-- a better time of year would be in the winter.   We drove in from Guanajuato/Leon airport-- long but good roads over spectacular mountains and all sorts of terrains.

address.streetAddress: Sierra Gorda de Queretaro Jalpan de Serra. B. juarez no. 29 col centro Jalpan de Serra, Qro.

314932419.name: Great missions and culture
314932419.author: a TripAdvisor user
314932419.reviewBody: I love visiting Jalpan in Queretaro.  The town is quaint but vibrant.  The mission in the central plaza is beautiful and well taken care of.  I was there about 7 years ago and they were restoring the facade from weathering.  Having gone back this week to see it now was great.  Additionally, there are a lot of great restaurants and several decent hotels in and around Jalpan for those wishing to visit some of central Mexico outside of the larger cities.  \nAs a side note, if you take the highway about 30 minutes out towards the state of San Luis Potosi, you\'ll find another small town by the name of Conca.  The mission there is equally wonderful and very rarely visited relative to the others.  If you stand in the courtyard of the Conca mission and look across the valley, you will see the cross placed on the hilltop.  For the adventurous, you can generally climb these hills up to the cross in a number of the smaller towns.  You need to assess the safety of your environment though and obviously be very respectful of where you are.

address.streetAddress: Sierra Gorda de Queretaro Jalpan de Serra. B. juarez no. 29 col centro Jalpan de Serra, Qro.

244596820.name: Well worth the trip
244596820.author: a TripAdvisor user
244596820.reviewBody:
The Franciscan Missions are located three hours by curvy road north of Querétaro City in the Sierra Gorda region.  They date to the mid-18th century when Father Junípero Serra (the same missionary who went on to establish the missions in California, which was then still part of Mexico) journeyed on foot to the area to evangelize the inhabitants.  The facades of the churches are remarkable works of art well worth the trip.

There are five mission churches in the area – Jalpan, Landa, Tilaco, Tancoyol, and Concá – all close to one another by car.  The facades of the churches were made by native artists and reflect a mixture of Catholic and indigenous themes.  There are numerous details in the facades that require previous study to fully appreciate.  Models of the five facades can be found in the Museo Regional in Querétaro City, as well as a description of the settlement of the region.
You should plan at least an overnight stay in Jalpan to see these churches, as well as the other sights of the Sierra Gorda Queretana.

address.streetAddress: Sierra Gorda de Queretaro Jalpan de Serra. B. juarez no. 29 col centro Jalpan de Serra, Qro.

223730437.name: Marvelous facades
223730437.author: a TripAdvisor user
223730437.reviewBody: If you are at all interested in mixed indigenous and spanish art, the facades of the UNESCO buildings are well worth a visit.  You an see all five in two days if you stay in Jalpan and have a car.  Look for the tourist information boards which are often not near the site.  For example, Tancoyal is located along the highway in Laganitas,   Jalpan is about a half a block away from the mission.  These boards have a lot of information about the iconography which is often no available on site or over the internet.  The interiors are often quite simple and have been painted over the original murals over time.

address.streetAddress: Sierra Gorda de Queretaro Jalpan de Serra. B. juarez no. 29 col centro Jalpan de Serra, Qro.

221887444.name: Beautiful!!
221887444.author: a TripAdvisor user
221887444.reviewBody: Very beautiful and very large church with outstanding artwork.  First Missions in Queretaro built in the 1500\'s.

address.streetAddress: Sierra Gorda de Queretaro Jalpan de Serra. B. juarez no. 29 col centro Jalpan de Serra, Qro.

148496703.name: In search of the faith Pilgrimage
148496703.author: a TripAdvisor user
148496703.reviewBody:
Fray Junipero de Serra was a Franciscan priest in search of the salvation of the Indian Souls. Pursuing this goal he has founded several “Misions” in the mid seventeenth century: interesting churches later on converted in towns, to evangelize.

In the Sierra Gorda of Queretaro, biosphere reserve, after an interesting journey of about 4 hours’ drive with a variety of climates and therefore ecosystems, we arrived to the main city declared magic town: Jalpan de Serra. The other missions are in the surroundings: Tancoyol, Tilaco, Landa de Matamoros and Concá.

The architecture is quite interesting as well as the surroundings having among other attractions interesting “Haciendas”, encounter of cold and warm water rivers, mountains, museums, gastronomy...

The hotel infrastructure is reasonable and even charm as well as the food possibilities.

In 2003 all the “Missions” were declared World Heritage by Unesco.

If you still have time you can visit the ”Huasteca”, at San Joaquin, in Queretaro, headquarters of the annual “Huapango” Festival and a couple of interesting archeological sites: Ranas and Toluquilla. Furthermore you should adventure to the San Luis Potosí “Huasteca” area, plenty of interesting surprises deserving a whole complete article. 

Visit this region is a must.

address.streetAddress: Sierra Gorda de Queretaro Jalpan de Serra. B. juarez no. 29 col centro Jalpan de Serra, Qro.

133145082.name: 16th Century Missions
133145082.author: a TripAdvisor user
133145082.reviewBody: The Missions Francisans  are elegant old buildings, with ancient bells and towering steeples. Parking is plentiful and easy. In general they are adequately maintained. The architecture and facades are breathtaking.

address.streetAddress: Sierra Gorda de Queretaro Jalpan de Serra. B. juarez no. 29 col centro Jalpan de Serra, Qro.

130489446.name: Of all the great sights in estado de Queretaro, this is one I would skip
130489446.author: a TripAdvisor user
130489446.reviewBody: I happen to be a big fan of UNESCO World Heritage sites, which these 5 missions are designated as.  So my husband and I decided to drive up to Jalpan de Serra in our rental car to check out the missions.  After a harrowing, 3 hour drive through curvy mountain roads, we finally arrived at Jalpan de Serra.  And during the 3 hour drive, the landscape was almost completely desolate and we drove for miles and miles without seeing a single sign of human habitation.  There were only a few small towns on the way, nowhere that you could stop and eat or stay for the night.  The landscape was interesting and beautiful, but in my opinion not worth the long drive.  When we arrived at Jalpan at 8 PM, we found a choice of 3 not-so-nice hotels and no restaurants that were open.  Especially would not advise going there if you don\'t speak Spanish (which my husband does) but we didn\'t encounter anyone who spoke English.  We settled for eating at an outdoor taco stand, which was good, and I was relieved that I didn\'t get sick from eating the food, but I was quite fearful that I would.  The hotel, the Los Angeles, was cheap, but had one of the most uncomfortable beds I\'ve slept in.  In the morning, we had trouble finding breakfast ... they didn\'t even have a traditional Mexican bakery, which I\'ve seen all over Mexico.  We visited the church in the main square, which was nothing fantastic, and then stopped at a small tourist kiosk for information on the missions.  The Jalpan mission, we discovered, was the church in the middle of the town square.  Of the countless churches I\'ve visited in Mexico, trust me this was nothing special.  We then learned that the remaining 4 missions were scattered through the Sierra Gordas at driving distances ranging from 30 minutes to 2 hours away.  I said forget it, eager to get back to civilization and a decent meal.  Then of course we had a 3 hour drive back, which we did have the highlight of the Sierra Gorda experience of visiting the Cascade de Chuveye waterfall, which was peaceful and gorgeous.  All in all, I really regret spending all that time driving up there, and wish I would have used the time to visit somewhere else.

address.streetAddress: Sierra Gorda de Queretaro Jalpan de Serra. B. juarez no. 29 col centro Jalpan de Serra, Qro.

657931421.name: Beautiful ornate 17th century church
657931421.author: a TripAdvisor user

657017175.name: Church
657017175.author: a TripAdvisor user
657017175.reviewBody: If there is one thing that is not lacking in Santiago de Quer\u00e9taro it is churches!  From the huge wooden doors gracing the front to the wonderful steeple reaching to to sky - we only got to peak inside and it had some very eleborate carvings and statues encrusted in gold.  Gold everything!  Everywhere- very ornate from the early 18th and 18th centuries.  Built in 1633!!!  The architecture of this church is magnificent- very beautiful and glamorous!  Beautiful courtyard as well.

644570412.author: a TripAdvisor user
644570412.reviewBody: It is a very interesting church, part of a monastery. The church and convent of Santa Cruz was built in the 17th century. Build at the place of a historical battle that tha Spanirds won on the 25 July 1531 against the indians.

639289528.name: Incorrect location here on TripAdvisor!
639289528.author: a TripAdvisor user
639289528.reviewBody: I am not 100% mobile but trudged in the afternoon heat to the location seen on the map. It is incorrect and on the completely wrong side of town as shown. By the time I struggled back to the centro it was closed (5:30 pm). Walked 30-40 minutes for nothing.

638684101.name: Gorgeous in so many ways!
638684101.author: a TripAdvisor user
638684101.reviewBody: Though it\'s difficult to choose a favorite amongst the historical churches in Queretaro, the moment I stepped into Santa Clara I knew this was it.  It\'s interior is elaborate with beautifully carved baroque altars washed in gold leaf.  People don\'t just stop to take a photo; they tend to go in and sit for awhile to take in the beauty and silence and the spiritual atmosphere that fills this lovely old church.

It is really interesting to \u00b4just walk around and look at all the detailed Baroque handcraft. it is really Worth stepping into for a short while to walk around and imagine all the work being done here by such skilled people.

337114317.name: Different visitors may react differently

337114317.reviewBody: The extravagance of the gold-laden Mexican baroque retablos may  turn off those who do not understand the exuberant spiritualism of the period\'s Catholicism or those who wonder why such lavish art decorated a convent, but for art history buffs and devote Catholics, this interior is remarkable.

334809481.name: Different feeling from other churches

314014463.name: One of the most beautiful churches in Queretaro
314014463.author: a TripAdvisor user
314014463.reviewBody: This over 400-year-old building stands right in the middle of Queretaro downtown, in al alley that starts from the very famous (and big) Neptune fountain just off Jardin Guerrero. The church also includes a beautiful museum and a souvenir store where you can find the usual list of pictures and gadgets, although I highly recommend to take your own pictures, since I don\'t remember any "do not use Flash" notice inside the church.

311447637.name: Another must in Queretaro

260062302.name: Unbelievable!
260062302.author: a TripAdvisor user
260062302.reviewBody: This place has one of the most exquisite architecture I have ever seen. You must see it  with your own eyes to actually believe it.

address.streetAddress: Calle de Allende y Andador Madero s/n. Centro Historico.

245005633.name: Baroque masterpiece
245005633.author: a TripAdvisor user
245005633.reviewBody: This church is located behind the Jardin Guerrero in the center of the city.  It is dedicated to Saint Clare and the nuns of her order, which is the female branch of the Franciscans.  The church dates to the 17th century and is a remarkable example of the baroque style of that era.  The interior side altars are an astounding display of religious imagery covered in gold leaf.  Note the section in the rear of the nave behind the grill work, where the cloistered nuns used to attend mass separated from the general public.  If you\u2019re interested in knowing about the daily lives of the nuns, there is a display about them in the first room of the Museo de la Restauraci\u00f3n de la Rep\u00fablica around the corner on Calle Guerrero.\n\nTo the left of the church as you exit on Calle Madero, note the fountain of Neptune.  On the right, the Michoacana ice cream shop serves tasty double scoops for 20 pesos per cup.  Enjoy your treat in the seating under the trees in front of the church and watch the queretanos and visitors pass by.

address.streetAddress: Calle de Allende y Andador Madero s/n. Centro Historico.

221887249.name: Beautiful!!
221887249.author: a TripAdvisor user
221887249.reviewBody: Wonderful place to visit and pray....definitely worth long visit!\nBuilt in the 1500\'s, you can learn a lot about the history and Catholicism through the altar panels, icons, and beautiful paintings that have been restored in some cases.

address.streetAddress: Calle de Allende y Andador Madero s/n. Centro Historico.

203324488.name: Colonial Architecture
203324488.author: a TripAdvisor user
203324488.reviewBody: This colonial church is by far one of the greatest experience we had in appreciating colonial art. Many of the altars and retalbos are from the 17th century as well as the paintings. Recommend reading or getting information on the church before coming.\n\nRMS

630464500.name: Entertaining small zoo 20 minutes away from Quer\u00e9taro
630464500.author: a TripAdvisor user
630464500.reviewBody: While it is rather small (it will take you 60 minutes to complete end to end), it is a great place to take your kids to. With a cheap price of 110 pesos/adult (6 bucks), it is interesting the way they can maintain the place. One drawback for parents with toddlers or adults on wheelchairs is that one part of the run is a stony path, making it difficult to cover it. Be sure to bring cash since no credit cards are accepted.

550541551.author: a TripAdvisor user
550541551.reviewBody: We went because they place we wanted to go originally was closed.\nMy 3 years old liked it, but I didn\'t. It\'s bad maintained, animals look sad and sick. Will not be going back.

475636878.author: a TripAdvisor user
475636878.reviewBody: If you\'re used to the fancy zoos in the U.S., this may not float your boat, but it is a pleasant place for those with simple tastes to spend with their families, and the kids have fun on the train rides, riding the ponies, seeing the animals (decent variety,and nearly all were quite active the day we visited)

405486612.name: Unexpected great experience
405486612.author: a TripAdvisor user
405486612.reviewBody: We went into the ZOO like- once we are here, we must go in.\nBut the variation of the animals is good and the best is, that this zoo is not so comercion\u00e1ized like those we know from Europe. Since long time a quierd place without having the comercials of Frozen & Co al around.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Bernal _ Cadereyta Km.2.5 Marquez

260458845.name: Delightful Zoo
260458845.author: a TripAdvisor user
260458845.reviewBody: If you like seeing animals in a zoo, this is a little different than most, \nbut we found it quite pleasant. To me it was kind of like visiting a farm with zoo animals as, rather than displaying animals in cages, there were expansive areas where they could roam, often with various other species. Many animals were separated from the walkway by a low wall, tho some (tigers, lions, wolves, etc.) were \nbehind fences. You can get quite close to most of them, & unlike in many traditional zoos, most  of the animals were awake & alert, meaning good photo -ops. There are said to be 1800 animals, 250 species, from 5 continents. Our favorites were the 2 leopard cubs, born in Dec. 2014. You can get there by city bus #314 near Alameda Park, in the Historical Center.The entrance fee was inexpensive.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Bernal _ Cadereyta Km.2.5 Marquez

186292582.name: Not where Google maps takes you
186292582.author: a TripAdvisor user
186292582.reviewBody: We followed the directions provided by Google maps in the TripAdvisor app, only to end up in a residential area with no zoo to be found.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Bernal _ Cadereyta Km.2.5 Marquez

159665351.name: Experiencia regular
159665351.author: a TripAdvisor user
159665351.reviewBody:
The zoo is in the outskirts of the city of El Marquez Queretaro, 20-25 mins drive of the city of Queretaro. The place is very deserted, lacks of shades and places to rest.  The price,of the tickets is expensive compared to similar zoo's (90 pesos adults, 70 pesos children).

There are several attractions that are worth seeing, for instance feeding the giraffe was quite an experience.  There is an extra tour in a small "train", 20 pesos a ticket, the train has a speaker that tries to narrate the animals on the cages,but most of the time the narration does not match what you are seeing.  There is an useless pit that looks pretty unsafe. Bathrooms are very clean.

some of the animals don't look quite good, they don't look bad, but thy don't great like in other zoos.  There ar free peacocks that look fabulous.

The whole zoo can be walked in 2:30 to 3 hours.  Price-benefit relationship seems very bad.  I will think it twice before returning.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Bernal _ Cadereyta Km.2.5 Marquez
